original: de'i las sa bon las ni rgyu'i rkyen rnam par gzhag go zhes bya ba la sogs pa dag smos so //
analyzed: de'i las sa bon las ni rgyu'i rkyen rnam par gzhag go zhes bya ba la sogs pa dag smos so //
translated: The causal condition is posited from the perspective of the seed.

original: sa bon gyis rgyu'i rkyen ma bsdus so zhe na /
analyzed: sa bon gyis rgyu'i rkyen ma bsdus so zhe na /
translated: If you ask, “Isn’t the seed included in the causal condition?”

analyzed: bsdus te sa bon gyi gnas ni rgyu'i rkyen yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: ngo bo nyid las ni de ma thag pa'i rkyen rnam par gzhag go zhes bya ba ni phal che ba'i dbang du byas pa'i phyir te /
translated: The immediately preceding condition is posited from the perspective of the essential nature.

original: grogs kyang de yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grogs kyang de yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the immediately preceding condition is the most important condition.🔽The dominant condition is posited from the perspective of the supporting condition and so on.

original: grogs la sogs pa las ni bdag po'i rkyen rnam par gzhag go zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgra ni las kyi tshul gyis dbang du byas pa yin no //
analyzed: grogs la sogs pa las ni bdag po'i rkyen rnam par gzhag go zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgra ni las kyi tshul gyis dbang du byas pa yin no //
translated: The word “and so on” in the root text refers to the perspective of the dominant condition.

original: bdag po'i rkyen ni 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu yongs su 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag po'i rkyen ni 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu yongs su 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The dominant condition is so called because it holds the desirable and undesirable results.

original: @112b de la las ni smras zin to //
analyzed: @112b de la las ni smras zin to //
translated: The action has already been explained.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba de yang rkyen kho na yin te /
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba de yang rkyen kho na yin te /
translated: That action is virtuous or nonvirtuous in dependence on conditions.

original: skyed par byed pa'i don gyi rgyu'i don med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyed par byed pa'i don gyi rgyu'i don med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the meaning of cause as that which generates is not applicable.

original: rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two types:

original: skyes nas thob pa dang sbyor ba las byung ba'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: skyes nas thob pa dang sbyor ba las byung ba'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: that acquired at birth and that derived from practice.

original: de ni nyung ste /
analyzed: de ni nyung ste /
translated: This is too few,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ma lus pa'i phyir ro zhes /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ma lus pa'i phyir ro zhes /
translated: because it does not include the nirvāṇa without remainder.

original: 'dir thams cad bsdus pa ni ma yin gyi de ni rab tu dbye ba tsam du zad do //
analyzed: 'dir thams cad bsdus pa ni ma yin gyi de ni rab tu dbye ba tsam du zad do //
translated: Here, the enumeration is not exhaustive; it is merely a classification.

original: yang na mdo sde las gsungs pa'i rjes su smras pa yin no //
analyzed: yang na mdo sde las gsungs pa'i rjes su smras pa yin no //
translated: Or else, it is stated in accordance with the sūtras.

original: bsod nams kyi cha dang mthun pa zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu mngon par mtho ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: bsod nams kyi cha dang mthun pa zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu mngon par mtho ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: The term “conducive to merit” means that it does not have a high rebirth as its result.

original: bsod nams zhes bya ba ni sems pa dge ba'o //
analyzed: bsod nams zhes bya ba ni sems pa dge ba'o //
translated: “Merit” is virtuous volition.

original: de nyid cha yin te /
analyzed: de nyid cha yin te /
translated: That itself is a “part”

original: tshogs kyi phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshogs kyi phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is one part of the collection.

original: tshogs mtha' dag ni de dang mthun pa yin la /
analyzed: tshogs mtha' dag ni de dang mthun pa yin la /
translated: The entire collection is “conducive to that”

original: de yang de dag dang mthun pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang de dag dang mthun pa yin no //
translated: and that is conducive to them.

original: yang na bsod nams kyi 'bras bu ni bsod nams ma yin no //
analyzed: yang na bsod nams kyi 'bras bu ni bsod nams ma yin no //
translated: Or else, merit is the result of merit.

original: de'i cha dang mthun pa ni sems dang sems las byung ba rnams te /
analyzed: de'i cha dang mthun pa ni sems dang sems las byung ba rnams te /
translated: That which is compatible with it is minds and mental factors.🔽

original: de dag gis de mngon par bsgrubs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gis de mngon par bsgrubs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The factors conducive to it are the mind and mental factors because they are the actualization of that.🔽The sutra states that the eight arise from merit.

original: bsod nams las skye ba dang brgyad ces bya ba ni mdo las 'di na kha cig dge sbyong rnams dang bram ze rnams dang / bkren pa rnams dang / sdug phongs pa rnams dang / lam du zhugs pa rnams dang / slong mo pa rnams la 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bsod nams las skye ba dang brgyad ces bya ba ni mdo las 'di na kha cig dge sbyong rnams dang bram ze rnams dang / bkren pa rnams dang / sdug phongs pa rnams dang / lam du zhugs pa rnams dang / slong mo pa rnams la 'di lta ste /
translated: Here, some give to ascetics, brahmins, the poor, the destitute, those traveling on the road, and beggars.

original: zas dang / skom dang / bza' ba dang / bca' ba dang / bzhon pa dang / gos dang / phreng ba dang / spos dang / byug pa dang / rgyab rten dang / mar me'i sbyin pa dag sbyin par byed cing des mi skyed pa dag mthong na 'di snyam du kye ma bdag mi'i skyid pa rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skye bar gyur cig snyam du sems shing de la sems rten par byed pa la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: zas dang / skom dang / bza' ba dang / bca' ba dang / bzhon pa dang / gos dang / phreng ba dang / spos dang / byug pa dang / rgyab rten dang / mar me'i sbyin pa dag sbyin par byed cing des mi skyed pa dag mthong na 'di snyam du kye ma bdag mi'i skyid pa rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skye bar gyur cig snyam du sems shing de la sems rten par byed pa la sogs pa nas /
translated: He sees those who give gifts of food, drink, edibles, savories, vehicles, clothes, garlands, perfumes, ointments, cushions, and lamps, and he thinks, “Oh, may I be born with an equal share of happiness among humans.” He focuses his mind on that and so on up to:

original: lan mang du byed pa'i bar du ste /
analyzed: lan mang du byed pa'i bar du ste /
translated: he frequently does that.

original: de ni mi'i skyid pa rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skye ba'i gnas yod pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni mi'i skyid pa rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skye ba'i gnas yod pa yin no //
translated: That is the basis for being born with an equal share of happiness among humans.

original: de la mi'i skyid pa ni 'di dag yin te /🔽'di lta ste rgyal rigs shing s'a la lta bu la sogs pa dang / de lta bu'i rigs rnams su skye bar 'gyur ba'o //

translated: Here, the happiness of humans is as follows:

original: tshul khrims dang ldan pa'i sems kyi smon pa 'grub pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang ldan pa'i sems kyi smon pa 'grub pa'i phyir te /
translated: because the wish of one who possesses morality is fulfilled.

original: de yang tshul khrims dag rnams par dag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang tshul khrims dag rnams par dag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And that is because morality is pure.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa drug gi lha rnams dang / tshangs ris rnams su yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa drug gi lha rnams dang / tshangs ris rnams su yang de bzhin no //
translated: The same is true of the gods in the six heavens of the desire realm and in the heaven of Brahma.

original: @113a * // de la bye brag ni 'di yod de /
analyzed: @113a * // de la bye brag ni 'di yod de /
translated: But there is this difference.

original: tshul khrims dang ldan pa'i sems kyi smon pa 'grub pa de yang 'dod pa dag la 'dod chags dang bral ba yin te /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang ldan pa'i sems kyi smon pa 'grub pa de yang 'dod pa dag la 'dod chags dang bral ba yin te /
translated: The wish of one who possesses morality is fulfilled, and he is free from attachment to the desire realm.

original: de dag ni bsod nams las skye ba brgyad po de dag yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni bsod nams las skye ba brgyad po de dag yin no //
translated: These are the eight kinds of birth that result from merit.

original: sdug pa'i 'bras bu yongs su 'dzin pa'i don zhes bya ba ni dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: sdug pa'i 'bras bu yongs su 'dzin pa'i don zhes bya ba ni dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: The meaning of “possessing a pleasant result” is that of the wholesome with-outflows.

original: dngos po yongs su shes pa la mkhas pa de 'bras bu'i don to zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dngos po yongs su shes pa la mkhas pa de 'bras bu'i don to zhes bya ba la /
translated: The meaning of “skill in knowing things as they are” is that of the result.

original: dngos po ni de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: dngos po ni de bzhin nyid do //
translated: “Things” means thusness.

original: de yongs su shes pa ni lam mo //
analyzed: de yongs su shes pa ni lam mo //
translated: “Knowing them as they are” means the path.

original: de la mkhas pa ni sbyor ba dang rjes su thob pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: de la mkhas pa ni sbyor ba dang rjes su thob pa'i ye shes so //
translated: The wise in regard to it is the knowledge of application and of the attainment of the result.

original: de'i 'bras bu ni mya ngan las 'das pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu ni mya ngan las 'das pa yin no //
translated: Its result is nirvana.

original: de dag kyang mdor bsdu na dge ba rnams yin no //
analyzed: de dag kyang mdor bsdu na dge ba rnams yin no //
translated: And these, in brief, are the wholesome.

original: yang na dngos po de ni bden pa rnams so //
analyzed: yang na dngos po de ni bden pa rnams so //
translated: Or else, that entity is the Truths.

original: yongs su shes pa la mkhas pa nyid lam yin no //
analyzed: yongs su shes pa la mkhas pa nyid lam yin no //
translated: The wise in regard to it is the path.

original: de'i 'bras bu ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
translated: Its result is nirvana.

original: de ni bden pa bzhi mngon par rtogs pa'i dbang du byas pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni bden pa bzhi mngon par rtogs pa'i dbang du byas pa yin no //
translated: And that is in the sense of the clear comprehension of the four Truths.

original: snga ma de bzhin nyid rtogs pa'i'o //
analyzed: snga ma de bzhin nyid rtogs pa'i'o //
translated: The former is in the sense of the realization of thusness.

original: dge ba'i chos la bgegs byed par gyur pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos la bgegs byed par gyur pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The obscurations to the wholesome dharmas.

original: 'di'i mtshan nyid ni dge ba'i mtshan nyid rnam pa gnyis po ji skad smos pa dag las bzlog pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: 'di'i mtshan nyid ni dge ba'i mtshan nyid rnam pa gnyis po ji skad smos pa dag las bzlog pa'i don yin no //
translated: The characteristic of these is the opposite of the two kinds of characteristic of the wholesome as stated.

original: kha cig na re mi sdug pa'i 'bras bu yongs su 'dzin pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang bstan pa dag gis chos kyi sgrib par 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni mtshan nyid lhag pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig na re mi sdug pa'i 'bras bu yongs su 'dzin pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang bstan pa dag gis chos kyi sgrib par 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni mtshan nyid lhag pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say: The obscurations to dharmas are those that are indicated by the words “because they fully grasp the result of the unpleasant” and so on.

original: yang kha cig na re 'dir dge ba zhes bya ba ni dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa la bya'o //
analyzed: yang kha cig na re 'dir dge ba zhes bya ba ni dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa la bya'o //
translated: Others say: Here virtue refers to contaminated virtue.

original: de la bgegs byed par gyur pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa dag go /
analyzed: de la bgegs byed par gyur pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa dag go /
translated: Attachment and so on obstruct it.

original: gang dag de la bgegs byed par gyur pa de dag la ni lam gyi bgegs chen po yin no //
analyzed: gang dag de la bgegs byed par gyur pa de dag la ni lam gyi bgegs chen po yin no //
translated: Those that obstruct it are great obstacles to the path.

original: ma rig pa rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: ma rig pa rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Ignorance has two types:

original: mi dge ba la 'jug pa'i las can dang / yang dag pa'i shes pa'i bar du gcod pa'i las can no //
analyzed: mi dge ba la 'jug pa'i las can dang / yang dag pa'i shes pa'i bar du gcod pa'i las can no //
translated: the function of engaging in nonvirtue and the function of obstructing correct knowledge.

original: de la dang po ni bgegs byed par gyur pa dag gi nang du 'dus so //
analyzed: de la dang po ni bgegs byed par gyur pa dag gi nang du 'dus so //
translated: The first is included among those that obstruct.

original: cig shos ni sgrib par gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: cig shos ni sgrib par gyur pa yin no //
translated: The second is an obscuration.

original: de ni dngos po yongs su shes pa'i bar du gcod pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni dngos po yongs su shes pa'i bar du gcod pa yin te /
translated: It is an obstruction to the complete understanding of entities.

original: de'i phyir dge ba'i tshig dag las bzlog pa ni mi dge ba'i tshig rnams yin par go rims bzhin du bstan to //
analyzed: de'i phyir dge ba'i tshig dag las bzlog pa ni mi dge ba'i tshig rnams yin par go rims bzhin du bstan to //
translated: Therefore, the words “nonvirtuous” should be understood as the opposite of the words “virtuous,” respectively.

original: de lta bas na mi sdug pa'i 'bras bu yongs su 'dzin pa'i phyir ni dge ba'i chos @113b la bgegs byed par gyur pa yin la /
analyzed: de lta bas na mi sdug pa'i 'bras bu yongs su 'dzin pa'i phyir ni dge ba'i chos @113b la bgegs byed par gyur pa yin la /
translated: Thus, it is an obstruction to virtuous qualities because it causes one to grasp the result of the meditation on foulness.

original: dngos po yang dag par yongs su mi shes pa'i phyir ni bsgribs par gyur pa yin no zhes go rims bzhin du bstan to zhes zer ro //
analyzed: dngos po yang dag par yongs su mi shes pa'i phyir ni bsgribs par gyur pa yin no zhes go rims bzhin du bstan to zhes zer ro //
translated: It is an obstruction to the complete understanding of entities because it causes one to be obscured.🔽The other is indeterminate.

original: gzhan ni lung du ma bstan pa'o zhes bya ba ni tha mal pa'i 'jug cing mngon par 'du byed pa med pa'i spyod lam byed pas 'brel pa'i sems gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan ni lung du ma bstan pa'o zhes bya ba ni tha mal pa'i 'jug cing mngon par 'du byed pa med pa'i spyod lam byed pas 'brel pa'i sems gang yin pa ste /
translated: The other is a mind that is related to the ordinary activities of engagement and abidance, which are not accompanied by manifest effort.

original: gzhan dag la yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: gzhan dag la yang de bzhin no //
translated: The same is true of other minds.

original: phyag 'tshal ba la sogs pa byed pa'i spyod lam las byung ba dang / gus pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gzugs 'dri ba bzo'i gnas las byung ba'i dge ba yang yod do //
analyzed: phyag 'tshal ba la sogs pa byed pa'i spyod lam las byung ba dang / gus pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gzugs 'dri ba bzo'i gnas las byung ba'i dge ba yang yod do //
translated: the Tathagata.

original: de ni 'dir ma smos te /
analyzed: de ni 'dir ma smos te /
translated: This is not mentioned here because it is not🔽always morally neutral.

original: thams cad du lung du ma bstan pa ma yin no zhes bya ba de 'ba' zhig brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad du lung du ma bstan pa ma yin no zhes bya ba de 'ba' zhig brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is only the morally neutral nature that is intended.

original: brjod par 'dod pa de yang rang gi phyogs dag gzhan du rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pa de yang rang gi phyogs dag gzhan du rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because that is established elsewhere in our own tradition.🔽The virtue arisen from emanation is the virtue of emanations such as the

original: sprul pa byed pa las byung ba'i dge ba ni sems can rnams kyi don gyi phyir sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i sku sprul par byed pa'o //
analyzed: sprul pa byed pa las byung ba'i dge ba ni sems can rnams kyi don gyi phyir sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i sku sprul par byed pa'o //
translated: body of a buddha for the sake of sentient beings.🔽The virtue arisen from🔽harm is the virtue of the emanation of a terrifying form such as a rakshasa

original: sems can rnams la tho 'tshams pa ni phyir srin po la sogs pa 'jigs su rung ba'i gzugs sprul par byed pa nyon mongs pa can de yang yod na ji ltar zhig yod de /
analyzed: sems can rnams la tho 'tshams pa ni phyir srin po la sogs pa 'jigs su rung ba'i gzugs sprul par byed pa nyon mongs pa can de yang yod na ji ltar zhig yod de /
translated: for the sake of sentient beings. This is also afflicted. How could it be virtue?

original: de ni las byung ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni las byung ba yin no //
translated: It is arisen from karma.

original: 'dir ni ting nge 'dzin gyi 'bras bu yin par 'dod do //
analyzed: 'dir ni ting nge 'dzin gyi 'bras bu yin par 'dod do //
translated: But here it is asserted to be the result of concentration.

original: gang gi tshe rnam par smin pa las byung ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa yin no zhes kyang smras na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rnam par smin pa las byung ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa yin no zhes kyang smras na /
translated: If you maintain that the eye consciousness and so on are derived from karmic maturation,

original: ci'i phyir rnam par smin pa las byung ba yang rnam pa gsum yod do zhes mi brjod ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rnam par smin pa las byung ba yang rnam pa gsum yod do zhes mi brjod ce na /
translated: why don’t you say that the three types of consciousness derived from karmic maturation exist?

original: dngos po ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dngos po ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because they are not real things.

original: dngos po ni rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: dngos po ni rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: A real thing is the consciousness that is the result of karmic maturation.

original: 'dir ni rnam par smin pa kho na rnam par smin pa las byung ba yin par 'dod de /
analyzed: 'dir ni rnam par smin pa kho na rnam par smin pa las byung ba yin par 'dod de /
translated: Here it is asserted that only that which is the result of karmic maturation is derived from karmic maturation,

original: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it arises from the cause of karmic maturation.

original: de yang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ma gtogs par gzhan med pas de'i phyir nyes pa med do //
analyzed: de yang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ma gtogs par gzhan med pas de'i phyir nyes pa med do //
translated: And since there is no other consciousness except the storehouse consciousness, there is no error.

original: yang ni dngos po ma yin pa'i tshul gyis rnam par smin pa las byung ba rnam pa gsum yod do zhes brjod pa na yang su zhig 'gog par byed /
analyzed: yang ni dngos po ma yin pa'i tshul gyis rnam par smin pa las byung ba rnam pa gsum yod do zhes brjod pa na yang su zhig 'gog par byed /
translated: Or, if you maintain that the three types of consciousness derived from karmic maturation exist in the manner of unreal imagination, who can refute that?

original: shes rab kyi mig go zhes bya ba ni mig gi rab tu dbye ba spyir bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab kyi mig go zhes bya ba ni mig gi rab tu dbye ba spyir bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The eye of wisdom is the general classification of the eye.

original: de la brten pa ni gzugs na spyod pa'o zhes bya ba ni yun ring du gnas pa'i chos yin pa'i phyir /🔽@114a * // sdug pa zhes bya ba ni rten du 'gyur ba la bya'o //
analyzed: de la brten pa ni gzugs na spyod pa'o zhes bya ba ni yun ring du gnas pa'i chos yin pa'i phyir / @114a * // sdug pa zhes bya ba ni rten du 'gyur ba la bya'o //
translated: The eye that is based on the form realm is the eye that endures for a long time.🔽The eye that is beautiful is the eye that is the basis.

original: gnas kyi mig ces bya ba ni mig gi 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: gnas kyi mig ces bya ba ni mig gi 'bras bu ste /
translated: The eye that is the abode is the eye that is the eye-faculty.

original: 'jig rten gyi brda las kyang /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi brda las kyang /
translated: In worldly parlance,

original: khyod kyi mig ni autpala sngon po'i 'dab ma 'dra //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyod kyi mig ni autpala sngon po'i 'dab ma 'dra // zhes bya ba la sogs pa brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: it is said, “Your eye is like a blue lotus petal.”

original: sprul pa'i mig ces bya ba ni mig gi rten phyi rol gyi gzugs so //
analyzed: sprul pa'i mig ces bya ba ni mig gi rten phyi rol gyi gzugs so //
translated: The eye that is emanated is the eye that is the external form that is the basis of the eye.

original: thob pa zhes bya ba ni 'das pa dang da ltar gyi rang gi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: thob pa zhes bya ba ni 'das pa dang da ltar gyi rang gi mtshan nyid do //
translated: Obtainment is the characteristic of the past and present.

original: ma thob pa zhes bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: ma thob pa zhes bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid do //
translated: Nonobtainment is the characteristic of the future.

original: yang na thob pa dang thob pa med pa las so //
analyzed: yang na thob pa dang thob pa med pa las so //
translated: Or else, obtainment is from the possession of the eye.🔽Nonobtainment is from the nonpossession of the eye.

original: sngon ma thob pa zhes bya ba ni sngon ma byung ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: sngon ma thob pa zhes bya ba ni sngon ma byung ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: That which is called not previously obtained is that which did not exist previously.

original: de las bzlog pa ni sngon thob pa'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni sngon thob pa'o //
translated: The opposite of that is previously obtained.

original: rnam pa bcu ni med do zhes bya ba ni mdo sde dag las ma gsungs pa'i phyir ro //🔽rnam pa bcu gcig ste zhes bya ba yang mdo sde gang nas gsungs te /
analyzed: rnam pa bcu ni med do zhes bya ba ni mdo sde dag las ma gsungs pa'i phyir ro // rnam pa bcu gcig ste zhes bya ba yang mdo sde gang nas gsungs te /
translated: There are not ten types, because they are not mentioned in the sutras.🔽Where in the sutras are the eleven types mentioned?

original: de bsdu ba byas pa de bzhin du rnam pa bcu yang byar rung bar 'gyur ro zhes kha cig zer na /
analyzed: de bsdu ba byas pa de bzhin du rnam pa bcu yang byar rung bar 'gyur ro zhes kha cig zer na /
translated: Some say: It is suitable to posit ten types, just as it is suitable to posit eleven types in the Compendium of Ascertainment.

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: That is illogical.

original: bstan bcos mdzad pa de nyid ni bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung rab mtha' dag rig pa yin pas 'dir ni de tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: bstan bcos mdzad pa de nyid ni bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung rab mtha' dag rig pa yin pas 'dir ni de tshad ma yin no //
translated: The author of the treatise is omniscient with respect to the entire teaching of the Bhagavan, so here he is authoritative.

original: mig rnam pa bcu gcig ste zhes bya ba ni skye mched drug gi mdo las /
analyzed: mig rnam pa bcu gcig ste zhes bya ba ni skye mched drug gi mdo las /
translated: The Compendium of Bases mentions eleven types of eyes:

original: mig gang ci yang rung 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: mig gang ci yang rung 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
translated: Whatever eyes there are, whether of the past, future, or present.

original: de thams cad la bdag kyang med la bdag gi yang med do zhes bya bar so sor brtag par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs so //
analyzed: de thams cad la bdag kyang med la bdag gi yang med do zhes bya bar so sor brtag par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs so //
translated: One should investigate all of them in this way: “They are not self, nor do they belong to self.”🔽Thus, since the classifications of others are also seen, give up the fault of being narrow-minded.

original: de bzhin du gzhan dag gi rab tu dbye ba yang mthong ba yin gyi bdag nyid thos pa nyung ba yin pas skyon 'dogs pa thong shig / gsal ba zhes bya ba gzugs na spyod pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan dag gi rab tu dbye ba yang mthong ba yin gyi bdag nyid thos pa nyung ba yin pas skyon 'dogs pa thong shig / gsal ba zhes bya ba gzugs na spyod pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: The clear light is that of the gods of the form realm.

original: ro yod ces bya ba ni rdzus te skye ba ma yin pa rnams kyi ste /
analyzed: ro yod ces bya ba ni rdzus te skye ba ma yin pa rnams kyi ste /
translated: The presence of taste is that of those who are not born supernaturally,

original: shi nas ro snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shi nas ro snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the corpse is seen after death.

original: ro med pa zhes bya ba ni rdzus te skyes pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: ro med pa zhes bya ba ni rdzus te skyes pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: The absence of taste is that of those born supernaturally.

original: dbang po thams cad kyi rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni de la mig la sogs pa dang lhag ma yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po thams cad kyi rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni de la mig la sogs pa dang lhag ma yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it follows all the faculties, it is the opposite of the above.

original: rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: There are three kinds of intermediate beings:

original: sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa ni sems la sogs pa dag ni yid kyi skye mched du 'dus pa'i phyir de dag ni yid kho na zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa ni sems la sogs pa dag ni yid kyi skye mched du 'dus pa'i phyir de dag ni yid kho na zhes bya'o //
translated: Mind, thought, and consciousness are included in the sense-sphere of the mental faculty, and therefore they are called the mental faculty.

original: rang gi rten dang bcas par snang ba zhes bya ba ni nor bu las byung ba'i 'od gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi rten dang bcas par snang ba zhes bya ba ni nor bu las byung ba'i 'od gang yin pa'o //
translated: The light that appears together with its support is the light that comes from a gem.

original: bde bar snang ba zhes bya ba ni mig dga' bar byed pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: bde bar snang ba zhes bya ba ni mig dga' bar byed pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The light that appears as pleasant is the light that delights the eye.

original: gsal bar gnas pa'o @114b zhes bya ba ni 'od la ma ltos par dbyibs kyis rab tu phye ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gsal bar gnas pa'o @114b zhes bya ba ni 'od la ma ltos par dbyibs kyis rab tu phye ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: The light that appears as abiding is the light that is distinguished by shape without depending on light.

original: gnas su bsdu ba zhes bya ba ni khang khyim dang yang tog la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gnas su bsdu ba zhes bya ba ni khang khyim dang yang tog la sogs pa'o //
translated: The light that appears as a location is a house, a tent, and so on.

original: rnam pa bdun te /
analyzed: rnam pa bdun te /
translated: There are seven kinds of light.

original: yongs su bzung ba rnam pa bdun po dag gi bye brag gis so zhes bya ba ni bdag dang pha ma la sogs pa gong du smos pa dag gi'o //
analyzed: yongs su bzung ba rnam pa bdun po dag gi bye brag gis so zhes bya ba ni bdag dang pha ma la sogs pa gong du smos pa dag gi'o //
translated: The seven kinds of light are distinguished by the seven kinds of objects that are grasped, that is, by the objects that were mentioned above, such as the self, parents, and so on.

original: rnam pa bcu ste /
analyzed: rnam pa bcu ste /
translated: There are ten kinds of light.

original: yo byad bcu po rnams so zhes bya ba ni zas la sogs pa gong du smos pa dag go //
analyzed: yo byad bcu po rnams so zhes bya ba ni zas la sogs pa gong du smos pa dag go //
translated: The ten requisites are the previously mentioned food, etc.

original: bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa zhes bya ba ni tshangs pa'i 'jig rten gyi ste /
analyzed: bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa zhes bya ba ni tshangs pa'i 'jig rten gyi ste /
translated: The obscured neutral is in the Brahma world.

original: de ni mi dge bar nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni mi dge bar nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that is definitely not virtuous.

original: sil snyan gyi rnam pa lnga bsdus pa ste zhes bya ba ni kun du bsgrengs dang / rnam par brgyud pa dang ; kun tu bsgrengs shing rnam par brgyus pa dang / sdug po dang / sbubs can no //
analyzed: sil snyan gyi rnam pa lnga bsdus pa ste zhes bya ba ni kun du bsgrengs dang / rnam par brgyud pa dang ; kun tu bsgrengs shing rnam par brgyus pa dang / sdug po dang / sbubs can no //
translated: The five types of musical instruments are the drum, flute, stringed instrument, cymbals, and singing.

original: sil snyan gyi sgra de yang gang dag gis lhan cig tu nye bar sbyor ba dang ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de ston to //
analyzed: sil snyan gyi sgra de yang gang dag gis lhan cig tu nye bar sbyor ba dang ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de ston to //
translated: The sound of musical instruments is taught by the nature of those that are applied together.

original: 'di lta ste 'jam pa la sogs pa rnams la'o zhes bya ba la /🔽mchod pa dang ltung ba'i 'dus te reg pa lci ba nyid dang yang ba nyid la'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste 'jam pa la sogs pa rnams la'o zhes bya ba la / mchod pa dang ltung ba'i 'dus te reg pa lci ba nyid dang yang ba nyid la'o //
translated: For example, softness, etc.🔽The heaviness and lightness of the contact of worship and falling down.

original: byug nom gyi 'dus te reg pa ni 'jam pa nyid dang rtsub pa nyid la'o //
analyzed: byug nom gyi 'dus te reg pa ni 'jam pa nyid dang rtsub pa nyid la'o //
translated: The smoothness and roughness of the contact of anointing.

original: lus 'gyur ba'i 'dus te reg pa ni grang ba nas bzung ste /
analyzed: lus 'gyur ba'i 'dus te reg pa ni grang ba nas bzung ste /
translated: Contact that is a transformation of the body is from cold to heat.🔽

original: mdangs bzang ba zhes bya ba'i bar dag la'o //
analyzed: mdangs bzang ba zhes bya ba'i bar dag la'o //
translated: The contact that is a transformation of the body is from cold up to good complexion.

original: 'thob pa zhes bya ba ni sa bon ma nyams pa dang yongs su brtas pa'o //
analyzed: 'thob pa zhes bya ba ni sa bon ma nyams pa dang yongs su brtas pa'o //
translated: Obtaining is the non-degeneration and growth of seeds.

original: srog gi dbang po zhes bya ba ni las nges par rnam par smin pa gnas pa'i dus kyi 'phen pa'o //
analyzed: srog gi dbang po zhes bya ba ni las nges par rnam par smin pa gnas pa'i dus kyi 'phen pa'o //
translated: The faculty of life is the projection of the time of remaining of the definite ripening of karma.

original: rigs mthun pa zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams kyi rigs dang rang bzhin dang skye gnas la sogs pa 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: rigs mthun pa zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams kyi rigs dang rang bzhin dang skye gnas la sogs pa 'dra ba'o //
translated: Homogeneity is the similarity of type, nature, birth, and so on of sentient beings.

original: so so'i skye bo nyid ces bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam gyi sa bon yang dag par ma bcom pa'o //🔽ming gi tshogs rnams zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid du btags pa las brtsams nas ji ltar brdar byas pa'i sgra rnams te /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo nyid ces bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam gyi sa bon yang dag par ma bcom pa'o // ming gi tshogs rnams zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid du btags pa las brtsams nas ji ltar brdar byas pa'i sgra rnams te /
translated: The state of an ordinary being is the non-destruction of the seeds of the path of seeing.

original: gzugs dang bum pa lta bu dag go //
analyzed: gzugs dang bum pa lta bu dag go //
translated: The collection of names is the sounds that are conventionally designated as entities, such as form and pot.

original: tshig gi tshogs rnams zhes bya ba ni de nyid kyi ngo bo nyid las btags pa'i yon tan dang skyon la sogs pa rnam par 'jog par byad pa'i sgra rnams so //
analyzed: tshig gi tshogs rnams zhes bya ba ni de nyid kyi ngo bo nyid las btags pa'i yon tan dang skyon la sogs pa rnam par 'jog par byad pa'i sgra rnams so //
translated: The collection of words is the collection of sounds that are used to posit the qualities and faults that are imputed from the nature of those words.

original: yi ge'i tshogs rnams zhes bya ba ni de dag la brten nas brjod pa rnams so //
analyzed: yi ge'i tshogs rnams zhes bya ba ni de dag la brten nas brjod pa rnams so //
translated: The collection of syllables is the collection of letters that are based on those words.

original: 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i rgyun no //
analyzed: 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i rgyun no //
translated: The continuum is the stream of causes and effects.

original: so sor nges pa zhes bya ba ni chos rnams kyi rgyu dang 'bras bu ma tshol ba'o //
analyzed: so sor nges pa zhes bya ba ni chos rnams kyi rgyu dang 'bras bu ma tshol ba'o //
translated: The individual is the non-investigation of the causes and effects of phenomena.

original: 'byor pa 'brel ba zhes bya ba ni thabs so //
analyzed: 'byor pa 'brel ba zhes bya ba ni thabs so //
translated: The connection is the method.

original: mgyogs pa zhes bya ba ni myur ba'i @115a * //
analyzed: mgyogs pa zhes bya ba ni myur ba'i @115a * //
translated: The speed is the swiftness of the continuum.

original: rnam pa'o // go rims zhes bya ba ni chos rnams rim gyis 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa'o // go rims zhes bya ba ni chos rnams rim gyis 'jug pa'o //
translated: The order is the sequential engagement of phenomena.

original: dus zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba dang 'jig pa'i dbang du byas nas mtshams yongs su gcod pa'o //
analyzed: dus zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba dang 'jig pa'i dbang du byas nas mtshams yongs su gcod pa'o //
translated: Time is the division of the periods based on the arising and destruction of the world.

original: yul zhes bya ba ni phyogs kyi mtshams yongs su gcod par byed pa'i gzugs gnas pa'o //
analyzed: yul zhes bya ba ni phyogs kyi mtshams yongs su gcod par byed pa'i gzugs gnas pa'o //
translated: Place is the form that divides the directions.

original: grangs zhes bya ba ni chos bgrang ba rnams kyi ji snyed yod pa'o //
analyzed: grangs zhes bya ba ni chos bgrang ba rnams kyi ji snyed yod pa'o //
translated: Number is the quantity of enumerated things.

original: tshogs pa zhes bya ba ni rkyen mtha' dag phrad pa'o //
analyzed: tshogs pa zhes bya ba ni rkyen mtha' dag phrad pa'o //
translated: Collection is the totality of conditions.

original: tshogs pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni de las bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: tshogs pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni de las bzlog pa'o //
translated: Non-collection is the opposite of that.

original: lhag ma rnams ni chos mngon pa kun las btus pa la sogs pa dag las 'byung ba dang mtshan nyid 'dra'o //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni chos mngon pa kun las btus pa la sogs pa dag las 'byung ba dang mtshan nyid 'dra'o //
translated: The remaining terms are the same as those found in the Abhidharmasamuccaya and so on.

original: bye brag ni brjod par bya ste ;🔽'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni 'dir bskyed par bya ba nyid de /
analyzed: bye brag ni brjod par bya ste ; 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni 'dir bskyed par bya ba nyid de /
translated: The specific characteristics of these terms should be explained.

original: 'di dang gzugs kyi khams su mngon sum du bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di dang gzugs kyi khams su mngon sum du bya ba yin no //
translated: The meditative attainment of cessation is that which is to be generated here, and it is manifested in the realm of form.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa rnam par gzhag na ni gzugs med pa rnams na yang yod do //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa rnam par gzhag na ni gzugs med pa rnams na yang yod do //
translated: If the foundation consciousness is posited, then it exists in the formless realm as well.

original: gal te ldan pa ma yin pa de dag gi rang gi mtshan nyid ci yang med pa yin na ci'i phyir de dag rnam par gzhag ce na /
analyzed: gal te ldan pa ma yin pa de dag gi rang gi mtshan nyid ci yang med pa yin na ci'i phyir de dag rnam par gzhag ce na /
translated: If these non-psychophysical forms have no specific characteristics at all, why are they posited?

original: mdo sde dag las de dag kun tu tha snyad btags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdo sde dag las de dag kun tu tha snyad btags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are designated as conventions in the sutras.

original: mdo sde las gang zag 'di ni dge ba'i chos rnams dang mi dge ba'i chos rnams dang ldan pa yin no zhes gsungs pa yod pa de ni sa bon las dgongs te gsungs pa yin no ;
analyzed: mdo sde las gang zag 'di ni dge ba'i chos rnams dang mi dge ba'i chos rnams dang ldan pa yin no zhes gsungs pa yod pa de ni sa bon las dgongs te gsungs pa yin no ;
translated: The sutras state that this person possesses virtuous and nonvirtuous phenomena, but this is stated from the perspective of seeds.

original: / de ltar ci mngon zhe na de'i phyir mdo sde las dge ba'i sems dang ldan pa la sa bon med na ji ltar mi dge ba rnams dang ldan par 'gyur ba zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / de ltar ci mngon zhe na de'i phyir mdo sde las dge ba'i sems dang ldan pa la sa bon med na ji ltar mi dge ba rnams dang ldan par 'gyur ba zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Why is that? Because the sutras state that if a virtuous mind exists, how could nonvirtuous seeds exist?

original: gzhan dag 'og nas rgya cher dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag 'og nas rgya cher dgod par bya'o //
translated: Others will be extensively cited later.

original: gal te mdo sde dag las kun tu tha snyad btags pa de dag rnam par gzhag na 'du ba la sogs pa de dag kyang ci'i phyir ma gsungs te /
analyzed: gal te mdo sde dag las kun tu tha snyad btags pa de dag rnam par gzhag na 'du ba la sogs pa de dag kyang ci'i phyir ma gsungs te /
translated: If those conventions are posited from the perspective of the sutras, why are those such as contact not stated?🔽For example, the sutras state:🔽Contact is the convergence of three.

original: 'di ltar mdo sde las gzhan du ba'i 'du ba la dang 'bral ba yang ni de bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ltar mdo sde las gzhan du ba'i 'du ba la dang 'bral ba yang ni de bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so zhe na /
translated: Separation is also like that.

original: gsungs su zin kyang 'gal ba ci yang med do //
analyzed: gsungs su zin kyang 'gal ba ci yang med do //
translated: But there is no contradiction at all.

original: 'o na ci'i phyir de tsam zhig gsungs shing ci'i phyir btags pa yod pa yin par 'dod ce na /
analyzed: 'o na ci'i phyir de tsam zhig gsungs shing ci'i phyir btags pa yod pa yin par 'dod ce na /
translated: Why did the Lord teach only those three natures? Why did he teach that the other two natures exist only as designations?

original: de gnyis ni yid kyis rnam par gtan la dbab pa nas brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de gnyis ni yid kyis rnam par gtan la dbab pa nas brjod par bya'o //
translated: Those two will be discussed in the Investigation of Mind.

original: mi g-yo ba zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan bzhi pa la bde ba dang sdug bsngal 'gag pa'o //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan bzhi pa la bde ba dang sdug bsngal 'gag pa'o //
translated: The “immovable” is the fourth meditation, where pleasure and pain cease.

original: 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa'o zhes bya ba ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i rnam par @115b shes pa 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa'o zhes bya ba ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i rnam par @115b shes pa 'gog pa'o //
translated: The cessation of discriminations and feelings is the cessation of the consciousness of meditative absorption.

original: de dag ni brgyad las kyang drug tu 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid gsum po dag ma phye na'o //
analyzed: de dag ni brgyad las kyang drug tu 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid gsum po dag ma phye na'o //
translated: Those three natures are included in the eight categories, but they are not the same as the eight.

original: gzugs can ma yin pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa dgag pa'i chos su bsdus pa zhes bya ba ni gzugs nyid tsam dgag pa'i phyir gzugs can ma yin pa zhes bya bar zad kyi /
analyzed: gzugs can ma yin pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa dgag pa'i chos su bsdus pa zhes bya ba ni gzugs nyid tsam dgag pa'i phyir gzugs can ma yin pa zhes bya bar zad kyi /
translated: The “unreal” is included in the category of dharmas that are neither material nor mental, because it is merely the negation of material form.

original: 'di ltar ldan pa ma yin pa ni gzugs la sogs pa'i bye brag dag la mtshan nyid gnyi gar yang mi dgag go //
analyzed: 'di ltar ldan pa ma yin pa ni gzugs la sogs pa'i bye brag dag la mtshan nyid gnyi gar yang mi dgag go //
translated: Thus, the two characteristics are not denied in the particularities of form, etc.

original: rnam pa dgu ste /
analyzed: rnam pa dgu ste /
translated: There are nine types of unconditioned things:

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa la sogs pa'i bye brag gis so zhes bya ba ni nang dang phyi gnyi ga ma gtogs pa rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i chos dang de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa la sogs pa'i bye brag gis so zhes bya ba ni nang dang phyi gnyi ga ma gtogs pa rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i chos dang de bzhin nyid do //
translated: space and the two cessations, because of the differences of past, future, etc.

original: rnam pa bcu ni rnam pa bcu'i phyir te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rnam pa bcu ni rnam pa bcu'i phyir te zhes bya ba la /
translated: There are ten types of the element of mental objects because of the ten types of mental objects.

original: chos kyi khams rnam pa bcu ni gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / sems pa rnams gcig tu byas pa dang / ldan pa ma yin pa'i tshig rnams gcig tu byas pa dang / nam mkha' dang so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa dang /
analyzed: chos kyi khams rnam pa bcu ni gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / sems pa rnams gcig tu byas pa dang / ldan pa ma yin pa'i tshig rnams gcig tu byas pa dang / nam mkha' dang so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa dang /
translated: The ten types of the element of mental objects are the five aggregates of form, feeling, conception, co-efficient, and consciousness, taken separately; the unassociated formative forces, taken separately; space; and analytical and non-analytical cessations.

original: so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa dang / de bzhin nyid gsum dang / mi g-yo ba dang / 'du shes dang / tshor ba 'gog pa rnams te go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa dang / de bzhin nyid gsum dang / mi g-yo ba dang / 'du shes dang / tshor ba 'gog pa rnams te go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: the cessation of ideation and sensation.

original: mi rtag pa dang ma bral ba'i don zhes bya ba ni chos gang rkyen ma tshang bas ma byung ba de dang 'dra ba'i tshogs pa la brten nas 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: mi rtag pa dang ma bral ba'i don zhes bya ba ni chos gang rkyen ma tshang bas ma byung ba de dang 'dra ba'i tshogs pa la brten nas 'byung ba ste /
translated: The meaning of “not being separated from impermanence” is that any dharma which does not arise due to the incompleteness of conditions, arises in dependence on the collection of causes and conditions which are similar to it.

original: de'i phyir mi rtag pa dang ma bral ba'i ngo bo nyid ni so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir mi rtag pa dang ma bral ba'i ngo bo nyid ni so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the essential nature of “not being separated from impermanence” is non-analytical cessation.

original: tshor ba dang bral ba ma yin pa'i don zhes bya ba ni btang snyoms yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshor ba dang bral ba ma yin pa'i don zhes bya ba ni btang snyoms yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The meaning of “not being separated from sensation” is because equanimity exists.

original: 'di la grag pa rnams dmigs shing 'di la grag pa rnams dmigs pas na rna ba'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'di la grag pa rnams dmigs shing 'di la grag pa rnams dmigs pas na rna ba'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The ear is so called because it is the objective support of sounds and because sounds are its objective support.

original: grag pa rnams zhes bya ba ni skye bo brjod pa'o //
analyzed: grag pa rnams zhes bya ba ni skye bo brjod pa'o //
translated: “Sounds” refers to the speech of people.

original: lus 'di ni dbang po zad par gyi rjes su song bas na lus so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lus 'di ni dbang po zad par gyi rjes su song bas na lus so zhes bya ba la /

original: lus zhes bya ba ni bsags pa'o //
analyzed: lus zhes bya ba ni bsags pa'o //
translated: The word “body” means a collection.🔽For a long time, fools have fabricated it, protected it, and clung to it as their own.

original: yun ring po nas 'di byis pa rnams kyis bcos shing bsrungs la bdag gir gzung ste zhes bya ba'i tshig rnams ni byi dor bya ba'i phyir ba dang ; gnod pa las yongs su bsrung ba'i phyir ba dang / 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yun ring po nas 'di byis pa rnams kyis bcos shing bsrungs la bdag gir gzung ste zhes bya ba'i tshig rnams ni byi dor bya ba'i phyir ba dang ; gnod pa las yongs su bsrung ba'i phyir ba dang / 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The words “fabricated” and so on refer to the body’s being an object of adornment, of protection from harm, and of the view of the transitory collection.

original: yul de dang der brtag par bya bar rung ba dang zhes bya ba ni yul la sogs par brtag tu rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul de dang der brtag par bya bar rung ba dang zhes bya ba ni yul la sogs par brtag tu rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is an object that can be examined in this and that way, because it can be examined in terms of its location and so on.

original: skye ba la zhes bya ba ni yul mnan nas 'byung ba'o //🔽'di la smra ba sna @116a * //
analyzed: skye ba la zhes bya ba ni yul mnan nas 'byung ba'o // 'di la smra ba sna @116a * //
translated: It is produced by the union of the parents, because it arises from the union of the parents.

original: tshogs gnas pas de'i phyir smra ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: tshogs gnas pas de'i phyir smra ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is called a body because it is the abode of various verbal expressions.

original: gnas pa zhes bya ba ni so sor gnas pa'o //
analyzed: gnas pa zhes bya ba ni so sor gnas pa'o //
translated: The word “abode” means a place where something is located.

analyzed: yang gcig tu na lta ba drug yongs su shes par bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: Or else, in order to understand the six views:

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / gtso bor lta ba dang / longs spyod gnyis kyi rgyu ba dag yin par lta ba dang / yongs su 'gyur bar byed pa po yin par lta ba dang bdag rang dbang yin par lta ba dang / chos bdag po med par 'jug par lta ba yongs su shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //

translated: the view of the transitory aggregates, the view of the supremacy of wrong doctrines, the view of the cause of the two kinds of enjoyment, the view of the agent who experiences transformation, the view of the self as independent, and the view of the self as the master of things.

analyzed: sangs rgyas bka' dngos po dgu yang bsdus par rig par bya ste zhes bya ba la / sangs rgyas kyi bka' dngos po dgu ni phung po'i rgyud du gtogs pa las phung po gcig go //
translated: The Buddha’s word is also included in the nine categories.

original: skye mched drug las kyang gcig go //
analyzed: skye mched drug las kyang gcig go //
translated: The Buddha’s word is included in the nine categories: one category is included in the aggregates, one in the six sense-spheres,🔽one in the four elements,

original: bzhi dang ldan pa las ni dngos po bzhi'o //
analyzed: bzhi dang ldan pa las ni dngos po bzhi'o //
translated: and four are included in the four elements.

original: nyan thos kyi bshad pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa las kyang gcig go //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi bshad pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa las kyang gcig go //
translated: One is included in the explanations of the Sravakas, and one is included in the explanations of the Lord.

original: lam gyi sde chen las ni dngos po gnyis te /
analyzed: lam gyi sde chen las ni dngos po gnyis te /
translated: The Great Path of Accumulation Sūtra mentions two things:

original: de dag kyang go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: de dag kyang go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: and these are to be connected respectively.🔽The enjoyments of the retinue are the eight retinue enjoyments.

original: 'khor gyi longs spyod ni 'khor brgyad de zhes bya ba la 'khor brgyad po dag ni gtso bo rnam pa lnga'i phyir rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: 'khor gyi longs spyod ni 'khor brgyad de zhes bya ba la 'khor brgyad po dag ni gtso bo rnam pa lnga'i phyir rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: The eight retinue enjoyments are established as the five principal types:

original: rigs pa dang / nor dang / dka' thub dang / longs spyod dang / de la 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir ro ;🔽/ de la rigs ni res 'ga' ni 'jig rten na rgyal rigs btsun par byed /
analyzed: rigs pa dang / nor dang / dka' thub dang / longs spyod dang / de la 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir ro ; / de la rigs ni res 'ga' ni 'jig rten na rgyal rigs btsun par byed /
translated: the family, wealth, asceticism, enjoyments, and freedom from attachment.

original: res 'ga' ni bram ze btsun par byed pa'i phyir rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: res 'ga' ni bram ze btsun par byed pa'i phyir rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: The family is twofold: sometimes the kṣatriya family is honored in the world, and sometimes the brahmin family is honored.

original: nor ni khyim bdag go //
analyzed: nor ni khyim bdag go //
translated: Wealth is the householder.

original: dka' thub ni dge sbyong ngo //
analyzed: dka' thub ni dge sbyong ngo //
translated: Asceticism is the ascetic.

original: longs spyod ni sa'i steng dang / rtse mo dang / gzhal med khang dag na gnas pa rnams kyi mchog yin pa'i @116b phyir rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: longs spyod ni sa'i steng dang / rtse mo dang / gzhal med khang dag na gnas pa rnams kyi mchog yin pa'i @116b phyir rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: Enjoyments are threefold: the enjoyments of those who live on the earth, the enjoyments of those who live on the peak of Mt.🔽Meru, and the enjoyments of those who live in the celestial palaces.

original: de la 'dod chags dang bral ba ni tshangs pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'dod chags dang bral ba ni tshangs pa'o //
translated: Freedom from attachment is Brahmā.

original: 'dus pa dang ni tshogs rnams dang // dus dang mtshan nyid rkyen rnams dang // dge ba la sogs rab dbye dang // mkhas pa dngos po tha ma yin //
analyzed: 'dus pa dang ni tshogs rnams dang // dus dang mtshan nyid rkyen rnams dang // dge ba la sogs rab dbye dang // mkhas pa dngos po tha ma yin //
translated: the classification of virtue and so on, and the learned are the final topic.

original: zhes bya ba ni sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa yin te /
translated: This is the verse summary.

original: gzhung las de la re zhig gzugs 'dus pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / de la sems dang sems las byung ba'i tshogs la zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / de la dus gsum rnam par gzhag pa ji lta bu yin zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang /
analyzed: gzhung las de la re zhig gzugs 'dus pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / de la sems dang sems las byung ba'i tshogs la zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / de la dus gsum rnam par gzhag pa ji lta bu yin zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang /
translated: The treatise itself begins with the line, Form is the aggregation of subtle particles and so on, the line, The collection of minds and mental factors and so on, the line, How are the three times posited and so on, and the line, The classification of virtue and so on.

original: skye ba dang rga ba dang gnas pa dang / mi rtag pa nyid ji ltar rnam par gzhag ce na zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / rkyen ni bzhi ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa zhes gang bstan pa la de dag gi rab tu dbye ba gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang /

translated: What is the classification of virtue, nonvirtue, and neutral states?

original: de la rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug gi chos lnga po ngo bo nyid dang gnas dang dmigs pa dang grogs dang las 'di dag gis ni phung po la mkhas pa yang bsdus par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa rnams dang go rims
analyzed: de la rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug gi chos lnga po ngo bo nyid dang gnas dang dmigs pa dang grogs dang las 'di dag gis ni phung po la mkhas pa yang bsdus par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa rnams dang go rims
translated: In this regard, the five dharmas of the six collections of consciousness, their natures, bases, objects, companions, and actions should be understood as including expertise in the aggregates.

original: bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: These should be applied in order.

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las yid kyis rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las yid kyis rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
