original: lces ldag pa zhes bya ba ni lces yang dang yang du mchu gnyis la bldag par @120b byed pa'o //
analyzed: lces ldag pa zhes bya ba ni lces yang dang yang du mchu gnyis la bldag par @120b byed pa'o //
translated: “One with a goiter the size of a pot is a butcher of pigs.”🔽“One with a goiter the size of a pot is a butcher of pigs

original: dri nga ba zhes bya ba ni sha rlon la sogs pa'i dri'o //
analyzed: dri nga ba zhes bya ba ni sha rlon la sogs pa'i dri'o //
translated: Foul smell refers to the smell of raw flesh, etc.🔽The suffering of poverty is experienced by sentient beings born as humans.

original: de la mir skyes pa'i sems can rnams ni phongs pa'i sdug bsngal 'di lta bu myong bar 'gyur ba ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni zas dang skom la sogs pa'i sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa las bzlog pa rnams dang go rims bzhin du sbyar ro🔽// lha'i bu mo rnams pas lha ma ma yin gyi bu mo rnams mchog yin pa dang / lha ma yin rnams la yang lha rnams kyi bdud rtsi mchog yin pa'i phyir de la lha ma yin gyi bu mo de dag gi phyir lha ma yin rnams dang 'grogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la mir skyes pa'i sems can rnams ni phongs pa'i sdug bsngal 'di lta bu myong bar 'gyur ba ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni zas dang skom la sogs pa'i sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa las bzlog pa rnams dang go rims bzhin du sbyar ro // lha'i bu mo rnams pas lha ma ma yin gyi bu mo rnams mchog yin pa dang / lha ma yin rnams la yang lha rnams kyi bdud rtsi mchog yin pa'i phyir de la lha ma yin gyi bu mo de dag gi phyir lha ma yin rnams dang 'grogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: The rest is as above, in reverse order, from the giving of food and drink, etc.🔽The asura daughters are superior to the celestial daughters.🔽The asuras are superior to the gods in nectar.🔽The asuras associate with the gods for the sake of the asura daughters and for the sake of the four types of nectar.

original: lha ma yin rnams ni bdud rtsi rnam pa bzhi'i phyir lha rnams dang 'grogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: lha ma yin rnams ni bdud rtsi rnam pa bzhi'i phyir lha rnams dang 'grogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The gods associate with the asuras for the sake of the four types of nectar.

original: bdud rtsi rnam pa bzhi zhes bya ba ni kha dog sngon po la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: bdud rtsi rnam pa bzhi zhes bya ba ni kha dog sngon po la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: The four kinds of nectar are the colors blue, etc.

original: de'i phyir / ched 'ga' mdo gzhan kha cig las 'gro ba tha dad pa'i bstan pas bstan to zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa la sogs pa dag las so //
analyzed: de'i phyir / ched 'ga' mdo gzhan kha cig las 'gro ba tha dad pa'i bstan pas bstan to zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa la sogs pa dag las so //
translated: Therefore, in some other sutras, the Buddha taught that there are different kinds of beings, i.e., in the Sutra of the Heap of Jewels, etc.

original: de dag ni lha nyid yin zhes bya ba de la btsun pa 'dus bzangs ni de dag la bden pa mngon par rtogs pa mi 'byung ba dang / mi ma yin pa'i 'gro bar bsdus pa'i phyir yi dags yin par nges so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de dag ni lha nyid yin zhes bya ba de la btsun pa 'dus bzangs ni de dag la bden pa mngon par rtogs pa mi 'byung ba dang / mi ma yin pa'i 'gro bar bsdus pa'i phyir yi dags yin par nges so zhes zer ro //
translated: Bhadanta Dharmasubhuti says that they are ghosts, because they do not realize the truth and are included in the class of non-human beings.

original: de la phal cher gtan tshigs ma nges pa de dag gi tha snyad 'dogs pa yin te /
analyzed: de la phal cher gtan tshigs ma nges pa de dag gi tha snyad 'dogs pa yin te /
translated: The reason is inconclusive, because the term ghost is applied to them in the sense that they are mostly ghosts.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa dag dang / byang gi sgra mi snyan dag na bden pa mngon par rtogs pa med kyang yi dags nyid med do //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa dag dang / byang gi sgra mi snyan dag na bden pa mngon par rtogs pa med kyang yi dags nyid med do //
translated: The truth is not realized in the form and formless realms, and in Uttarakuru, but ghosts do not exist there.

original: gal te mi las gzhan pa mi ma yin pa la dgag pa brjod pa ni gtan tshigs ma nges pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te mi las gzhan pa mi ma yin pa la dgag pa brjod pa ni gtan tshigs ma nges pa yin no //
translated: If the negation is stated with respect to non-humans, other than humans, the reason is not established.

original: gal te 'gal ba la ni de'i tshe ma grub pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te 'gal ba la ni de'i tshe ma grub pa yin te /
translated: If it is contradictory, then it is not established.

original: mdo sde gang las kyang lha ma yin no zhes ni gsungs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mdo sde gang las kyang lha ma yin no zhes ni gsungs pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is stated in no sūtra that they are not gods.

original: mdo sde las bcom ldan 'das kyi mngon sum du dbang po btsun pa 'di dag ni sngon nas lha lags so zhes ji skad gsol ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdo sde las bcom ldan 'das kyi mngon sum du dbang po btsun pa 'di dag ni sngon nas lha lags so zhes ji skad gsol ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said in the sūtra, “Blessed One, these powerful gods have been gods from the beginning.”

original: de ni drang ba yang ma yin te /🔽mdo sde gang gi stobs kyis de drang bar gyur /
analyzed: de ni drang ba yang ma yin te / mdo sde gang gi stobs kyis de drang bar gyur /
translated: That is not correct,🔽because by the power of which sūtra would that be interpreted?

original: gal te rjes su dpag pa'i stobs kyis so zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rjes su dpag pa'i stobs kyis so zhe na /
translated: If by the power of inference,

original: 'di nyid la yang rjes su dpag pa lo legs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di nyid la yang rjes su dpag pa lo legs pa yin no //
translated: then inference is better.

original: thags zangs ris ni yi dags ma yin te /
analyzed: thags zangs ris ni yi dags ma yin te /
translated: Vṛtra is not a hungry ghost.

original: bdud rtsi zil pa'i phyir dang / lha mo rnams la longs spyod par byed pa'i phyir ba dang / lha rnams kyis de dag gi bu mo dag yongs su longs spyad pa'i phyir ba dang / sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha'i bu la sogs pa kha cig zil gyis @121a * //
analyzed: bdud rtsi zil pa'i phyir dang / lha mo rnams la longs spyod par byed pa'i phyir ba dang / lha rnams kyis de dag gi bu mo dag yongs su longs spyad pa'i phyir ba dang / sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha'i bu la sogs pa kha cig zil gyis @121a * //
translated: Because they are the abode of the nectar of immortality, because they enjoy goddesses, because the gods enjoy their daughters, because they surpass the gods of the Thirty-three and so on,

original: gnon pa'i phyir ba dang / de dag 'joms par byed pa'i phyir ba dang / de dag gi yongs su spyad pa bdag gir byed pa'i phyir ba dang / de dang sum cu rtsa gsum pa rnams kyi longs spyod dang 'dra ba'i phyir ba dang /
analyzed: gnon pa'i phyir ba dang / de dag 'joms par byed pa'i phyir ba dang / de dag gi yongs su spyad pa bdag gir byed pa'i phyir ba dang / de dang sum cu rtsa gsum pa rnams kyi longs spyod dang 'dra ba'i phyir ba dang /
translated: because they conquer them, because they appropriate their enjoyments, because they are similar to the enjoyments of the Thirty-three,

original: der gtogs pa'i sems can rnams bde ba mang po la spyod pa'i phyir ba dang ; de dang ris mthun pa'i thams cad kyang gnyis ka la grags pa'i lha'i bu rnams dang mdog dang / dbang phyug dang / chu zheng dang / dga' ba dang /
analyzed: der gtogs pa'i sems can rnams bde ba mang po la spyod pa'i phyir ba dang ; de dang ris mthun pa'i thams cad kyang gnyis ka la grags pa'i lha'i bu rnams dang mdog dang / dbang phyug dang / chu zheng dang / dga' ba dang /
translated: because the beings there enjoy many pleasures, and because they are similar in color, power, width, and joy to the gods of the Thirty-three and other realms known to both.

original: rtsed mo dang / mthu dang / kha zas la sogs pa'i longs spyod 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtsed mo dang / mthu dang / kha zas la sogs pa'i longs spyod 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are similar to the gods in their play, their power, their food, etc.

original: lha la sogs pa bzhin te phyogs ni de lta'o //
analyzed: lha la sogs pa bzhin te phyogs ni de lta'o //
translated: The gods are like this.

original: ji ltar thags zangs ris gnod sbyin yin pa lta bar dgongs dang / lha ma yin thams cad kyang de bzhin no //🔽btsun pa 'dus bzangs nges pa'i tshig tsam gyis lha ma yin pa rnams lha nyid ma yin par 'gog par byed cing /
analyzed: ji ltar thags zangs ris gnod sbyin yin pa lta bar dgongs dang / lha ma yin thams cad kyang de bzhin no // btsun pa 'dus bzangs nges pa'i tshig tsam gyis lha ma yin pa rnams lha nyid ma yin par 'gog par byed cing /
translated: But the asuras are like the yakṣa Tumburu, who is a god, and all the other yakṣas.🔽“Bhadanta, the asuras are not gods, because of the etymology of the word.

original: 'di ltar de dag gi nges pa'i tshig kyang lha nyid las zlog par byed de /
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag gi nges pa'i tshig kyang lha nyid las zlog par byed de /
translated: The etymology of the word asura is the opposite of the etymology of the word devaputra.

original: sur zhes bya ba ni dbang phyug yin pas su ra ni lha rnams yin no //🔽de bkag pa'i phyir lha ma yin rnams zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sur zhes bya ba ni dbang phyug yin pas su ra ni lha rnams yin no // de bkag pa'i phyir lha ma yin rnams zhes bya ste /
translated: The word sura means “powerful.” The gods are surāḥ because they are powerful.🔽The asuras are asurāḥ because they are the opposite of that.

original: de lta bu'i dbang phyug med pa'i tha tshig go zhes zer ba ni shin tu dmun pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu'i dbang phyug med pa'i tha tshig go zhes zer ba ni shin tu dmun pa yin no //
translated: To say that the asuras are the opposite of the gods because of the etymology of the word is a very foolish statement.

original: lha'i chos yang dag par blangs te gnas pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni smad pa la dgag pa ston par byed de /
analyzed: lha'i chos yang dag par blangs te gnas pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni smad pa la dgag pa ston par byed de /
translated: The phrase “they do not properly take up and practice the Dharma of gods” indicates a prohibition against disparaging the gods.

original: dper na bu nyid yin yang smad pa yin pa'i phyir 'di nga'i bu ma yin no zhes zer ba bzhin du lha ma yin rnams kyang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: dper na bu nyid yin yang smad pa yin pa'i phyir 'di nga'i bu ma yin no zhes zer ba bzhin du lha ma yin rnams kyang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: For example, even though someone is a son, he is called “not my son” when he is disparaged.

original: sgrib pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni kha cig na re las dang rnam par smin pa'i sgrib pa dag dang ci rigs su sbyar ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: sgrib pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni kha cig na re las dang rnam par smin pa'i sgrib pa dag dang ci rigs su sbyar ro zhes zer ro //
translated: The phrase “they are obscured” means that some say that they are obscured by karma and the ripening of karma, as appropriate.

original: kha cig na re 'di shes par bya'o zhes brtsal kyang ji lta ba bzhin du mi shes pa la bya'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig na re 'di shes par bya'o zhes brtsal kyang ji lta ba bzhin du mi shes pa la bya'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say that this means that even though they try to understand something, they do not understand it as it truly is.

original: de la sems can dmyal ba rnam pa bzhi char na yang zhes bya ba ni tsha ba dang / grang ba dang / lhag pa dang / nyi tshe'i dmyal ba'i bye brag dag na'o //
analyzed: de la sems can dmyal ba rnam pa bzhi char na yang zhes bya ba ni tsha ba dang / grang ba dang / lhag pa dang / nyi tshe'i dmyal ba'i bye brag dag na'o //
translated: The phrase “in all four of the hells” means in the hot hells, the cold hells, the occasional hells, and the isolated hells.

original: bde ba myong ba med de zhes bya ba ni kha cig na re rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'i bde ba'i dbang du bya bas yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: bde ba myong ba med de zhes bya ba ni kha cig na re rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'i bde ba'i dbang du bya bas yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: The phrase “there is no experience of pleasure” means that there is no experience of pleasure that is the result of evolution.

original: kha cig na re reg pa'i skye mched drug pa'i dbang du byas pa yin no //
analyzed: kha cig na re reg pa'i skye mched drug pa'i dbang du byas pa yin no //
translated: Some say that this refers to the pleasure that is the object of the experience of the sixth sense sphere, which is contact.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang dge slong dag reg pa'i skye mched drug pa zhes bya ba'i sems can dmyal ba dag yod de /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang dge slong dag reg pa'i skye mched drug pa zhes bya ba'i sems can dmyal ba dag yod de /
translated: The Blessed One has said, “Monks, there are hells called the six sense spheres.

original: gang dag der skye ba de dag ni shin tu sdug bsngal ba kho na nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs @121b pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gang dag der skye ba de dag ni shin tu sdug bsngal ba kho na nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs @121b pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: Those who are born there experience only the most intense suffering.”

original: phyi rol du bltas pa las skyes pa'i yo byad kyi bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba 'dres pas 'dres mar snang ngo zhes bya ba ni 'dren ma yin pa'i phyir spel ma zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phyi rol du bltas pa las skyes pa'i yo byad kyi bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba 'dres pas 'dres mar snang ngo zhes bya ba ni 'dren ma yin pa'i phyir spel ma zhes bya'o //
translated: The pleasure and pain that arise from looking outward appear as a mixture, because they are mixed.

original: rin po che sna bdun po dag 'byung ba ni mdo nyid las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin du brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gleng gzhi mnyan yod na ste /
analyzed: rin po che sna bdun po dag 'byung ba ni mdo nyid las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin du brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gleng gzhi mnyan yod na ste /
translated: The sutras state:

original: dge slong dag 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po byung na rin po che sna bdun 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: dge slong dag 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po byung na rin po che sna bdun 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: “Monks, when a wheel-turning king arises, the seven jewels arise in the world.

original: sna bdun po de dag gang zhe na /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: sna bdun po de dag gang zhe na / 'di lta ste /
translated: What are the seven?🔽They are the precious wheel, and so on.

original: 'khor lo rin po che dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa mdo sde dag las rgya cher 'byung ba rnams mdor bsdus te brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'khor lo rin po che dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa mdo sde dag las rgya cher 'byung ba rnams mdor bsdus te brjod par bya'o //
translated: These are extensively found in the sutras and should be summarized and described.

original: dge slong dag 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po tshes bco lnga'i gso sbyong gi nyi ma de nyid la mgo dang bcas pa bkrus te gso sbyong byas nas /
analyzed: dge slong dag 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po tshes bco lnga'i gso sbyong gi nyi ma de nyid la mgo dang bcas pa bkrus te gso sbyong byas nas /
translated: Monks, on the fifteenth day of the waxing moon, the wheel-turning king bathes his head, observes the poṣadha fast,🔽and ascends to the top of the palace.

original: blon po'i tshogs kyis yongs su bskor zhing 'dug pa na shar phyogs nas 'khor lo rin po che rtsibs stong la sogs pa dang ldan pa dag 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: blon po'i tshogs kyis yongs su bskor zhing 'dug pa na shar phyogs nas 'khor lo rin po che rtsibs stong la sogs pa dang ldan pa dag 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: When the king is seated and surrounded by the assembly of ministers, the precious wheel appears from the east, endowed with a thousand spokes and so forth.

original: de yang brgya byin gyi tshig gis las thams cad pas byas nas rgyal po chen po rnams kyis rgyal po la ston par byed do //
analyzed: de yang brgya byin gyi tshig gis las thams cad pas byas nas rgyal po chen po rnams kyis rgyal po la ston par byed do //
translated: The wheel is created by the words of Śakra and is shown to the king by the great kings.

original: de bzhin du byang phyogs logs na bya skyibs lham gyi ngos zhes bya ba de na glang po che rab brtan zhes bya ba me tog ku mu da'i mdog 'dra la /
analyzed: de bzhin du byang phyogs logs na bya skyibs lham gyi ngos zhes bya ba de na glang po che rab brtan zhes bya ba me tog ku mu da'i mdog 'dra la /
translated: Similarly, in the north, on the slope of the mountain called Shoe Sole, there is an elephant called Excellent, the color of a kumuda flower.

original: de'i mgo bzang zhing sngo la gtsug lham bu chu gsher gyi mdog ltar dmar ba zhig gnas te /
analyzed: de'i mgo bzang zhing sngo la gtsug lham bu chu gsher gyi mdog ltar dmar ba zhig gnas te /
translated: Its head is good, blue, and its forehead is red like a ruby.

original: de la 'khor glang po che brgya stong yod de /
analyzed: de la 'khor glang po che brgya stong yod de /
translated: It has a retinue of a hundred thousand elephants.

original: de dag kyang de dang 'dra ba sha stag yin no //
analyzed: de dag kyang de dang 'dra ba sha stag yin no //
translated: They are all just like him.

original: de nas brgya byin gyi tshig gis glang po che'i rgyal po rab brtan bu tha chungs 'khor los sgyur ba'i don du gtong bar byed do //
analyzed: de nas brgya byin gyi tshig gis glang po che'i rgyal po rab brtan bu tha chungs 'khor los sgyur ba'i don du gtong bar byed do //
translated: Then, by the words of Indra, the king of elephants, Supratiṣṭhita, gives his youngest son to be the cakravartin.

original: de bzhin du nub phyogs logs na rta'i rgyal po sprin gyi shugs can la yang snga ma bzhin du tha chungs thams cad sngon la mgo nag pa yang gtod par byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin du nub phyogs logs na rta'i rgyal po sprin gyi shugs can la yang snga ma bzhin du tha chungs thams cad sngon la mgo nag pa yang gtod par byed do //
translated: Similarly, in the west, the king of horses, Meghajava, also gives his youngest son to be the cakravartin, as before.

original: nor bu rin po che ni klu rnams sam rgyal po bzhis ster bar byed do //
analyzed: nor bu rin po che ni klu rnams sam rgyal po bzhis ster bar byed do //
translated: The precious jewel is given by the nāgas or the four kings.

original: dge slong dag 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po byung na bud med rin po che gzugs bzang ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong dag 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po byung na bud med rin po che gzugs bzang ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Bhikṣus, when a cakravartin king appears, the precious woman, who has an excellent form, and so on, also appears in the world.

original: de bzhin du lhag ma rnams kyang 'byung bar brjod par bya'o zhes gsungs pa la bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du lhag ma rnams kyang 'byung bar brjod par bya'o zhes gsungs pa la bya'o //
translated: Similarly, it should be said that the remaining precious things also appear.

original: yal ga dang lo ma dang lo ma gzhon nu ni dpag tshad brgyad cur khyad par 'jug go zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yal ga dang lo ma dang lo ma gzhon nu ni dpag tshad brgyad cur khyad par 'jug go zhes bya ba la /
translated: The branches, leaves, and young leaves extend eighty yojanas.

original: sdong po'i sboms su yang dpag tshad nyi shu yod pa de'i phyir da ni thad kar dpag tshad brgya yod do //
analyzed: sdong po'i sboms su yang dpag tshad nyi shu yod pa de'i phyir da ni thad kar dpag tshad brgya yod do //
translated: The trunk of the tree is twenty yojanas in circumference, thus it is one hundred yojanas in height.

original: logs na ni dpag tshad lnga bcur @122a * //
analyzed: logs na ni dpag tshad lnga bcur @122a * //
translated: It is fifty yojanas in width.

original: ngad ldang ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ngad ldang ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: The tree is called Jambu because a fruit of this tree, when ripe, has the color of the Jambu fruit.

original: la la dag ji ltar na dri rdzi phyogs ma yin par 'gro bar 'gyur zhes zer na /
analyzed: la la dag ji ltar na dri rdzi phyogs ma yin par 'gro bar 'gyur zhes zer na /
translated: How can the odor go against the wind?

original: ci'i phyir mi 'gro /'di na ma mthong ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mi 'gro /'di na ma mthong ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Why not? Because we do not see it.

original: ci khyod kyis gzugs med pa rnams kyang mthong ngam /
analyzed: ci khyod kyis gzugs med pa rnams kyang mthong ngam /
translated: Do you see the formless realm?

original: bcom ldan 'das ni tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni tshad ma yin no //
translated: The Buddha is the authority.

original: gzhan yang dper na de na ma brdungs par yang sgra 'byung ba la 'di ni ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang dper na de na ma brdungs par yang sgra 'byung ba la 'di ni ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: Moreover, sound is produced there without effort, but not here.

original: gzhan yang de dang 'di'i rnam par 'byor pa'i khyad par mi 'dra ba de bzhin du las kyi khyad par gyis mngon par grub pa'i phyir dri yang srid do //
analyzed: gzhan yang de dang 'di'i rnam par 'byor pa'i khyad par mi 'dra ba de bzhin du las kyi khyad par gyis mngon par grub pa'i phyir dri yang srid do //
translated: Moreover, odor is possible there as it is here, because it is produced by the specific power of action.

original: 'o na mdo sde las me tog gi dri ni rdzi phyogs ma yin par mi 'gro'o zhes gsungs pa ji lta bu zhe na /🔽de ni 'di na grags pa'i dri las dgongs te /
analyzed: 'o na mdo sde las me tog gi dri ni rdzi phyogs ma yin par mi 'gro'o zhes gsungs pa ji lta bu zhe na / de ni 'di na grags pa'i dri las dgongs te /
translated: But a sutra declares, “The fragrance of flowers does not travel against the wind.”

original: gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gsungs pa yin no //
translated: That statement is made with regard to the fragrance that is familiar here.

original: dbyar zla ba bzhi zhes bya ba ni de'i tshe de me tog rgyas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbyar zla ba bzhi zhes bya ba ni de'i tshe de me tog rgyas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The four months of summer are the time when flowers are in full bloom.

original: byang gi sgra mi snyan dag na ni shing ljon pa de lta bu dag la dpag bsam gyi shing rnams zhes bya ba la bdud rtsi ni med do //
analyzed: byang gi sgra mi snyan dag na ni shing ljon pa de lta bu dag la dpag bsam gyi shing rnams zhes bya ba la bdud rtsi ni med do //
translated: In Uttarakuru, those trees are called wish-fulfilling trees, but they do not produce ambrosia.

original: rtag tu me tog man d'a ra bas pus nub tsam du khebs par 'dug ste zhes bya ba ni 'di pa'i pus mo la bya'o //
analyzed: rtag tu me tog man d'a ra bas pus nub tsam du khebs par 'dug ste zhes bya ba ni 'di pa'i pus mo la bya'o //
translated: They are always covered with mandara flowers up to their knees.

original: zhi ba'i bde ba can mi g-yo ba myong ngo zhes bya ba ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal nye bar zhi ba'i phyir bsam gtan de ni zhi ba'i bde ba can yin te /
analyzed: zhi ba'i bde ba can mi g-yo ba myong ngo zhes bya ba ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal nye bar zhi ba'i phyir bsam gtan de ni zhi ba'i bde ba can yin te /
translated: The fourth meditation is called peaceful bliss, because it is peaceful due to the pacification of pleasure and pain.

original: de'i phyir mi g-yo ba zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir mi g-yo ba zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is called immovable.

original: de ni gnyi ga 'gags pas rab tu phye ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni gnyi ga 'gags pas rab tu phye ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is distinguished by the cessation of both.

original: ji lta ji ltar lus sdug bsngal gyi snod du shin tu gyur pa zhes bya ba ni byed rgyu gong ma rnams med du zin kyang las rnams kho nas sdug bsngal skye ba dang rjes su mthun pa'i lus bskyed pa la bya'o //
analyzed: ji lta ji ltar lus sdug bsngal gyi snod du shin tu gyur pa zhes bya ba ni byed rgyu gong ma rnams med du zin kyang las rnams kho nas sdug bsngal skye ba dang rjes su mthun pa'i lus bskyed pa la bya'o //
translated: As the body becomes more and more of a vessel for suffering, even without the above-mentioned causes, suffering is produced by karma alone and a body is generated that is conducive to suffering.

original: dgang ba la rtsol ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dgang ba la rtsol ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: The effort to inhale is as follows.

original: dgang ba zhes bya ba ni rung bar byed pa'i gzhu la bya'o //
analyzed: dgang ba zhes bya ba ni rung bar byed pa'i gzhu la bya'o //
translated: Inhalation refers to the bellows of a smith.

original: de la 'phags pa'i nor las byung ba'i bde ba ni 'phags pa'i nor bdun po zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de la 'phags pa'i nor las byung ba'i bde ba ni 'phags pa'i nor bdun po zhes bya ba la /
translated: The happiness that arises from the wealth of the noble ones is as follows.

original: nor bdun po zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu dang bcas pa dang / rgyu dang bcas pa dang / mngon par rtogs pa las brtsams nas rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: nor bdun po zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu dang bcas pa dang / rgyu dang bcas pa dang / mngon par rtogs pa las brtsams nas rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: The seven types of wealth of the noble ones are presented in the context of the results, causes, and realizations of the noble ones.

original: 'bras bu ni rtogs nas dad pa rnams dang / 'phags pa dgyes pa'i tshul khrims rnams dang / de las byung ba ma nges pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni rtogs nas dad pa rnams dang / 'phags pa dgyes pa'i tshul khrims rnams dang / de las byung ba ma nges pa rnams so //
translated: The result is the faith of one who has realized, the morality pleasing to the noble ones, and the indeterminate ones that arise from that.

original: rgyu ni thos pa dang gong ma dag go //
analyzed: rgyu ni thos pa dang gong ma dag go //
translated: The cause is learning and the higher ones.

original: mngon par rtogs pa ni shes rab kyi ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa ni shes rab kyi ngo bo nyid do //
translated: Realization is the nature of wisdom.

original: 'bras bu thob pa ma yin na yang de dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyir de dag rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: 'bras bu thob pa ma yin na yang de dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyir de dag rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Even when one has not attained the result, it is established because it is in conformity with that.

original: de la 'phags pa'i nor las byung ba'i @122b bde ba las rnam pa bco lngas khyad par du 'phags te zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i nor las byung ba'i bde ba las 'phags pa ma yin pa'i nor las byung ba'i bde ba shin tu dma' ba yin te
analyzed: de la 'phags pa'i nor las byung ba'i @122b bde ba las rnam pa bco lngas khyad par du 'phags te zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i nor las byung ba'i bde ba las 'phags pa ma yin pa'i nor las byung ba'i bde ba shin tu dma' ba yin te
translated: Among them, the happiness that arises from the wealth of the noble ones is superior in fifteen ways. The happiness that arises from the wealth of the non-noble ones is very low compared to the happiness that arises from the wealth of the noble ones.

original: / thams cad du skyon dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / thams cad du skyon dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is always faulty.

original: sgrub pa'i dus na yang phyi ma la mi 'dod pa yin te /
analyzed: sgrub pa'i dus na yang phyi ma la mi 'dod pa yin te /
translated: Even at the time of practice, it is undesirable for the future.

original: nyes par spyod pa kun nas slong ba la yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyes par spyod pa kun nas slong ba la yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the instigator of misdeeds.

original: tshe 'di la yang mi 'dod pa yin te /
analyzed: tshe 'di la yang mi 'dod pa yin te /
translated: It is also undesirable in this life,

original: kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa la dga' ba dang ldan pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa la dga' ba dang ldan pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is associated with delight in what is reprehensible.

original: gal te 'ga' zhig kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa la dga' ba dang ldan pa ma yin du zin kyang rang bzhin gyis chung ba dang / dus thams cad pa ma yin pa dang / sa thams cad pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i dman pa rnam pa de gsum gyis shin tu dman pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te 'ga' zhig kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa la dga' ba dang ldan pa ma yin du zin kyang rang bzhin gyis chung ba dang / dus thams cad pa ma yin pa dang / sa thams cad pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i dman pa rnam pa de gsum gyis shin tu dman pa yin no //
translated: Even if someone is not associated with delight in what is reprehensible, it is still inferior in three ways: by nature, not being always or everywhere.

original: yongs su spyod pa na phyis 'phags pa ma yin pa'i nor gnyi ga thob par byed pa ma yin pa dang / tshe 'di la longs spyod na yongs su zin cing mthar thug par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: yongs su spyod pa na phyis 'phags pa ma yin pa'i nor gnyi ga thob par byed pa ma yin pa dang / tshe 'di la longs spyod na yongs su zin cing mthar thug par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: When it is enjoyed, it is not obtained in both ways by those who are not noble. When it is enjoyed in this life, it is limited and comes to an end.

original: srung ba na tshe 'di la rgyal po rnams sam chom rkun rnams la sogs pas gcad du rung ba dang / tshe phyi mar yang 'di nas blangs nas 'gro bar 'gyur ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: srung ba na tshe 'di la rgyal po rnams sam chom rkun rnams la sogs pas gcad du rung ba dang / tshe phyi mar yang 'di nas blangs nas 'gro bar 'gyur ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: When it is guarded, it is not suitable to be taken away by kings, thieves, etc. in this life, and it does not follow one from this world to the next.

original: yongs su spyad na tshe 'di la bsten na chog mi shes pa yin pa dang / 'thab pa la sogs pa dang na ba la sogs pa skyed par byed pa dang / phyi ma la yang sdug bsngal skyed par byed pa ni ma 'ongs pa'i sdug bsngal skyer dogs pa'i gzhi'i gnas su gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su spyad na tshe 'di la bsten na chog mi shes pa yin pa dang / 'thab pa la sogs pa dang na ba la sogs pa skyed par byed pa dang / phyi ma la yang sdug bsngal skyed par byed pa ni ma 'ongs pa'i sdug bsngal skyer dogs pa'i gzhi'i gnas su gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: If one indulges in them, they are not satisfying in this life, and they cause quarrels, etc., and sickness, etc. And in the next life, they are the basis for the fear of suffering.

original: bsrungs na yang tshe 'di la phyin ci log dag gis kun tu rmongs par byed pa dang / phyi ma la yang sdug bsngal spong bar 'gyur ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: bsrungs na yang tshe 'di la phyin ci log dag gis kun tu rmongs par byed pa dang / phyi ma la yang sdug bsngal spong bar 'gyur ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: Even if one guards them, they are the cause of delusion through error in this life, and they do not lead to the abandonment of suffering in the next life.

original: bsdu ba'i tshigs su bcad pa ni /
analyzed: bsdu ba'i tshigs su bcad pa ni /
translated: A concluding verse

original: sgrub dang longs spyod srung ba dang // spyad dang bsrung ba'i bye brag las //
analyzed: sgrub dang longs spyod srung ba dang // spyad dang bsrung ba'i bye brag las //
translated: They are to be accomplished, enjoyed, guarded, used, and guarded.

original: dus lnga 'di dang phyi ma la //
analyzed: dus lnga 'di dang phyi ma la //
translated: In five periods, in this life and the next,

original: dbye bas de dag gnyis gnyis so //
analyzed: dbye bas de dag gnyis gnyis so //
translated: they are divided into two kinds each.

original: 'phags pa'i nor las byung ba ni de dag las bzlog pa yin par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i nor las byung ba ni de dag las bzlog pa yin par brjod par bya'o //
translated: The opposite of these should be said to be the wealth of the noble ones.

original: 'phags pa'i nor las byung ba ni nang gi rkyen la rag las pa'i phyir dus thams cad pa yin no zhes bya ba ni lung la ltos pa yin du zin kyang 'byung ba'i skad cig ni tshul bzhin yid la byed pa la rag las pa yin pa'i phyir
analyzed: 'phags pa'i nor las byung ba ni nang gi rkyen la rag las pa'i phyir dus thams cad pa yin no zhes bya ba ni lung la ltos pa yin du zin kyang 'byung ba'i skad cig ni tshul bzhin yid la byed pa la rag las pa yin pa'i phyir
translated: Even though it depends on scripture, the moment of arising depends on proper mental attention.

original: ro // chos kyi longs spyod bde ba yongs su rdzogs pa zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs ni /
analyzed: ro // chos kyi longs spyod bde ba yongs su rdzogs pa zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs ni /
translated: The reason “the enjoyment of the Dharma is perfect bliss”

original: bdud dang phyir rgol ba nges par bcom pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: bdud dang phyir rgol ba nges par bcom pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: means “because demons and adversaries are definitely conquered.”

original: de'i phyir de @123a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir de @123a * //
translated: Therefore,

original: gnyis ni tshig gcig tu bsdu'o //
analyzed: gnyis ni tshig gcig tu bsdu'o //
translated: those two are combined into one phrase.

original: de la 'dod pa can rnams kyi 'dod pa'i bde ba yid la bde ba'i gnas lta bu ni rjes su chags pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni smras ma thag pa lnga po dag las bzlog pa yin no //
analyzed: de la 'dod pa can rnams kyi 'dod pa'i bde ba yid la bde ba'i gnas lta bu ni rjes su chags pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni smras ma thag pa lnga po dag las bzlog pa yin no //
translated: Among them, the pleasure of desire is like a basis for mental pleasure. The opposite of the five just mentioned is called “accompanied by attachment.”

original: rjes su 'brel pa nyid yin pa dang zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang ma bral ba rnams kyi ste /
analyzed: rjes su 'brel pa nyid yin pa dang zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang ma bral ba rnams kyi ste /
translated: The phrase “because it is related to” refers to those who are not free from passion.

original: kun tu rtog pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun tu rtog pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is related to imagination.

original: yang phyir ldog par 'gyur la zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: yang phyir ldog par 'gyur la zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams kyi'o //
translated: The phrase “because it turns back” refers to those who are free from passion.

original: bden pa'i bde ba zhes bya ba ni yongs su rdzogs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bden pa'i bde ba zhes bya ba ni yongs su rdzogs pa ma yin te /
translated: The phrase “the happiness of the truth” refers to the incomplete.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is supramundane.

original: bdud dang phyir rgol ba dang ldan pa yin te zhes bya ba ni sgyu ma lta bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa yul drug po dag gis ston te /
analyzed: bdud dang phyir rgol ba dang ldan pa yin te zhes bya ba ni sgyu ma lta bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa yul drug po dag gis ston te /
translated: The phrase “it is associated with the demon Mara and with resistance” is explained by the six objects beginning with “like an illusion.”

original: skye mched drug gi mdo las /
analyzed: skye mched drug gi mdo las /
translated: The Sutra of the Six Senses says:

original: bdud kyang de yin la bdud sdig can yang de yin no zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: bdud kyang de yin la bdud sdig can yang de yin no zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: “That is Mara, and that is the evil Mara.”

original: de bzhin du legs 'byor gyi mdo las sems can ji lta bar bdud kyang de bzhin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de bzhin du legs 'byor gyi mdo las sems can ji lta bar bdud kyang de bzhin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: Similarly, the Sutra of Subahu says: “Just as is the sentient being, so is Mara.”

original: mdo nyid las ji skad rgyas par 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni dge slong gang zang zing dang bcas pa'i dga' ba yang yod /
analyzed: mdo nyid las ji skad rgyas par 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni dge slong gang zang zing dang bcas pa'i dga' ba yang yod /
translated: There is joy with relish,

original: zang zing med pa'i dga' ba yang yod /
analyzed: zang zing med pa'i dga' ba yang yod /
translated: there is joy without relish,

original: zang zing med pas kyang ches zang zing med pa'i dga' ba yang med do //
analyzed: zang zing med pas kyang ches zang zing med pa'i dga' ba yang med do //
translated: and there is joy without relish that is superior to the joy without relish.

original: bde ba dang btang snyoms dang / rnam par thar pa yang de bzhin te /
analyzed: bde ba dang btang snyoms dang / rnam par thar pa yang de bzhin te /
translated: The same applies to pleasure and equanimity.

original: 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la brten te skyes pa'i dga' ba gang yin pa de ni zang zing dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la brten te skyes pa'i dga' ba gang yin pa de ni zang zing dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: The joy that arises in dependence on the five sense pleasures is with relish.

original: bsam gtan dang po rdzogs par bya ste gnas pa gang yin pa de ni zang zing med pa yin no //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po rdzogs par bya ste gnas pa gang yin pa de ni zang zing med pa yin no //
translated: The abiding in the first meditative absorption is without relish.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa'i gang yin pa de ni zang zing med pa bas ches zang zing med pa yin no //
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa'i gang yin pa de ni zang zing med pa bas ches zang zing med pa yin no //
translated: The abiding in the second meditative absorption is without relish that is superior to the joy without relish.

original: de bzhin du bde ba yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du bde ba yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Similarly, there are three kinds of pleasure.

original: 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga dang / bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa'i'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga dang / bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa'i'o //
translated: The five sense pleasures and the first and second absorptions.

original: de bzhin du btang snyoms kyang 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga dang / bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa'i'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du btang snyoms kyang 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga dang / bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa'i'o //
translated: So too, equanimity is in regard to the five sense pleasures and the first and second absorptions.

original: de bzhin du rnam par thar pa yang gzugs dang gzugs med pa dang ldan pa dag dang / 'di la dge slong 'dod chags las sems rnam par grol pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsum pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par thar pa yang gzugs dang gzugs med pa dang ldan pa dag dang / 'di la dge slong 'dod chags las sems rnam par grol pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsum pa'o //
translated: So too, the liberations are in regard to the form and formless realms. The third is called “the monk is liberated from the mind in regard to attachment.”

original: gnas pa'i bde ba zhes bya ba ni gnas pa de nyid shin tu rab tu zhi ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas pa'i bde ba zhes bya ba ni gnas pa de nyid shin tu rab tu zhi ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The happiness of abiding is the same as the abiding itself, because it is extremely peaceful.

original: de la zas kyi longs spyod dang yongs su spyad pa rnam par gzhag pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la zas kyi longs spyod dang yongs su spyad pa rnam par gzhag pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The enjoyment and utilization of food is presented as follows:

original: 'di lta ste bde @123b ba dang / sdug bsngal myong ba dang zas kyi longs spyod dang zhes gang smos pa de la zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'di lta ste bde @123b ba dang / sdug bsngal myong ba dang zas kyi longs spyod dang zhes gang smos pa de la zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: “The enjoyment and utilization of food is in regard to the experience of pleasure and pain.”

original: rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyis ni pha dang ma'i phrag pa'am pang par byis pa lo lnga lon pa lta bu rdzus te 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyis ni pha dang ma'i phrag pa'am pang par byis pa lo lnga lon pa lta bu rdzus te 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: Those of the Caturmaharajakayikas are born supernaturally, like children five years of age, either on the lap of their parents or in their wombs.🔽Like means similar.

original: lta bu zhes bya ba ni 'dra ba'i don te ji skad du /
analyzed: lta bu zhes bya ba ni 'dra ba'i don te ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: mig sman thur ma gsar bris ltar ;
analyzed: mig sman thur ma gsar bris ltar ;
translated: Like a new drawing in eye ointment,

original: / rus pa'i rgyan rnams brgyan byas shing //
analyzed: / rus pa'i rgyan rnams brgyan byas shing //
translated: adorned with bone ornaments,

original: pha rol tshor bar mi byed pa'i //🔽byis pa rnams la rmongs pas khyab //
analyzed: pha rol tshor bar mi byed pa'i // byis pa rnams la rmongs pas khyab //
translated: without causing pain to others,

original: ces gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ces gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: the children are pervaded by delusion.

original: de la skye bar dogs pa rnam par gzhag pa ni zhes bya ba ni khams gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa'i rab tu dbye ba drug yin par sbyar ro //
analyzed: de la skye bar dogs pa rnam par gzhag pa ni zhes bya ba ni khams gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa'i rab tu dbye ba drug yin par sbyar ro //
translated: The presentation of the fear of birth is connected with the six divisions of the presentation of the designation of realms.

original: ji ltar 'dod pa skye ba gsum dang / bde ba skye ba gsum du rnam par gzhag ce na zhes bya ba ni //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod pa skye ba gsum dang / bde ba skye ba gsum du rnam par gzhag ce na zhes bya ba ni //
translated: How are the three births and three happy births presented?

original: ci'i phyir skye ba gsum kho nar zad la mang du rnam par mi gzhag snyam du bsams nas 'dri'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir skye ba gsum kho nar zad la mang du rnam par mi gzhag snyam du bsams nas 'dri'o //
translated: Why are only three births presented and not more?

original: de dag de ltar gnas pas dran pa brjed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni kha zas kyi ste /
analyzed: de dag de ltar gnas pas dran pa brjed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni kha zas kyi ste /
translated: They live in that way and forget mindfulness. This is the food of hunger.

original: de'i phyir bkres pas 'chi'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir bkres pas 'chi'o //
translated: Therefore, they die from hunger.

original: gcig la gcig mig gis mig tshugs su rtog par byed de zhes bya ba ni gcig la gcig phrag dog gis so //
analyzed: gcig la gcig mig gis mig tshugs su rtog par byed de zhes bya ba ni gcig la gcig phrag dog gis so //
translated: They look at each other with eyes of envy.

original: dbang po yongs su rdzogs pa zhes bya ba ni thams cad 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po yongs su rdzogs pa zhes bya ba ni thams cad 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They have fully developed faculties because they desire everything.

original: dbang po yongs su smin pa rnams so zhes bya ba ni tha snyad shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po yongs su smin pa rnams so zhes bya ba ni tha snyad shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They have fully matured faculties because they know the conventional.

original: bstan bcos la btags pa'i yong pa dang / don dam par yod pa'i rgyu rnam par gzhag pa gcig tu bsdus nas rgyu rnam pa bcu ston par 'gyur bas na /
analyzed: bstan bcos la btags pa'i yong pa dang / don dam par yod pa'i rgyu rnam par gzhag pa gcig tu bsdus nas rgyu rnam pa bcu ston par 'gyur bas na /
translated: The ten causes are taught by combining into one the causes that are nominally existent in the treatises and those that are ultimately existent.

original: de la rgyu'i mtshan nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la rgyu'i mtshan nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is the characteristic of a cause?

original: snga na yod pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: snga na yod pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: It is that which exists prior to something else, etc.

original: rang gi sa bon ni snga na yod pa ste zhes bya ba ni sa bon ni 'bras bu bas snga ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi sa bon ni snga na yod pa ste zhes bya ba ni sa bon ni 'bras bu bas snga ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The seed exists prior to it means that the seed exists prior to the effect.

original: brten nas zhes bya ba ni gtso bo'i rkyen la brten nas so //
analyzed: brten nas zhes bya ba ni gtso bo'i rkyen la brten nas so //
translated: In dependence means in dependence on the principal condition.

original: phrad na zhes bya ba ni phrad pa tsam du zad pa la bya'i yang dang yang du byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: phrad na zhes bya ba ni phrad pa tsam du zad pa la bya'i yang dang yang du byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: If it meets means if it meets only once, not if it meets repeatedly.

original: gnas gzugs can nam zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa dag gi 'byung ba chen po rnams te /
analyzed: gnas gzugs can nam zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa dag gi 'byung ba chen po rnams te /
translated: The material basis means the great elements of the eye, etc.

original: mig la sogs pa dang de dag gi rnam par shes pa rnams kyi gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa dang de dag gi rnam par shes pa rnams kyi gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are the basis of the eye, etc. and their consciousnesses.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i bya ba ci zhig yod na gang gi phyir de'i rgyu brjod ce na /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i bya ba ci zhig yod na gang gi phyir de'i rgyu brjod ce na /
translated: What is the activity of nirvana that it is said to be the cause of that?

original: thob par bya ba nyid kyi rgyu brjod pa yin gyi bskyed par bya ba'i rgyu ma yin pas na nyes pa ci yod /
analyzed: thob par bya ba nyid kyi rgyu brjod pa yin gyi bskyed par bya ba'i rgyu ma yin pas na nyes pa ci yod /
translated: We reply: It is said to be the cause of its attainment, not the cause of its generation, so what is the problem?

original: rgyu zhes bya ba ni sa bon spong bar byed pa yin te /
analyzed: rgyu zhes bya ba ni sa bon spong bar byed pa yin te /
translated: The cause is the seed that is abandoned.

original: lus nyon mongs pa dang bral bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro @124a * //
analyzed: lus nyon mongs pa dang bral bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro @124a * //
translated: Because it causes the body to be free of affliction.

original: las kyi mtha' ma log pa zhes bya ba ni mtshams med pa'i las rnams mi byed pa la bya ste /
analyzed: las kyi mtha' ma log pa zhes bya ba ni mtshams med pa'i las rnams mi byed pa la bya ste /
translated: Correct livelihood is not engaging in the karma of the heinous actions.

original: ji skad du lnga pa zhes bya ba'i mdo las /
analyzed: ji skad du lnga pa zhes bya ba'i mdo las /
translated: The Sūtra on the Five Beings states:

original: log pa'i las kyi mtha' gang zhe na /
analyzed: log pa'i las kyi mtha' gang zhe na /
translated: What is wrong livelihood?🔽It is the five heinous actions.🔽The desire to know is prior.

original: mtshams med pa lnga'o zhes bya ba gsungs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos shing 'dod pa ni snga na yod pa ste zhes bya ba ni shes bya gang yin pa la nges shing bsgrub par 'dod pa yang yod pa na de 'grub par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: mtshams med pa lnga'o zhes bya ba gsungs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos shing 'dod pa ni snga na yod pa ste zhes bya ba ni shes bya gang yin pa la nges shing bsgrub par 'dod pa yang yod pa na de 'grub par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: When there is something to be known, there is also the desire to ascertain and establish it, and then it is accomplished.

original: don gang rang la nges na gzhan la yang go bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don gang rang la nges na gzhan la yang go bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because when one ascertains a meaning for oneself, one also causes others to understand it.

original: bzo shes pa ni snga na yod pa ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bzo shes pa ni snga na yod pa ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: Knowledge of the arts is prior.

original: bzo'i gnas ni sngon byung ba sbyor ba tsam du zad kyi sngon ma byung ba skyed pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bzo'i gnas ni sngon byung ba sbyor ba tsam du zad kyi sngon ma byung ba skyed pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The arts are merely the application of what has occurred in the past. They are not the creation of something that has not occurred in the past.

original: de bas na 'grub ces bya ba'i sgrar bstan gyi skye bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i sgrar ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de bas na 'grub ces bya ba'i sgrar bstan gyi skye bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i sgrar ni ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, the word “to be established” is taught, not the word “to be born.”

original: de lta bas na 'dir skye zhes bya ba dang / 'grub ces bya ba la bye brag ni de yod do //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'dir skye zhes bya ba dang / 'grub ces bya ba la bye brag ni de yod do //
translated: Thus, there is a difference between “to be born” and “to be established.”

original: zas rnam pa bzhi dang phrad na zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang sngon byung ba nyid gnas par byed pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: zas rnam pa bzhi dang phrad na zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang sngon byung ba nyid gnas par byed pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: “When there is contact with the four kinds of nutriment” and so on, the prior existence is the cause of continuance.

original: de yang grub pa nyid de /
analyzed: de yang grub pa nyid de /
translated: And that is established,

original: 'di ltar rnam par smin pa la skyes pa'i rgyud yod na bsags pa las byung ba'i rgyud 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par smin pa la skyes pa'i rgyud yod na bsags pa las byung ba'i rgyud 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because when there is a continuum of birth in the result of evolution, a continuum that arises from the accumulation of action can occur.

original: gal te gnas shing zhes bya ba ma smos na /
analyzed: gal te gnas shing zhes bya ba ma smos na /
translated: If the word “continuing” were not mentioned,

original: nus pa med pa nus pa yod par byas pa'i phyir bsgrubs pa zhes bya bas na brta ba yang 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: nus pa med pa nus pa yod par byas pa'i phyir bsgrubs pa zhes bya bas na brta ba yang 'grub par 'gyur te /

original: de'i phyir gnas shing zhes bya ba ni bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gnas shing zhes bya ba ni bstan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the word “continuing” is taught.

original: 'tsho la zhes bya ba dang / brta bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba gnyis ni bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'tsho la zhes bya ba dang / brta bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba gnyis ni bshad pa yin no //
translated: The two phrases “it lives” and “it endures” have been explained.

original: 'tsho la zhes bya ba ni gnod pa med pa nye bar sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'tsho la zhes bya ba ni gnod pa med pa nye bar sogs pa yin no //
translated: “It lives” means it is not harmed.

original: brta bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni phan 'dogs pa nye bar sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: brta bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni phan 'dogs pa nye bar sogs pa yin no //
translated: “It endures” means it is helped.

original: chos ci zhig byed par 'gyur zhe na /

original: rang gi sa bon ni snga na yod pa ste zhes bya ba la ;
analyzed: rang gi sa bon ni snga na yod pa ste zhes bya ba la ;

analyzed: de nyid kyi dbang gis phyi rol gyi dngos po rnams kyang phun tshogs pa dan rgud par 'gyur ba'i phyir te zhes bya ba ni nang gi 'du byed kyi longs spyod kyi don du phyi rol rnams mngon par 'gyur bas na de nyid kyi dbang gis phun sum tshogs pa dang rgud par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because external things manifest for the sake of the enjoyment of internal formations, they become prosperous or ruined because of that.

original: rlan dang bcas pa'i sa bon zhes bya ba ni srid pas de ma thag pa'i 'bras bu skyed nus pa skyed pa ste /
analyzed: rlan dang bcas pa'i sa bon zhes bya ba ni srid pas de ma thag pa'i 'bras bu skyed nus pa skyed pa ste /
translated: A seed with moisture is a seed that is able to generate the result that immediately follows existence.

original: mngon par brjod pa'i bag chags ni sa bon no //🔽mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu ni sred pa yin no zhes gsungs pa lta bu ste zhes bya ba 'di ni khungs yin te /
analyzed: mngon par brjod pa'i bag chags ni sa bon no // mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu ni sred pa yin no zhes gsungs pa lta bu ste zhes bya ba 'di ni khungs yin te /
translated: The latent tendencies of expression are the seed.🔽Craving is the cause of actualization.

original: mngon par brnyan pa'i sa bon de ni mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon par brnyan pa'i sa bon de ni mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is the source, because that seed of the latent tendencies of expression is the cause of actualization.

original: phrad nas 'gags pa zhes bya ba ni mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen la bya ste /
analyzed: phrad nas 'gags pa zhes bya ba ni mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen la bya ste /

analyzed: nye bar spyod pa'i phyir ram / 'gags pa'i tshe zhes kha cig gi lugs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are the basis of the experience of the object,🔽or because they are the basis of the experience of the object at the moment of cessation, according to another opinion.

original: gzhan dag na re phrad nas 'gags pa zhes bya ba ni yul de dang dbang po la sogs pa'i bye brag dag tu byas pa yang yin no zhes zer ro //

translated: According to another opinion, the expression “having come into contact” indicates that the object, the sense faculty, etc., are also differentiated.

original: de ltar na de bzhin du zhes bya ba'i sgra ni go dka' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na de bzhin du zhes bya ba'i sgra ni go dka' bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: mig gi yul thams cad ni rnam par shes pa skyed par mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For not all objects of the eye give rise to visual consciousness.

original: de dag nyid gnas kyang yin te snga ma bzhin no /
analyzed: de dag nyid gnas kyang yin te snga ma bzhin no /

translated: If you fear that the Vaibhāṣikas will be frightened by the four types of distance,

analyzed: 'dus ma byas pa mngon sum du bya ba yang 'dren to zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i thob pa la bya ste /

original: de nyid rgyu yin te /

analyzed: gzhag dag na re snga ma rnams ni phal cher skye ba'i rgyu yin te /
translated: The Vaibhāṣikas say: The former are generally causes of birth.

original: de'i phyir lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu 'di nyid du skye ba dang 'thob pa la sogs pa dag bstan pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu 'di nyid du skye ba dang 'thob pa la sogs pa dag bstan pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore, the causes of birth, obtainment, etc. are taught as co-existent causes.

original: gzhan dag na re de lta bu srid mod kyi de dag la 'dus pa med pas na de'i phyir ma bstan to zhes brjod par rigs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re de lta bu srid mod kyi de dag la 'dus pa med pas na de'i phyir ma bstan to zhes brjod par rigs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Others say: Although that is possible, it is not reasonable to say that they are not taught because they are not included among them.

original: de la rgyu'i gnas bar du gcod pa la brten nas mi mthun pa'i rgyu 'dogs par byed do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de la rgyu'i gnas bar du gcod pa la brten nas mi mthun pa'i rgyu 'dogs par byed do zhes bya ba la /
translated: In this regard, the designation of a cause as an opposing cause is based on the obstruction of the state of being a cause.

original: ji ltar na med pa gzhan gyi rgyur 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na med pa gzhan gyi rgyur 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How can a non-existent be a cause of another?

original: de lta bu'i tha snyad yod pas na nyes pa med do //
analyzed: de lta bu'i tha snyad yod pas na nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no error, since such a convention exists.

original: 'dir rgyus ji ltar de la byed par 'gyur zhes rgol ba de ni de'i rkyen ma tshang bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir rgyus ji ltar de la byed par 'gyur zhes rgol ba de ni de'i rkyen ma tshang bar byed pa yin no //
translated: Here, the opponent argues: How can a cause act in that way? It is said that it acts by making the conditions for that incomplete.

original: gal te bar du gcod pa ma yin pa nye bar gnas par gyur na zhes bya ba ni mar me la sogs pas bar du gcod pa bsal ba la bya'o //
analyzed: gal te bar du gcod pa ma yin pa nye bar gnas par gyur na zhes bya ba ni mar me la sogs pas bar du gcod pa bsal ba la bya'o //
translated: If the non-obstructing cause is present, i.e., if the lamp, etc. is present to remove the obstruction,

original: 'o na lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu dang 'di la bye brag ci yod ce na /
analyzed: 'o na lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu dang 'di la bye brag ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the difference between a co-existent cause and a non-obstructing cause?

original: kha cig na re rdzas ni gcig pa yin mod kyi spyod pa la bye brag yod do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig na re rdzas ni gcig pa yin mod kyi spyod pa la bye brag yod do zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say: although the substance is the same, there is a difference in function.

original: yang kha cig na re snga ma'i rkyen mtha' dag dang 'grogs pa yin gyi bar du gcod pa ni rgyu gcig pu yin par zad do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: yang kha cig na re snga ma'i rkyen mtha' dag dang 'grogs pa yin gyi bar du gcod pa ni rgyu gcig pu yin par zad do zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: the former is accompanied by all the conditions, but the non-obstructing cause is only a single cause.

original: yongs su 'dzin pa'i rgyu dang ni sa bon las bye brag yod do //
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pa'i rgyu dang ni sa bon las bye brag yod do //
translated: There is a difference between the cause of possession and the seed.

original: yang na bar du gcod pa med pa tsam nyid rgyur 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang na bar du gcod pa med pa tsam nyid rgyur 'gyur te /
translated: Or, the mere absence of obstruction is the cause.

original: dper na chos kyi rgyun gyi rgyu yod pa yang nye ba tsam gyis phan 'dogs par byed pa de bzhin du 'ga' zhig med par gyur pa gang yin pa yang nye bar gyur pas na skye bar 'gyur bas de ni 'dra ba yin no //
analyzed: dper na chos kyi rgyun gyi rgyu yod pa yang nye ba tsam gyis phan 'dogs par byed pa de bzhin du 'ga' zhig med par gyur pa gang yin pa yang nye bar gyur pas na skye bar 'gyur bas de ni 'dra ba yin no //
translated: For example, just as the presence of the cause of the stream of dharmas is helpful when it is near, in the same way, when something that is absent becomes near, it arises.

original: de la rkyen gyi gnas sa bon la brten nas rgyu'i rkyen 'dogs so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de la rkyen gyi gnas sa bon la brten nas rgyu'i rkyen 'dogs so zhes bya ba la /
translated: In this regard, the causal condition is designated in dependence on the seed that is the basis of the condition.

original: sa bon zhes bya ba ni mngon par brjod pa'i bag chags kyi sa bon la bya ste /
analyzed: sa bon zhes bya ba ni mngon par brjod pa'i bag chags kyi sa bon la bya ste /
translated: Here, seed refers to the seed of the latent impressions of verbalization.

original: gzhan dag tu ni bag chags bdag po'i rkyen yang yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dag tu ni bag chags bdag po'i rkyen yang yin no //
translated: In other places, the latent impressions are also the dominant condition.

original: de la rgyu'i gnas dang rkyen gyi gnas bag chags dang mthun pa la brten nas rnam @126b par smin pa'i 'bras bu dang rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu 'dogs so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de la rgyu'i gnas dang rkyen gyi gnas bag chags dang mthun pa la brten nas rnam @126b par smin pa'i 'bras bu dang rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu 'dogs so zhes bya ba la /
translated: In this regard, the ripened result and the result that is in accordance with its cause are designated in dependence on the basis of the cause and the basis of the condition that are in accordance with the latent impressions.

original: rgyu'i gnas las kyi bag chags la brten nas rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu 'dogs par byed kyi mngon par brjod pa'i bag chags la ni ma yin te /🔽de la mngon par grub pa ni rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu'i gnas las kyi bag chags la brten nas rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu 'dogs par byed kyi mngon par brjod pa'i bag chags la ni ma yin te / de la mngon par grub pa ni rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The result of conscious construction is designated in dependence on the causal state, the latent impressions of action, and not in dependence on the latent impressions of verbalization.

original: lung du ma bstan pa ni dman pa'i phyir dge ba dang mi dge ba rnams dang mthun pa yin par sngar yang rnam par ma bzhag pa rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ni mthun pa ma yin no //
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa ni dman pa'i phyir dge ba dang mi dge ba rnams dang mthun pa yin par sngar yang rnam par ma bzhag pa rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ni mthun pa ma yin no //
translated: Because the result of conscious construction is the result of natural outcome, and the result of conscious construction is not the result of natural outcome, because the neutral is not posited as homogeneous with the virtuous and nonvirtuous because it is inferior.

original: de la rgyu ni phan pa'i don to zhes bya ba ni nges pa'i tshig yin gyi de mtshan nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de la rgyu ni phan pa'i don to zhes bya ba ni nges pa'i tshig yin gyi de mtshan nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: The cause is for the sake of benefit means that this is the verbal definition, not the definition of the cause itself.

original: lhag ma rnams ni thabs kyi rgyu'o zhes bya ba ni rjes su tha snyad 'dogs pa la sogs pa dag go //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni thabs kyi rgyu'o zhes bya ba ni rjes su tha snyad 'dogs pa la sogs pa dag go //
translated: The remaining causes are the instrumental cause means that the remaining causes are the cause of the means, such as the cause of designation.

original: 'di lta ste mig gi rnam par shes pa'i'o zhes bya ba ni lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin pa'i sde pa dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: 'di lta ste mig gi rnam par shes pa'i'o zhes bya ba ni lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin pa'i sde pa dag gis smras pa /
translated: The cause of the eye consciousness is the eye faculty means that the cause of the eye consciousness is the eye faculty.

original: rgyu ni lhan cig 'byung ba med pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: rgyu ni lhan cig 'byung ba med pa kho na yin te /
translated: The cause is only non-existent simultaneous arising.

original: mig dang gzugs ni snga la de las rnam par shes pa 'byung ba la sogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig dang gzugs ni snga la de las rnam par shes pa 'byung ba la sogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the eye and form are prior, and consciousness arises from them, etc.

original: pha rol gyi sems shes pa yang da ltar byung ba la dmigs pa'i phyir ba dang / rgyur byas pa'i gzugs kyang lhan cig byung ba la brten nas khas blangs pa'i phyir ba dang / de 'phel ba dang 'grib par 'gyur ba la sogs pa dag gis 'dod kyang lhan cig skyes pa'i mar me rten pa nyid yin pa'i snga ma dag gis bsgrubs pa'i phyir med pa kho na yin no zhes zer ba de ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: pha rol gyi sems shes pa yang da ltar byung ba la dmigs pa'i phyir ba dang / rgyur byas pa'i gzugs kyang lhan cig byung ba la brten nas khas blangs pa'i phyir ba dang / de 'phel ba dang 'grib par 'gyur ba la sogs pa dag gis 'dod kyang lhan cig skyes pa'i mar me rten pa nyid yin pa'i snga ma dag gis bsgrubs pa'i phyir med pa kho na yin no zhes zer ba de ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Also, because the knowledge of the mind of another has the present as its object, and because derivative form is accepted as based on the simultaneous elements, and because the former masters have proven that the lamp is only a simultaneous support, etc., by the fact that it increases and decreases, etc., it is not reasonable to say that it is only non-existent.

original: mig dang gzugs ni 'di lta ste gnas dang dmigs pa nyid du rnam par shes pa'i rgyu'i dngos po tsam du zad do //
analyzed: mig dang gzugs ni 'di lta ste gnas dang dmigs pa nyid du rnam par shes pa'i rgyu'i dngos po tsam du zad do //
translated: The eye and form are merely the cause of consciousness in the sense of being the basis and object, respectively.

original: skyed pa po ni lhan cig 'byung ba ma yin par yang 'dod la rag go //
analyzed: skyed pa po ni lhan cig 'byung ba ma yin par yang 'dod la rag go //
translated: Let it be accepted that the producer is not a simultaneous cause.

original: gzhan yang smra bar nus te ;
analyzed: gzhan yang smra bar nus te ;
translated: There are other arguments as well.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa ni 'das pa la dmigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa ni 'das pa la dmigs pa ma yin te /
translated: The visual consciousness does not have as its object a past form,

original: rtog pa med pa'i phyir te sgra bzhin no //
analyzed: rtog pa med pa'i phyir te sgra bzhin no //
translated: because it is nonconceptual, like sound.

original: gang 'das pa de ni rnam par rtog pa yin te /
analyzed: gang 'das pa de ni rnam par rtog pa yin te /
translated: That which is past is conceptualized,

original: dper na dra ba can gyi yid kyi rnam par shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na dra ba can gyi yid kyi rnam par shes pa bzhin no //
translated: like the visual consciousness of the spider.

original: rnam par rtog pa ma yin pa'i rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa 'das ma thag pa'i gzugs ni yul ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ma yin pa'i rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa 'das ma thag pa'i gzugs ni yul ma yin te /
translated: The form that is the object of a nonconceptual consciousness is not the immediately past form,

original: 'das pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'das pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is past.

original: 'gags nas lo brgya lon pa'i gzugs bzhin te /
analyzed: 'gags nas lo brgya lon pa'i gzugs bzhin te /
translated: It is like the form that has ceased a hundred years ago.

original: skad cig de la 'gags pa dang 'gags nas lo brgya lon pa ni dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin par bye brag med do //
analyzed: skad cig de la 'gags pa dang 'gags nas lo brgya lon pa ni dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin par bye brag med do //
translated: There is no difference between the form that has ceased in that moment and the form that has ceased a hundred years ago, in that they are both essentially non-existent.

original: log pa ni 'dus ma byas pa'o //🔽gzhan dag rjes su @127a * //
analyzed: log pa ni 'dus ma byas pa'o // gzhan dag rjes su @127a * //
translated: The past is uncompounded.🔽Others, fearing such consequences,

original: dpag pa de lta bus 'jigs nas smras pa /
analyzed: dpag pa de lta bus 'jigs nas smras pa /
translated: say that the past exists.

original: de ni dmigs pa ma yin gyi sngon po la sogs pa'i rkyen gyi mjug thogs kho nar sngon po la sogs par snang ba 'byung ba na de la dmigs pa zhes bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: de ni dmigs pa ma yin gyi sngon po la sogs pa'i rkyen gyi mjug thogs kho nar sngon po la sogs par snang ba 'byung ba na de la dmigs pa zhes bya'o zhe na /
translated: It is not the object, but rather the appearance of blue, etc. that occurs immediately following the condition of blue, etc. is called the object.

original: de'i dmigs pa'i dngos po yin par khas mi len na de'i rkyen gyi dngos po gzhan gang yin te ;
analyzed: de'i dmigs pa'i dngos po yin par khas mi len na de'i rkyen gyi dngos po gzhan gang yin te ;
translated: If you do not accept that it is the object of the sense faculty, then what is the other thing that is the condition of the sense faculty?

original: khyed cag ni dmigs pa'i dngos po rang gi rnam par 'byung ba kho na yin par smra'o //
analyzed: khyed cag ni dmigs pa'i dngos po rang gi rnam par 'byung ba kho na yin par smra'o //
translated: You say that the object of the sense faculty is only the appearance of the object.

original: rgyu lnga po de dag ni bsdu ba dang / dus kyi rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: rgyu lnga po de dag ni bsdu ba dang / dus kyi rnam par gzhag go //
translated: These five causes are included in the two times.

original: bsdu ba yang don dam par yod pa dang / brdar btags pa yod pa'i tshig gnyis kyis bstan to //
analyzed: bsdu ba yang don dam par yod pa dang / brdar btags pa yod pa'i tshig gnyis kyis bstan to //
translated: The inclusion is taught by the two phrases “ultimate existence” and “conventional existence.”🔽The immediately past is the cause of the present, such as the cause of the arising of the visual sense faculty.🔽This is the time of the immediately past cause.

original: 'gags ma thag pa ni 'di lta ste mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu'o zhes bya ba ni mjug thogs su spyod par 'gyur ba ste /🔽bye brag des rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: 'gags ma thag pa ni 'di lta ste mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu'o zhes bya ba ni mjug thogs su spyod par 'gyur ba ste / bye brag des rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The long past is the cause of the present, such as the cause of the arising of the visual sense faculty.

original: 'gags nas ring du lon pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'gags nas ring du lon pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: This is the time of the long past cause.

original: 'phen pa'i rgyu'o zhes bya ba ni dge ba dang mi dge ba'i 'du byed rnams kyi bag chags kyi 'jug pas 'bras bu skyed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'phen pa'i rgyu'o zhes bya ba ni dge ba dang mi dge ba'i 'du byed rnams kyi bag chags kyi 'jug pas 'bras bu skyed par byed pa'o //
translated: The projecting cause is the cause of the projecting of the effect by the power of the latent impressions of the formative forces, whether they be wholesome or unwholesome.

original: sdug pa'i rgyu zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i bag chags dang mthun pa'i phyogs gcig yin no //🔽mi sdug pa'i rgyu zhes bya ba ni mi dge ba'i bag chags dang mthun pa'i phyogs gcig yin no //🔽brta ba'i rgyu zhes bya ba ni zas kyis bsdus pa ste /
analyzed: sdug pa'i rgyu zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i bag chags dang mthun pa'i phyogs gcig yin no // mi sdug pa'i rgyu zhes bya ba ni mi dge ba'i bag chags dang mthun pa'i phyogs gcig yin no // brta ba'i rgyu zhes bya ba ni zas kyis bsdus pa ste /
translated: The cause of the agreeable is one part of the cause of the wholesome latent impressions.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs gcig kho na yin no //🔽'jug pa'i rgyu zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i rgyu dang de kho na la lta ba'i rgyu ma gtogs pa de las gzhan pa'o //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs gcig kho na yin no // 'jug pa'i rgyu zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i rgyu dang de kho na la lta ba'i rgyu ma gtogs pa de las gzhan pa'o //

original: ldog pa'i rgyu zhes bya ba ni ma gtogs pa gang yin pa gnyis so //🔽'di lta ste mi rtag pa'i rgyu yin gyi zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ldog pa'i rgyu zhes bya ba ni ma gtogs pa gang yin pa gnyis so //🔽'di lta ste mi rtag pa'i rgyu yin gyi zhes bya ba la /
