original: kha cig na re rtag pa zhes bya ba ni med par dgag pa la bya ste /
analyzed: kha cig na re rtag pa zhes bya ba ni med par dgag pa la bya ste /
translated: Some say: “Permanence” is a non-implicative negation.

original: de'i phyir rtag pa'i chos ni skye ba'i rgyu la sogs pas gang gi rgyur yang mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pas de nyid rnam par 'grel bar byed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir rtag pa'i chos ni skye ba'i rgyu la sogs pas gang gi rgyur yang mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pas de nyid rnam par 'grel bar byed do //
translated: Therefore, they explain that a permanent phenomenon is not a cause of anything, such as arising, etc.

original: de lta ma yin du zin na skyes la 'gags pa zhes bya ba de dang khyad par med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin du zin na skyes la 'gags pa zhes bya ba de dang khyad par med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were not so, it would be no different from “arisen and ceased.”

original: 'di ltar skyes la 'gags pa zhes bya ba ni skye ba dang 'gags pa dang ldan pa yin no zhes 'chad do //
analyzed: 'di ltar skyes la 'gags pa zhes bya ba ni skye ba dang 'gags pa dang ldan pa yin no zhes 'chad do //
translated: Thus they explain that “arisen and ceased” is to possess arising and cessation.

original: 'das pa ni dngos po med pa'i phyir rgyu'i dngos po med pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'das pa ni dngos po med pa'i phyir rgyu'i dngos po med pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: They say: “The past is not a cause because it is a non-entity.”

original: mi rtag pa'i chos mi rtag pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba yang zhes bya ba ni ma yin par dgag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i chos mi rtag pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba yang zhes bya ba ni ma yin par dgag par 'gyur te /
translated: “Also, a impermanent phenomenon is not a cause of an impermanent phenomenon” is an implicative negation.

original: mi rtag pa nyid rgyu yin no zhes bya ba 'dis ni snga ma nyid gtan la 'bebs par byed do //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid rgyu yin no zhes bya ba 'dis ni snga ma nyid gtan la 'bebs par byed do //
translated: This statement “Impermanence is a cause” confirms the former statement.

original: skyes la 'gags pa zhes gang 'byung ba des ni 'das pa nyid brjod @127b pa yin te /
analyzed: skyes la 'gags pa zhes gang 'byung ba des ni 'das pa nyid brjod @127b pa yin te /
translated: The phrase “arisen and ceased” indicates the past.

original: rgyu'i khyad par brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu'i khyad par brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: This is because the specific cause is intended to be expressed.

original: yang kha cig na re ji ltar 'das pa ni dngos po med pa yin yang bag chags la sogs pa'i tshul gyi rgyu yin pa de bzhin du bstan pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: yang kha cig na re ji ltar 'das pa ni dngos po med pa yin yang bag chags la sogs pa'i tshul gyi rgyu yin pa de bzhin du bstan pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say: Just as the past is a cause in the manner of latent impressions and so on, it is taught to be a cause in the same way.

original: rtag pa ni gang gi rgyur yang mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rtag pa ni gang gi rgyur yang mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: Permanence is not a cause of anything.

original: kha cig na re rgyu'i don rnam pa bcu po dag tu mi rung ba'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig na re rgyu'i don rnam pa bcu po dag tu mi rung ba'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say: Because it is not suitable as a cause in any of the ten ways.

original: 'o na yongs su 'dzin pa'i rgyu ni dbang po dang yul la sogs pa dag yin no zhes ma smos so zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na yongs su 'dzin pa'i rgyu ni dbang po dang yul la sogs pa dag yin no zhes ma smos so zhe na /
translated: But if that is so, then the sense faculties and objects are not stated to be the cause of the appropriator.

original: de'i yul ni 'dus byas yin par 'dod de /
analyzed: de'i yul ni 'dus byas yin par 'dod de /
translated: The object of the appropriator is asserted to be conditioned states.

original: yongs su 'dzin pa'i don yin par smras pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pa'i don yin par smras pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said to be the meaning of the appropriator.

original: de lta na lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu yin par 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: de lta na lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu yin par 'gyur ro ;
translated: In that case, it would be a coemergent cause.

original: / yang kha cig na re gzhan yang rgyu ni rnam par bdun du gzhag pa yin te zhes bya ba'i tshig de ni 'dren pa dang / 'phen pa dang / mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu las bsams pa yin te 'di ltar phyi ma'i rgyur gyur gyi skad cig de nyid kyi ma yin pa la sogs pas de las gzhan pa'i rgyu dag las khyad par du bstan pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: / yang kha cig na re gzhan yang rgyu ni rnam par bdun du gzhag pa yin te zhes bya ba'i tshig de ni 'dren pa dang / 'phen pa dang / mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu las bsams pa yin te 'di ltar phyi ma'i rgyur gyur gyi skad cig de nyid kyi ma yin pa la sogs pas de las gzhan pa'i rgyu dag las khyad par du bstan pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say: Moreover, the word “also” in the statement “There is also another presentation of seven types of causes” refers to the projecting cause and the establishing cause. Thus, it is taught that the other causes are different from those two causes, since they are causes of future states and not of that very moment.

original: yang kha cig na re dngos po yin pa'i phyir de ni skyed pa'i rgyu'i mtshan nyid kho na yin te /
analyzed: yang kha cig na re dngos po yin pa'i phyir de ni skyed pa'i rgyu'i mtshan nyid kho na yin te /
translated: Some say: It is only the characteristic of the productive cause, because it is a real entity.

original: de'i phyir 'di ltar mi rtag pa'i chos mi rtag pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ltar mi rtag pa'i chos mi rtag pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore, it is said that “impermanent dharmas are the cause of impermanent dharmas” and so on.

original: skyes la 'gags pa zhes bya ba des ni ma 'ongs pa 'gog par byed do //
analyzed: skyes la 'gags pa zhes bya ba des ni ma 'ongs pa 'gog par byed do //
translated: The phrase “having arisen and ceased” refutes the idea that the cause is future.

original: kha cig na re skyes la zhes bya ba ni da ltar byung ba la bya'o //
analyzed: kha cig na re skyes la zhes bya ba ni da ltar byung ba la bya'o //
translated: Some say: The phrase “having arisen” refers to the present.

original: 'gags pa zhes bya ba ni 'das pa la bya'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'gags pa zhes bya ba ni 'das pa la bya'o zhes zer ro //
translated: The past is called “ceased” because it has ceased.

original: yang kha cig na re de ni 'das pa kho na yin par gsungs so zhes kyang zer ro //
analyzed: yang kha cig na re de ni 'das pa kho na yin par gsungs so zhes kyang zer ro //
translated: Some say: It is said to be only the past.

original: yang kha cig na re skyes la ma 'gags pa zhes bya bar brjod de /
analyzed: yang kha cig na re skyes la ma 'gags pa zhes bya bar brjod de /
translated: Others say: It is called “arisen but not ceased.”

original: de dag gi rnam par rtog pa yang gnyis te /
analyzed: de dag gi rnam par rtog pa yang gnyis te /
translated: Their theories are twofold:

original: da ltar byung ba dang 'das pa dag da ltar byung ba yin par rtog go //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba dang 'das pa dag da ltar byung ba yin par rtog go //
translated: They imagine that the present and the past are the present.

original: mi rtag pa'i chos mi rtag pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba yang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i chos mi rtag pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba yang zhes bya ba la /
translated: “The impermanent cause of the impermanent” means

original: ji ltar na 'thob pa'i rgyu la 'bras bu mi rtag par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'thob pa'i rgyu la 'bras bu mi rtag par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: how can the cause of obtainment be impermanent?

original: sems dang sems las byung ba rnam par grol ba'i byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba rnam par grol ba'i byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the activity of the mind and mental factors is liberation.

original: dngos po gzhan zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dngos po gzhan zhes bya ba la /
translated: “Another entity” means

original: dngos po gzhan gyi ni dus mnyam pa'am dus phyi ma'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: dngos po gzhan gyi ni dus mnyam pa'am dus phyi ma'i rgyu yin no //
translated: the cause of another entity is simultaneous or subsequent.

original: rang gi ngo bo phyi ma'i rgyur 'gyur gyi zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo phyi ma'i rgyur 'gyur gyi zhes bya ba la /
translated: “The cause of the future of its own nature” means

original: rang gi ngo bo la ni phyi ma'i rgyur 'gyur te /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo la ni phyi ma'i rgyur 'gyur te /
translated: It is a cause of the subsequent entity in the sense of being its intrinsic nature.

original: dper na mig ni mjug thogs su 'byung ba'i mig gi rgyu yin pa lta bu'o //🔽des ni sngar 'byung bar sems par smra ba dag gis @128a * //
analyzed: dper na mig ni mjug thogs su 'byung ba'i mig gi rgyu yin pa lta bu'o // des ni sngar 'byung bar sems par smra ba dag gis @128a * //
translated: For example, the eye is the cause of the subsequent eye that arises.

original: nyes pa'i lan yang btab pa yin no //
analyzed: nyes pa'i lan yang btab pa yin no //
translated: This also answers the objection raised by the proponents of the theory of the prior nonexistence of effect that the effect would not arise if the cause were to cease.

original: de bas na skad cig de nyid kyi ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngo bo kho na dang sbyar ba yin no //🔽snga ma las gyur na byed kyi ma gyur bar mi byed do zhes bya ba ni rkyen gyi rgyur 'gyur bar byed pa na 'bras bu'i rkyen gyi bya ba byed pa la bya'o //🔽mthun zhing 'phrod pa las 'byung gi zhes bya ba ni de yang mthu yin te /
analyzed: de bas na skad cig de nyid kyi ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngo bo kho na dang sbyar ba yin no // snga ma las gyur na byed kyi ma gyur bar mi byed do zhes bya ba ni rkyen gyi rgyur 'gyur bar byed pa na 'bras bu'i rkyen gyi bya ba byed pa la bya'o // mthun zhing 'phrod pa las 'byung gi zhes bya ba ni de yang mthu yin te /
translated: Therefore, the phrase “not in that moment” refers only to the intrinsic nature.🔽If the effect arises from the prior cause, it is produced by the cause, but not if it does not exist prior to the cause.🔽The phrase “arises from a concordant and suitable combination” means that the cause is a condition in the sense of a supporting condition.

original: gal te mthun par gyur na ni rang dang mthun par skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te mthun par gyur na ni rang dang mthun par skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase “concordant” means that the effect arises in accordance with its cause.

original: 'phrod par 'gyur na ni gzhan gyis skyed pa'i rkyen gyis dngos por 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'phrod par 'gyur na ni gzhan gyis skyed pa'i rkyen gyis dngos por 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase “suitable” means that the effect is produced by the supporting condition.

original: de la mtshan nyid gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de la mtshan nyid gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba la /
translated: What is the presentation of the designation of characteristics?

original: de la zhes bya ba ni khams dang mtshan nyid tshul bzhin dang zhes bya ba de la mtshan nyid gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa gang zhe na zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni khams dang mtshan nyid tshul bzhin dang zhes bya ba de la mtshan nyid gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa gang zhe na zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Here means in the presentation of the elements and characteristics.

original: rtog pa dang dpyod pa rnams kyi lus gang zhe na /🔽rtog pa dang dpyod pa rnams dmigs pa la mngon par mi rtogs pa ni sems pa'i lus yin la zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rtog pa dang dpyod pa rnams kyi lus gang zhe na / rtog pa dang dpyod pa rnams dmigs pa la mngon par mi rtogs pa ni sems pa'i lus yin la zhes bya ba la /
translated: What is the body of investigation and analysis?🔽The body of investigation and analysis is the mental body that does not investigate and analyze objects.

original: dmigs pa mngon par mi rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni nye bar brtag par bya ba'i dngos po la nges par mi rtog pa ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa mngon par mi rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni nye bar brtag par bya ba'i dngos po la nges par mi rtog pa ste /
translated: The mental body that does not investigate and analyze objects is the mental body that does not ascertain objects.

original: de'i tshe na shes rab med pa'i sems pa 'ba' zhig la gdags pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe na shes rab med pa'i sems pa 'ba' zhig la gdags pa yin no //
translated: At that time, it is merely designated as intention that lacks wisdom.

original: rtog pa dang dpyod pa rnams dmigs pa la mngon par rtogs pa ni shes pa'i lus yin par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni de'i tshe na sems pa yang yod mod kyi gtso bo ma yin te /
analyzed: rtog pa dang dpyod pa rnams dmigs pa la mngon par rtogs pa ni shes pa'i lus yin par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni de'i tshe na sems pa yang yod mod kyi gtso bo ma yin te /
translated: Although there is volition at that time, it is not the principal factor,

original: bya ba byed pa'i tshe na shes rab kyis skabs rnyed pas zil gyis non pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bya ba byed pa'i tshe na shes rab kyis skabs rnyed pas zil gyis non pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because when it is functioning, it is overwhelmed by wisdom, which has obtained the opportunity.

original: de'i phyir de'i tshe na sems pa de la rtog pa dang dpyod par gdags pa med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i tshe na sems pa de la rtog pa dang dpyod par gdags pa med do //
translated: Therefore, at that time, volition is not designated as investigation and analysis.

original: 'di ltar yang dag pa'i shes pa'i ngo bo nyid ni yang dag pa'i rtog pa kho na yin no zhes 'og nas kyang 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'di ltar yang dag pa'i shes pa'i ngo bo nyid ni yang dag pa'i rtog pa kho na yin no zhes 'og nas kyang 'byung ngo //
translated: Thus, it will be said below that the nature of right knowledge is right investigation alone.

original: 'di la lung ni bsam gtan pa rnam par 'byed pa zhes bya ba'i mdo las btsun pa rtog pa dang dpyod pa rnams kyi dngos po gang lags /
analyzed: 'di la lung ni bsam gtan pa rnam par 'byed pa zhes bya ba'i mdo las btsun pa rtog pa dang dpyod pa rnams kyi dngos po gang lags /
translated: Here, the scripture is the Sūtra on the Analysis of Meditative Concentration, which states, “Venerable One, what is the substance of investigation and analysis?

original: dge slong rtog pa dang dpyod pa rnams kyi dngos po ni sems pa dang shes rab yin no //
analyzed: dge slong rtog pa dang dpyod pa rnams kyi dngos po ni sems pa dang shes rab yin no //
translated: Bhikṣus, the substance of investigation and analysis is volition and wisdom.”

original: btsun pa rtog pa dang dpyod pa rnams kyi gdags pa gang lags /
analyzed: btsun pa rtog pa dang dpyod pa rnams kyi gdags pa gang lags /
translated: Venerable, what is the designation of applied thought and sustained thought?

original: dge slong rtog pa dang dpyod pa rnams kyi gdags pa ni yid la brjod pa'i sgo nas 'jug pa'i sems pa dang shes rab yin no zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong rtog pa dang dpyod pa rnams kyi gdags pa ni yid la brjod pa'i sgo nas 'jug pa'i sems pa dang shes rab yin no zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Bhikṣus, the designation of applied thought and sustained thought is the intention and wisdom that engage through mental expression.

original: ci rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag sems gcig la yod dam zhe na /
analyzed: ci rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag sems gcig la yod dam zhe na /
translated: Do applied thought and sustained thought exist in one mind?

original: gal te skad cig las brtsams te smra na ni med de /
analyzed: gal te skad cig las brtsams te smra na ni med de /
translated: If one begins with a moment, they do not exist,

original: gcig ni yongs @128b su tshol ba'i rnam pa yin pa'i phyir ba dang / cig shos ni so sor rtog pa'i rnam pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig ni yongs @128b su tshol ba'i rnam pa yin pa'i phyir ba dang / cig shos ni so sor rtog pa'i rnam pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one is the aspect of thorough search and the other is the aspect of discernment.

original: rnam pa tha dad pa yin pa'i phyir tshor ba dang 'du shes bzhin du mtshungs par ldan pa kho na ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa tha dad pa yin pa'i phyir tshor ba dang 'du shes bzhin du mtshungs par ldan pa kho na ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Aren’t they only concomitant because they are different aspects, like feeling and discernment?

original: de gnyis ni mtshungs par ldan par rigs te /
analyzed: de gnyis ni mtshungs par ldan par rigs te /
translated: Those two are suitable to be concomitant,

original: rdzas tha dad pa yin pa'i phyir ba dang / dus mi mthun pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdzas tha dad pa yin pa'i phyir ba dang / dus mi mthun pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are different substances and because they do not have different times.

original: rtog pa dang dpyod pa gnyis ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rtog pa dang dpyod pa gnyis ni ma yin te /
translated: But they are not applied thought and sustained thought,

original: rdzas gcig pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ba dang / don yongs su btsal nas de'i 'og tu so sor rtog par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdzas gcig pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ba dang / don yongs su btsal nas de'i 'og tu so sor rtog par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are by nature the same substance and because, having sought the meaning, one then discerns it.

original: gal te rgyun las bsams te smra na ni de'i phyir yod do //
analyzed: gal te rgyun las bsams te smra na ni de'i phyir yod do //
translated: If you say that they exist because they are considered in a continuum,🔽then the same text says:

original: de la yang mdo de nyid las btsun pa rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag ji ltar rjes su 'jug par 'gyur /
analyzed: de la yang mdo de nyid las btsun pa rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag ji ltar rjes su 'jug par 'gyur /
translated: “Venerable, how do applied thought and sustained thought occur?

original: dge slong rgyun gyis ni rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag na sems gcig la rjes su 'jug par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: dge slong rgyun gyis ni rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag na sems gcig la rjes su 'jug par 'gyur gyi /
translated: The elder Kauṇḍinya said, ‘Monks, applied thought and sustained thought occur in the same mind.

original: skye bas ni ma yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: skye bas ni ma yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: They do not occur in different minds.’

original: de la rtog pa dang dpyod pa rnams kyi dmigs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la rtog pa dang dpyod pa rnams kyi dmigs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the object of applied thought and sustained thought?

original: ming gi tshogs dang tshig gi tshogs dang yi ge'i tshogs la brten pa'i don ni dmigs pa yin no zhes bya ba la tshogs la brten pa'i don zhes bya ba ni de dag gis brjod par bya ba'o //
analyzed: ming gi tshogs dang tshig gi tshogs dang yi ge'i tshogs la brten pa'i don ni dmigs pa yin no zhes bya ba la tshogs la brten pa'i don zhes bya ba ni de dag gis brjod par bya ba'o //
translated: The object is the meaning that is based on the collection of names, the collection of phrases, and the collection of letters.

original: ji ltar na de dag gis dmigs pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na de dag gis dmigs pa yin zhe na /
translated: How can they be the cognitive object of the mental consciousness?

original: de ni rnam pa dang 'brel bas yul la 'jug pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa dang 'brel bas yul la 'jug pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the mental consciousness is associated with mental factors, it engages its object by way of mental factors.

original: de bas na yid la brjod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na yid la brjod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That is why it is called mental discourse.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa dag la ji ltar rung zhe na /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa dag la ji ltar rung zhe na /
translated: How can the visual consciousness, etc., be mental discourse?

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pas 'phangs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pas 'phangs pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because they are projected by the mental consciousness,

original: zhe sdang la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: zhe sdang la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: like hatred, etc.

original: kha cig na re nye bar gnas pa las byung ba las ni de dag mi srid pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig na re nye bar gnas pa las byung ba las ni de dag mi srid pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say: They are not possible in the mental consciousness that arises from actual material form.

original: yang kha cig na re nye bar gnas pa las byung ba yang mngon par brjod pa dang 'brel pa kho nas don la 'jug pa yin te /
analyzed: yang kha cig na re nye bar gnas pa las byung ba yang mngon par brjod pa dang 'brel pa kho nas don la 'jug pa yin te /
translated: Some say: The mental consciousness that arises from actual material form engages its object by being associated with mental discourse.

original: de lta ma yin na de'i don mngon par brjod pa'i mtshan nyid thams cad dang bral ba la yid kyi rnam par shes pas sngon po'o zhes nges par bya zhing sgro 'dogs par yang mi rigs so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na de'i don mngon par brjod pa'i mtshan nyid thams cad dang bral ba la yid kyi rnam par shes pas sngon po'o zhes nges par bya zhing sgro 'dogs par yang mi rigs so zhes zer ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would not be possible for the mental consciousness to ascertain and designate the object of the eye consciousness, which is devoid of all the characteristics of mental discourse.

original: dper na rjes las thob pa'i ye shes kyis ngas 'di lta bu dang mngon bar rdzogs par khong du chud do zhes mngon par rtogs pa mngon par 'jog par byed kyang /
analyzed: dper na rjes las thob pa'i ye shes kyis ngas 'di lta bu dang mngon bar rdzogs par khong du chud do zhes mngon par rtogs pa mngon par 'jog par byed kyang /
translated: For example, the wisdom of subsequent attainment, having attained this or that realization, posits the realization I have realized this.

original: mngon par rtogs pa la rnam par rtog pa med pa de bzhin du 'di la yang rung bar 'gyur ba ma yin nam /🔽'di ltar rnal 'byor pa'i rjes las thob pa'i ye shes kyis ni 'di lta bu kho nar rtogs pa ma yin te /🔽'on kyang thabs byung ba de dag gis @129a * //
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa la rnam par rtog pa med pa de bzhin du 'di la yang rung bar 'gyur ba ma yin nam / 'di ltar rnal 'byor pa'i rjes las thob pa'i ye shes kyis ni 'di lta bu kho nar rtogs pa ma yin te / 'on kyang thabs byung ba de dag gis @129a * //
translated: But it is not the case that the wisdom of meditative equipoise is like that, for it is free of conceptualization.

original: rtogs par byed pa yin no //🔽snga ma yang de lta bu yin te /
analyzed: rtogs par byed pa yin no // snga ma yang de lta bu yin te /
translated: The wisdom of subsequent attainment of a yogi does not realize this or that object in that way, but it is realized by the means of the method of arising from meditative equipoise.

original: 'di ltar yid kyi rnam par shes pas ni de lta bu kho nar rtogs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar yid kyi rnam par shes pas ni de lta bu kho nar rtogs pa ma yin te /
translated: The former is also like that, for the mental consciousness does not realize this or that object in that way.

original: de ni myong ba dang brda'i thabs kyis de'i 'og tu rnam par 'jog par byed do zhe na /
analyzed: de ni myong ba dang brda'i thabs kyis de'i 'og tu rnam par 'jog par byed do zhe na /
translated: It is posited as that by the means of experience and signs.

original: de ni mi rung ste /
analyzed: de ni mi rung ste /
translated: That is illogical.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa la sngon por snang ba'i mjug thogs su byung ba yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang de'i rnam pa dang 'dra bar khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa la sngon por snang ba'i mjug thogs su byung ba yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang de'i rnam pa dang 'dra bar khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is accepted that the mental consciousness that occurs immediately after the eye consciousness perceiving blue has the same aspect.

original: de dang mthun pa'i phyir snga ma la yang mngon bar brjod pa yod par rjes su dpag tu rung ngo //
analyzed: de dang mthun pa'i phyir snga ma la yang mngon bar brjod pa yod par rjes su dpag tu rung ngo //
translated: And it is possible to infer that the prior perception also had a verbal report, because it is similar to the latter.

original: de bzhin nyid kyi ye shes dang rjes las thob pa'i ye shes gnyis la ni 'dra ba chung zad kyang med de /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi ye shes dang rjes las thob pa'i ye shes gnyis la ni 'dra ba chung zad kyang med de /
translated: But there is not the slightest similarity between the gnosis of reality and the subsequently acquired gnosis.

original: gcig ni shin tu rnam par mi rtog pa yin pa'i phyir ba dang / cig shos ni gzung ba dang 'dzin par sgro 'dogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig ni shin tu rnam par mi rtog pa yin pa'i phyir ba dang / cig shos ni gzung ba dang 'dzin par sgro 'dogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The former is utterly nonconceptual, while the latter is the postdiscursive state of the former and is the conceptualization of subject and object.

original: dmigs pa de nyid la gtod cing zhes bya ba ni mtshan ma la sems kyis yongs su tshol ba ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa de nyid la gtod cing zhes bya ba ni mtshan ma la sems kyis yongs su tshol ba ste /
translated: Directing the mind to that very object means to investigate the object with the mind.

original: nges par rtog pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: nges par rtog pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the ascertainment.

original: bye brag tu gtong pa zhes bya ba ni de bzhin du so sor rtog cing mjug sdud par byed pa'o //
analyzed: bye brag tu gtong pa zhes bya ba ni de bzhin du so sor rtog cing mjug sdud par byed pa'o //
translated: To relinquish means to conclude by discerning in that way.

original: mngon par rtogs pa'i dus na ni yongs su brtsal ba las nges par rtog go //
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa'i dus na ni yongs su brtsal ba las nges par rtog go //
translated: At the time of realization, one ascertains through investigation.

original: mngon par mi rtogs pa la ni yongs su brtsal ba las nges par rtog pa med de kun nas slong ba tsam du zad do //
analyzed: mngon par mi rtogs pa la ni yongs su brtsal ba las nges par rtog pa med de kun nas slong ba tsam du zad do //
translated: When there is no realization, there is no ascertainment through investigation, but only a mere instigation.

original: de ltar na de gnyis ni shes rab dang sems pa'i rjes su 'jug pa dang go rims bzhin du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na de gnyis ni shes rab dang sems pa'i rjes su 'jug pa dang go rims bzhin du bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, these two are taught in order, as following wisdom and intention.

original: ngag kun nas slong ngo zhes bya ba ni tshig kun nas slong bar byed pa la bya'o //
analyzed: ngag kun nas slong ngo zhes bya ba ni tshig kun nas slong bar byed pa la bya'o //
translated: “One instigates speech” means one instigates speech.

original: yang na de dag las ngag kun nas 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: yang na de dag las ngag kun nas 'byung ba ste /
translated: Or, from those two, one instigates speech.

original: de dag sngon du 'gro zhing tha snyad kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag sngon du 'gro zhing tha snyad kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because those two precede and are the cause of conventional usage.

original: rab tu dbye ba rnam pa bdun te /
analyzed: rab tu dbye ba rnam pa bdun te /
translated: There are seven types of distinctions:

original: mtshan ma can dang mtshan ma can ma yin pa nas /
analyzed: mtshan ma can dang mtshan ma can ma yin pa nas /
translated: having signs, not having signs,🔽and so on.

original: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i bar du snga ma bzhin no zhes bya ba ni mtshan ma can dang / mtshan ma can ma yin pa dang / rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa dang / tshol ba pa dang / so sor rtog pa dang /🔽nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa rnams la bya'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i bar du snga ma bzhin no zhes bya ba ni mtshan ma can dang / mtshan ma can ma yin pa dang / rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa dang / tshol ba pa dang / so sor rtog pa dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa rnams la bya'o //
translated: The meditative attainment of cessation is the most excellent of the wholesome, etc.

translated: The phrase “pretas with great magical power” should be understood as referring to some animals,

original: de dang 'dra bas na sngar yang phyogs gcig tu byas pa'i phyir brjod pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: de dang 'dra bas na sngar yang phyogs gcig tu byas pa'i phyir brjod pa kho na yin no //
translated: because they are similar to pretas. Therefore, they are mentioned here as a single group.

original: gcig tu nges par nang gi sdug pa'i yul gyi 'dus te reg pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gcig tu nges par nang gi sdug pa'i yul gyi 'dus te reg pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The phrase “contact that is pleasant in its effects and is internal” refers to

original: nang gi zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan las skyes pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nang gi zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan las skyes pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the internal because it arises from the meditative absorptions.🔽The phrase “contact that is definitely pleasant” refers to the attainment of

original: gcig tu nges par bde ba dang mi 'bral bar 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni bde ba thob pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig tu nges par bde ba dang mi 'bral bar 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni bde ba thob pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: pleasure.

original: de la tshul bzhin yid la byed pa gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de la tshul bzhin yid la byed pa gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba la /
translated: What is the presentation of the designation of proper mental attention?

original: de la zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Here, the phrase “here” refers to

original: khams dang mtshan nyid tshul bzhin dang zhes bya ba de la 'dir tshul bzhin yid la byed pa gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: khams dang mtshan nyid tshul bzhin dang zhes bya ba de la 'dir tshul bzhin yid la byed pa gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Here, what is the correct method of mental attention?

original: gnas rnam pa drug ste /
analyzed: gnas rnam pa drug ste /
translated: There are six types of bases:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: 1. the time of certainty,🔽2. the time of turning away,🔽3. the time of karma,🔽4. the time of worldly detachment,🔽5. the time of supramundane detachment,

original: nges pa'i dus dang / ldog pa'i dus dang / las kyi dus dang / 'jig rten pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'i dus dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'i dus dang / sems can la phan 'dogs pa'i dus so zhes bya ba la /🔽dang po ni dad pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rtog pa dang dpyod pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: nges pa'i dus dang / ldog pa'i dus dang / las kyi dus dang / 'jig rten pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'i dus dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'i dus dang / sems can la phan 'dogs pa'i dus so zhes bya ba la / dang po ni dad pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rtog pa dang dpyod pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: 6. the time of benefiting sentient beings.🔽The first is for those with faith, the second is for those with shame and conscience,🔽the third is for those with effort,🔽the fourth is for those with concentration,

original: gnyis pa ni ngo tsha shes pa dang khrel yod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni ngo tsha shes pa dang khrel yod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: the fifth is for those with wisdom,🔽and the sixth is for those with skillful means.🔽The first is for those with faith, the second is for those with shame and conscience,🔽the third is for those with effort,🔽the fourth is for those with concentration,🔽the fifth is for those with wisdom,🔽and the sixth is for those with skillful means.

original: gsum pa ni brtson 'grus dang bcas shing ma chags pa la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: gsum pa ni brtson 'grus dang bcas shing ma chags pa la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: The third is for those who are associated with vigor, nonattachment, etc.

original: bzhi pa ni shin tu sbyangs mtshungs par ldan pa rnams kyi'o //🔽lnga pa ni bag yod pa @130a * //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni shin tu sbyangs mtshungs par ldan pa rnams kyi'o // lnga pa ni bag yod pa @130a * //
translated: The fourth is for those who are associated with pliancy.

original: dang btang snyoms dang mtshungs par ldan pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: dang btang snyoms dang mtshungs par ldan pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: The fifth is for those who are associated with heedfulness and equanimity.

original: drug pa ni rnam par mi 'tshe ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa rnams kyi gnas yin no //
analyzed: drug pa ni rnam par mi 'tshe ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa rnams kyi gnas yin no //
translated: The sixth is for those who are associated with nonviolence.

original: ji ltar na nges pa'i dus dang dad pa'i gnas yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na nges pa'i dus dang dad pa'i gnas yin zhe na /
translated: How are they the basis of conviction and faith?

original: dad pas ni mos par dka' ba la yang de ni bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa yin no zhes mos par byed la mos pa ni nges pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dad pas ni mos par dka' ba la yang de ni bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa yin no zhes mos par byed la mos pa ni nges pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Faith is conviction in the teaching of the Blessed One, even when it is difficult to understand.

original: tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dang ldan pa'i rtog pa dang dpyod pa rnams kyi dngos po gang zhe na /
analyzed: tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dang ldan pa'i rtog pa dang dpyod pa rnams kyi dngos po gang zhe na /
translated: What is the object of the conceptual thoughts and the investigations associated with proper mental attention?

original: dngos po brgyad de /
analyzed: dngos po brgyad de /
translated: It is the eight objects.

original: sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po dang / tshul khrims las byung ba dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba dang / thos pa las byung ba dang / bsams pa las byung ba dang / de las gzhan pa'i bsgoms pa las byung ba dang /
analyzed: sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po dang / tshul khrims las byung ba dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba dang / thos pa las byung ba dang / bsams pa las byung ba dang / de las gzhan pa'i bsgoms pa las byung ba dang /
translated: The first is the meritorious action that arises from giving, the second is the meritorious action that arises from morality, the third is the meritorious action that arises from meditation, the fourth is the meritorious action that arises from hearing, the fifth is the meritorious action that arises from reflection, the sixth is the meritorious action that arises from other meditations,

original: so sor brtags pa las byung ba dang / sems can la phan 'dogs pa las byung ba'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: so sor brtags pa las byung ba dang / sems can la phan 'dogs pa las byung ba'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: the seventh is the meritorious action that arises from investigation, and the eighth is the meritorious action that arises from benefiting sentient beings.

original: dang po dad pas mngon par bsgrubs pa'i rtog pa dang dpyod pa rnams kyi dngos po'o //
analyzed: dang po dad pas mngon par bsgrubs pa'i rtog pa dang dpyod pa rnams kyi dngos po'o //
translated: The first is the entity of the conceptualization and investigation accomplished by faith.

original: lhag ma rnams ni ngo tsha shes pa dang / khrel yod pas bsgrubs pa dang / ma chags pa dang zhe sdang med pas bsgrubs pa dang / gti mug med pas bsgrubs pa dang / brtson 'grus kyis bsgrubs pa dang / shin tu sbyangs pas bsgrubs pa dang /
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni ngo tsha shes pa dang / khrel yod pas bsgrubs pa dang / ma chags pa dang zhe sdang med pas bsgrubs pa dang / gti mug med pas bsgrubs pa dang / brtson 'grus kyis bsgrubs pa dang / shin tu sbyangs pas bsgrubs pa dang /
translated: The remaining ones are accomplished by shame, accomplished by modesty, accomplished by non-attachment, accomplished by non-hatred, accomplished by non-delusion, accomplished by effort, accomplished by pliancy,

original: bag yod pa dang btang snyoms kyis bsgrubs pa dang / rnam par mi 'tshe bas bsgrubs pa'i dngos po rnams te go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: bag yod pa dang btang snyoms kyis bsgrubs pa dang / rnam par mi 'tshe bas bsgrubs pa'i dngos po rnams te go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: and those accomplished by conscientiousness, equanimity, and non-violence, respectively.

original: de las gzhan pa'i bsgoms pa las zhes 'byung ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i bsgoms pa las zhes 'byung ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: The others are cultivated by means of the eight things.

original: de las gzhan pa'i zhes bya ba ni byams pa la sogs pa dag ma gtogs pa'i'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i zhes bya ba ni byams pa la sogs pa dag ma gtogs pa'i'o //
translated: The others are those other than love, etc.

original: dngos po brgyad dag kyang mi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i gnyen po dang / shin tu dag pas ma yin pa dang / shin tu dag pa dang / lta ba dang / sgrib pa rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: dngos po brgyad dag kyang mi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i gnyen po dang / shin tu dag pas ma yin pa dang / shin tu dag pa dang / lta ba dang / sgrib pa rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: The eight things are: the antidote to the roots of non-virtue, the absence of complete purity, complete purity, the purification of views, and the purification of obscurations.

original: de dag kyang tshig gnyis dang / gsum dang / gcig dang / gcig dang go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: de dag kyang tshig gnyis dang / gsum dang / gcig dang / gcig dang go rims bzhin no //
translated: They are two, three, one, and one, respectively.

original: tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dang ldan pa'i rtog pa dang dpyod pa rnams kyi tshal pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dang ldan pa'i rtog pa dang dpyod pa rnams kyi tshal pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the nature of the investigation and analysis that are associated with proper mental attention?

original: 'di ltar 'di na kha cig ces bya ba la /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di na kha cig ces bya ba la /
translated: Here, some, having heard the Dharma from another,

original: 'di ltar 'di na kha cig ces bya ba'i tshig ni dper na brjod pa tsam yongs su bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di na kha cig ces bya ba'i tshig ni dper na brjod pa tsam yongs su bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase “in this way, some” is used to indicate that this is merely an example.

original: chags pa zhes bya ba ni kun nas dkris pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa la bya'o //
analyzed: chags pa zhes bya ba ni kun nas dkris pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa la bya'o //
translated: “Attachment” refers to the fetters and the secondary mental afflictions.

original: zhen pa zhes bya ba ni de nyid kyi rgyur 'brel pa la bya'o //
analyzed: zhen pa zhes bya ba ni de nyid kyi rgyur 'brel pa la bya'o //
translated: “Clinging” refers to the connection with the cause of those.

original: mtshungs pa zhes bya ba ni lhag par yongs @130b su 'dzin pa la bya'o //
analyzed: mtshungs pa zhes bya ba ni lhag par yongs @130b su 'dzin pa la bya'o //
translated: “Equality” refers to the excessive grasping.

original: mdud pa bor ba zhes bya ba ni de nyid kyi rgyur 'brel pa la bya'o //
analyzed: mdud pa bor ba zhes bya ba ni de nyid kyi rgyur 'brel pa la bya'o //
translated: “Bondage” refers to the connection with the cause of those.

original: brgyal ba zhes bya ba ni ches lhag pa la bya'o //
analyzed: brgyal ba zhes bya ba ni ches lhag pa la bya'o //
translated: “Swooning” refers to the excessive.

original: lhag par chags pa zhes bya ba ni brgyal nas de'i bla ma'i tshig mi nyan pa la sogs pa la bya'o //
analyzed: lhag par chags pa zhes bya ba ni brgyal nas de'i bla ma'i tshig mi nyan pa la sogs pa la bya'o //
translated: “Excessive attachment” refers to the point at which one no longer listens to the words of one’s spiritual teachers, etc.

original: lhag par chags par gyur pa zhes bya ba de nyid kyi rgyun dang 'brel ba la bya'o ;
analyzed: lhag par chags par gyur pa zhes bya ba de nyid kyi rgyun dang 'brel ba la bya'o ;
translated: “Becoming excessively attached” refers to the continuity of that.

original: / nyes dmigs su mi lta ba zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir de nyid mtshan du ngoms mi myong bar zhing de la gzhol bar byed pa la bya'o //
analyzed: / nyes dmigs su mi lta ba zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir de nyid mtshan du ngoms mi myong bar zhing de la gzhol bar byed pa la bya'o //
translated: The phrase not viewing them as faults means that one does not become satisfied with the mere signs of those and one is devoted to that field.

original: nges par 'byung ba mi shes bzhin du zhes bya ba ni nges par 'byung ba rab tu mi shes pa la bya ste /
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba mi shes bzhin du zhes bya ba ni nges par 'byung ba rab tu mi shes pa la bya ste /
translated: The phrase without knowing the means of deliverance means that one does not know the means of deliverance.🔽The phrase without knowing the means of deliverance means that one does not know the means of deliverance.

original: de dag las bzlog pa ni chags pa med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig rnams dang go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: de dag las bzlog pa ni chags pa med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig rnams dang go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: The opposite of those is the absence of attachment, etc.

original: yang dag par sgrub pa gang zhe na /🔽'di ltar 'di na kha cig mar 'dzin pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: yang dag par sgrub pa gang zhe na / 'di ltar 'di na kha cig mar 'dzin pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: What is right practice?🔽Here, some people honor their mother and father, etc.

original: mar 'dzin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig rnams ni bla ma'i gnas dang / de las gzhan pa'i gnas la mchod pa bya ba las brtsams pa yin te /
analyzed: mar 'dzin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig rnams ni bla ma'i gnas dang / de las gzhan pa'i gnas la mchod pa bya ba las brtsams pa yin te /
translated: The words honoring one's mother and father and so on begin the discussion of the worship of those who are in a position of authority and of those who are in other positions.

original: de la bla ma rnams ni phan 'dogs pas gtso bo rnams dang / yon tan gyis gtso bo rnams dang / rigs kyis gtso bo rnams te /
analyzed: de la bla ma rnams ni phan 'dogs pas gtso bo rnams dang / yon tan gyis gtso bo rnams dang / rigs kyis gtso bo rnams te /
translated: The gurus are the most important in terms of benefit, the most important in terms of virtue, and the most important in terms of family.

original: de dag la bsam pa thag pa nas mchod pa bya ba'i phyir te tshig lngas bstan to //
analyzed: de dag la bsam pa thag pa nas mchod pa bya ba'i phyir te tshig lngas bstan to //
translated: One should worship them with a sincere mind. This is indicated by the first five words.

original: sbyor ba ni tshig gcig gis so //
analyzed: sbyor ba ni tshig gcig gis so //
translated: The application is indicated by the next word.

original: de mar 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni ma dang / rjes su mthun par byed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de mar 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni ma dang / rjes su mthun par byed pa'i phyir te /
translated: One should be like a son to one's mother, because one acts in accordance with her.

original: dper na yid du 'ong ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na yid du 'ong ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, one should be like a son who is dear to his mother.

original: phar 'dzin pa zhes bya ba yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: phar 'dzin pa zhes bya ba yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: One should be like a son to one's father, because he is the one who gives birth.

original: dge sbyong du 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni dge sbyong rnams legs par byed do //
analyzed: dge sbyong du 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni dge sbyong rnams legs par byed do //
translated: One should be like a son to the virtuous, because they are the ones who make one virtuous.

original: bram zer 'dzin pa zhes bya ba yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: bram zer 'dzin pa zhes bya ba yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: One should be like a son to the brahmans, because they are the ones who make one a brahman.

original: rigs kyi gtso bo la rim gro byed pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rigs kyi gtso bo la rim gro byed pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: One should serve the most important of the family,

original: rigs kyi gtso bo rnams ni phu bo la sogs pa dag ste /
analyzed: rigs kyi gtso bo rnams ni phu bo la sogs pa dag ste /
translated: the most important of the family being the elder brother and so on.

original: de dag la zhes bya ba la sogs pa byed pa ni de dag la rim gro byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag la zhes bya ba la sogs pa byed pa ni de dag la rim gro byed pa yin no //
translated: The phrase to them and so on indicates the service.

original: don byed pa zhes bya ba ni thams cad kyi bya ba sgrub par byed pa la bya'o //
analyzed: don byed pa zhes bya ba ni thams cad kyi bya ba sgrub par byed pa la bya'o //
translated: The phrase to do what is to be done means to accomplish all that needs to be done.

original: de las gzhan pa la mchod pa byed pa zhes bya ba ni thabs gang gis byed pa dang / ci zhig byed pa ste /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa la mchod pa byed pa zhes bya ba ni thabs gang gis byed pa dang / ci zhig byed pa ste /
translated: The phrase to worship those other than them indicates the means by which one acts and what one does.

original: de dag kyang bya ba byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig rnams kyis yongs su bstan te /
analyzed: de dag kyang bya ba byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig rnams kyis yongs su bstan te /
translated: These are indicated by the phrases to do what is to be done and so on.

original: de la thabs ni rigs pas byed pa yin pa'i phyir bya ba byed pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: de la thabs ni rigs pas byed pa yin pa'i phyir bya ba byed pa kho na yin no //
translated: Among them, the means is to do what is to be done because it is done in a proper manner.

original: ltos pa ni 'jig rten gnyis kar yang kha na ma tho ba rnams la 'jigs par lta ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: ltos pa ni 'jig rten gnyis kar yang kha na ma tho ba rnams la 'jigs par lta ba nyid yin te /
translated: The phrase to be fearful means to be fearful of the misdeeds in both worlds.

original: 'jig rten 'di dang 'jig rten pha rol du kha na ma tho ba rnams la 'jigs par lta ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di dang 'jig rten pha rol du kha na ma tho ba rnams la 'jigs par lta ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is said that one is fearful of the misdeeds in this world and the next world.

original: ci zhig byed ce na /
analyzed: ci zhig byed ce na /
translated: What does one do?

original: sbyin pa dag @131a * //
analyzed: sbyin pa dag @131a * //
translated: One gives gifts,

original: sbyin zhing bsod nams dag byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa dag go /
analyzed: sbyin zhing bsod nams dag byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa dag go /
translated: They give and make merit.🔽The four characteristics of a donor are stated in the sutra called The Basis of Merit:

original: yang sbyin bdag gi mtshan nyid rnam pa bzhi ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po zhes bya ba'i mdo las sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po gang zhe na /
analyzed: yang sbyin bdag gi mtshan nyid rnam pa bzhi ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po zhes bya ba'i mdo las sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po gang zhe na /
translated: What is the basis of merit that arises from giving?

original: 'di ltar 'di na kha cig dge sbyong rnams dang / bram ze rnams dang / bkren pa rnams dang / sdug phongs pa rnams dang / 'dren pa rnams dang / slong mo rnams la 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di na kha cig dge sbyong rnams dang / bram ze rnams dang / bkren pa rnams dang / sdug phongs pa rnams dang / 'dren pa rnams dang / slong mo rnams la 'di lta ste /
translated: In this world, some give gifts to virtuous ascetics, brahmins, the poor, the destitute, the sick, and beggars,

original: zas dang / skom dang / bca' ba dang / bza' ba dang / bzhon pa dang / gos dang / phreng ba dang / spos dang / byug pa dang / gnas dang / mar me sbyin pa dag sbyin par byed de /
analyzed: zas dang / skom dang / bca' ba dang / bza' ba dang / bzhon pa dang / gos dang / phreng ba dang / spos dang / byug pa dang / gnas dang / mar me sbyin pa dag sbyin par byed de /
translated: such as food and drink, snacks and meals, vehicles, clothes, garlands, incense, ointments, dwellings, and lamps.🔽The result of that is resources.

original: de'i 'bras bu ni longs spyod yin no zhes bya ba gsungs pa'i mdo sde'i dum bu yin te /
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu ni longs spyod yin no zhes bya ba gsungs pa'i mdo sde'i dum bu yin te /
translated: This is a passage from a sutra.

original: 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni sbyin par byed pa ni de'i ngang tshul can yin pa'i phyir sbyin pa po zhes bya ba'o zhes gang gsungs pa la bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni sbyin par byed pa ni de'i ngang tshul can yin pa'i phyir sbyin pa po zhes bya ba'o zhes gang gsungs pa la bya'o //
translated: The term desire should be understood as referring to the one who is in that state of mind, i.e., the one who is giving.

original: phyogs mi 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni gang dge slong dang bram ze rnams dang thams cad la sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa la bya'o //
analyzed: phyogs mi 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni gang dge slong dang bram ze rnams dang thams cad la sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa la bya'o //
translated: The term not taking sides should be understood as referring to the one who gives gifts to all, i.e., to virtuous ascetics and brahmans.

original: phongs pa sel ba zhes bya ba ni gang zas dang skom la sogs pas phongs pa dag la zas dang skom la sogs pa'i sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa la bya'o //
analyzed: phongs pa sel ba zhes bya ba ni gang zas dang skom la sogs pas phongs pa dag la zas dang skom la sogs pa'i sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa la bya'o //
translated: The term removing distress should be understood as referring to the one who gives gifts of food and drink, etc. to those who are in distress for food and drink, etc.

original: yang dag par shes pa zhes bya ba ni gang gis sbyin pa'i 'bras bu longs spyod yin par shes pa la bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag par shes pa zhes bya ba ni gang gis sbyin pa'i 'bras bu longs spyod yin par shes pa la bya'o //
translated: The term correct knowledge should be understood as referring to the one who knows that the result of generosity is enjoyment.

original: tshul khrims dang ldan pa'i mtshan nyid ni rnam pa bzhi ste zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims kyi phung por gtogs pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang ldan pa'i mtshan nyid ni rnam pa bzhi ste zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims kyi phung por gtogs pa'i mdo las /
translated: The characteristics of morality are fourfold.

original: tshul khrims las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po gang zhe na zhes bya ba rgya cher gsungs pa mdor bsdus te brjod par bya na /🔽'di la ston pa 'jig rten du byung zhing dam pa'i chos thog mar dge ba la sogs pa'i bar dag ston par mdzad na khyim bdag gam /
analyzed: tshul khrims las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po gang zhe na zhes bya ba rgya cher gsungs pa mdor bsdus te brjod par bya na / 'di la ston pa 'jig rten du byung zhing dam pa'i chos thog mar dge ba la sogs pa'i bar dag ston par mdzad na khyim bdag gam /
translated: In brief, the Buddha taught:

original: khyim bdag gi bu chos de nyan par byed do //
analyzed: khyim bdag gi bu chos de nyan par byed do //
translated: When the Teacher appears in the world and initially teaches the Dharma, such as the virtuous aggregates, a householder or the son of a householder hears that Dharma.🔽Having heard that Dharma, he obtains faith and goes forth, abandoning taking life and so on, up to abandoning wrong views.

original: des chos de thos nas kyang dad pa rab tu 'thob pa dang / rab tu byung ba'i bar dang / srog gcod pa spong bar byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bar dang / de tshul khrims kyi phung po de dang ldan pas dbang po rnams kyi sgo gcod de dran pa kun tu srung zhing gnas so zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang /
analyzed: des chos de thos nas kyang dad pa rab tu 'thob pa dang / rab tu byung ba'i bar dang / srog gcod pa spong bar byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bar dang / de tshul khrims kyi phung po de dang ldan pas dbang po rnams kyi sgo gcod de dran pa kun tu srung zhing gnas so zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang /
translated: Endowed with that aggregate of morality, he guards the doors of the sense faculties, protects mindfulness, and so on.🔽The result of that morality is rebirth in the higher realms.

original: tshul khrims de'i 'bras bu ni mtho ris yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa'i mdo sde'i dum bu yin te /
analyzed: tshul khrims de'i 'bras bu ni mtho ris yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa'i mdo sde'i dum bu yin te /
translated: This is a passage from a sutra.

original: 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni dad pa rab tu thob pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa la bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni dad pa rab tu thob pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa la bya'o //
translated: The term desire should be understood as referring to the statement: he obtains supreme faith.

original: chu lon @131b gyi glon pa zhes bya ba de srog gcod pa spong bar byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa la bya'o //
analyzed: chu lon @131b gyi glon pa zhes bya ba de srog gcod pa spong bar byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa la bya'o //
translated: The term dam should be understood as referring to the statement: he becomes one who abstains from killing living beings.

original: kun tu mi spyod pa zhes bya ba ni dbang po rnams kyi sgo bcad de dran pa kun tu srung zhing gnas so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa la bya ste /
analyzed: kun tu mi spyod pa zhes bya ba ni dbang po rnams kyi sgo bcad de dran pa kun tu srung zhing gnas so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa la bya ste /
translated: The term non-performance should be understood as referring to the statement: he closes the doors to the senses, guards his mindfulness, and remains focused.

original: de'i 'gro ba dang 'dug pa'i gnas skabs dag la 'chal pa'i tshul khrims kun tu 'byung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i 'gro ba dang 'dug pa'i gnas skabs dag la 'chal pa'i tshul khrims kun tu 'byung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no occurrence of immorality in the states of his going and staying.

original: yang dag par shes pa zhes bya ba ni gang gis tshul khrims kyi 'bras bu mtho ris yin par shes pa la bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag par shes pa zhes bya ba ni gang gis tshul khrims kyi 'bras bu mtho ris yin par shes pa la bya'o //
translated: The term correct knowledge should be understood as referring to the knowledge that the result of morality is rebirth in the heavens.

original: sgom pa po'i mtshan nyid ni rnam pa bzhi ste zhes bya ba yang /
analyzed: sgom pa po'i mtshan nyid ni rnam pa bzhi ste zhes bya ba yang /
translated: The term cultivator should be understood as referring to the four types of characteristics of the cultivator.

original: 'di ltar 'di na kha cig byams pa dang ldan pa'i sems kho na med pa /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di na kha cig byams pa dang ldan pa'i sems kho na med pa /
translated: without harm,🔽vast,🔽great,

original: 'gran zla med pa /
analyzed: 'gran zla med pa /
translated: immeasurable,🔽and well cultivated, resolves on one direction, pervades it, accomplishes it, and dwells there.🔽In the same way, with a mind full of love,🔽without rivals,

original: gnod pa med pa ;
analyzed: gnod pa med pa ;
translated: without harm,🔽vast,🔽great,🔽immeasurable,🔽and well cultivated, he resolves on the second direction, pervades it, accomplishes it, and dwells there.🔽In the same way, with a mind full of love,🔽without rivals,🔽without harm,🔽vast,🔽great,

original: yangs pa / rgya chen por gyur pa /
analyzed: yangs pa / rgya chen por gyur pa /
translated: immeasurable,🔽and well cultivated, he resolves on the third direction, pervades it, accomplishes it, and dwells there.🔽In the same way, with a mind full of love,

original: mi gnyis pa /
analyzed: mi gnyis pa /
translated: without rivals,🔽without harm,🔽vast,🔽great,🔽immeasurable,

original: tshad med pa shin tu bsgoms pas phyogs gcig tu mos par byas te khyab par byas nas bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: tshad med pa shin tu bsgoms pas phyogs gcig tu mos par byas te khyab par byas nas bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: and well cultivated, he resolves on the fourth direction, pervades it, accomplishes it, and dwells there.

original: de bzhin du gnyis pa dang / de bzhin du gsum pa dang / de bzhin du bzhi pa dang / bla dang / 'og dang / thad kar rnam pa thams cad du thams cad dang ldan pa'i 'jig rten 'di byams pa dang ldan pa'i sems kho na med pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du gnyis pa dang / de bzhin du gsum pa dang / de bzhin du bzhi pa dang / bla dang / 'og dang / thad kar rnam pa thams cad du thams cad dang ldan pa'i 'jig rten 'di byams pa dang ldan pa'i sems kho na med pa /
translated: In the same way, with a mind full of love,

original: 'gran zla med pa /
analyzed: 'gran zla med pa /
translated: without rivals,🔽without harm,🔽vast,🔽great,🔽immeasurable,🔽and well cultivated, he resolves on the zenith, pervades it, accomplishes it, and dwells there.🔽In the same way, with a mind full of love,🔽without rivals,

original: gnod pa med pa /
analyzed: gnod pa med pa /
translated: without harm,🔽vast,🔽great,

original: yangs pa / rgya chen por gyur pa /
analyzed: yangs pa / rgya chen por gyur pa /
translated: immeasurable,🔽and well cultivated, he resolves on the nadir, pervades it, accomplishes it, and dwells there.🔽In the same way, with a mind full of love,

original: mi gnyis pa /
analyzed: mi gnyis pa /
translated: without rivals,🔽without harm,🔽vast,🔽great,🔽immeasurable,

original: tshad med pa shin tu bsgoms pas mos te khyab par byas nas bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: tshad med pa shin tu bsgoms pas mos te khyab par byas nas bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: and well cultivated, he resolves on all directions, pervades them, accomplishes them, and dwells there.

original: de'i rnam par smin pa yang tshangs pa'i 'jig rten yin no zhes gsungs pa'i mdo sde'i dum bu yin te /
analyzed: de'i rnam par smin pa yang tshangs pa'i 'jig rten yin no zhes gsungs pa'i mdo sde'i dum bu yin te /
translated: This is a passage from a sutra.

original: de la bsam pa rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba ni byams pa dang ldan pa'i sems kho na med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa la bya'o //
analyzed: de la bsam pa rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba ni byams pa dang ldan pa'i sems kho na med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa la bya'o //
translated: Here, pure thought refers to the mind possessing love, which is said to be nonviolent and so on.

original: nye bar sbyor ba rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba ni phyogs gcig tu zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: nye bar sbyor ba rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba ni phyogs gcig tu zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Pure application refers to the statement that he pervades one direction,

original: rnam pa thams cad du thams cad dang ldan pa'i 'jig rten 'di khyab par byas nas bsgrubs te gnas so zhes bya ba'i bar du gang gsungs pa la bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du thams cad dang ldan pa'i 'jig rten 'di khyab par byas nas bsgrubs te gnas so zhes bya ba'i bar du gang gsungs pa la bya'o //
translated: pervades this world in all aspects and accomplishes and dwells.

original: shes pa rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba ni gang gis bsgom pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po'i rnam par smin pa tshangs pa'i 'jig rten yin par shes pa la bya'o //
analyzed: shes pa rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba ni gang gis bsgom pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po'i rnam par smin pa tshangs pa'i 'jig rten yin par shes pa la bya'o //
translated: Pure knowledge refers to the knowledge that the karmic maturation of the entity of merit derived from meditation is the Brahma world.

original: da ni zas sbyin pa rnam pa drug ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas sbyin pa las byung ba la sogs pa bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po mdo sde las gsungs pa'i tshig rnams rnam par 'jog par byed de /
analyzed: da ni zas sbyin pa rnam pa drug ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas sbyin pa las byung ba la sogs pa bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po mdo sde las gsungs pa'i tshig rnams rnam par 'jog par byed de /
translated: Now, the six types of giving food and so on are the six types of giving food, drink, clothing, transportation, flower garlands, and ointments.

original: 'dir zas sbyin pa rnam pa drug po dag ni dge sbyong rnams dang / bram ze rnams dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig drug dang go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //🔽gnod @132a * //
analyzed: 'dir zas sbyin pa rnam pa drug po dag ni dge sbyong rnams dang / bram ze rnams dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig drug dang go rims bzhin du sbyar ro // gnod @132a * //
translated: The six types of giving food are connected with the six phrases beginning with “to ascetics and brahmins” in the sutra.

original: pa ni rnam pa brgyad de zhes bya ba rnams kyang zas dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig rnams dang go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: pa ni rnam pa brgyad de zhes bya ba rnams kyang zas dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig rnams dang go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The eight types of harm are connected with the phrases beginning with “food” in the sutra.

original: bca' pa dang bza' ba gnyis ni kha zas ngan pa za bas gnod pa zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: bca' pa dang bza' ba gnyis ni kha zas ngan pa za bas gnod pa zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: The two types of food and drink are connected with the phrase “harm through eating bad food.”

original: yang gnod pa ni rnam pa drug ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yang gnod pa ni rnam pa drug ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: The six types of harm are connected with the phrase “harm through the six types of contact.”

original: 'dir yang lhan cig skyes pa zhes bya ba ni bkres pa dang skom pa la bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir yang lhan cig skyes pa zhes bya ba ni bkres pa dang skom pa la bya ste /
translated: Here, “innate” refers to hunger and thirst.

original: de'i gnyen por zas skom sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: de'i gnyen por zas skom sbyin par byed do //
translated: The antidote to that is giving food and drink.

original: de bzhin du 'dod pas phongs pa las byung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa dag kyang bca' ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa mdo sde las gsungs pa'i tshig gnyis pa dang / re re dang go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //🔽de las bzlog pa ni phan gdags pa ni rnam pa drug ste zhes bya ba rnams dang ci rigs su sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dod pas phongs pa las byung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa dag kyang bca' ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa mdo sde las gsungs pa'i tshig gnyis pa dang / re re dang go rims bzhin du sbyar ro // de las bzlog pa ni phan gdags pa ni rnam pa drug ste zhes bya ba rnams dang ci rigs su sbyar te /
translated: Similarly, the two phrases in the sutra, “from the suffering of being tormented by desire” and so on, and “from the suffering of being tormented by heat” and so on, are respectively connected with the two phrases, “from the suffering of being tormented by hunger” and so on, and “from the suffering of being tormented by thirst” and so on.

original: de yang zas dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa mdo sde las gsungs pa'i tshig bzhi dang re re dang go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: de yang zas dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa mdo sde las gsungs pa'i tshig bzhi dang re re dang go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: The opposite of that is the six kinds of benefit, which are respectively connected with the four phrases in the sutra, “from the suffering of being tormented by hunger” and so on, and “from the suffering of being tormented by thirst” and so on.

original: mi mdza' ba'i mtshan nyid ni bzhi ste zhes bya ba dag ni kho na med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig bzhi las bzlog pa yin te /
analyzed: mi mdza' ba'i mtshan nyid ni bzhi ste zhes bya ba dag ni kho na med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig bzhi las bzlog pa yin te /
translated: The four characteristics of enemies are the opposite of the four phrases beginning with “absence of hostility.”

original: de las 'khrug pa'i bsam pa mi gtong ba zhes bya ba ni kho na med pa zhes gang gsungs pa las go bzlog pa yin no //
analyzed: de las 'khrug pa'i bsam pa mi gtong ba zhes bya ba ni kho na med pa zhes gang gsungs pa las go bzlog pa yin no //
translated: The phrase “not abandoning the intention to quarrel” is the opposite of the phrase “absence of hostility.”

original: byams pa dang ldan pa'i sems zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: byams pa dang ldan pa'i sems zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'i tshig yin no //
translated: The phrase “a thought endowed with loving kindness” is the statement of the teaching.

original: sdug pa la rnam par bgegs byed pa'i gnas zhes bya ba ni 'gran zla med pa zhes gsungs pa las bzlog pa yin no //
analyzed: sdug pa la rnam par bgegs byed pa'i gnas zhes bya ba ni 'gran zla med pa zhes gsungs pa las bzlog pa yin no //
translated: The phrase “an object that is a hindrance to what is dear” is the opposite of the phrase “an object that is not a hindrance to what is dear.”

original: mi sdug pa bsgrub pa dang phan pa ma yin pa sgrub pa'o zhes bya ba la kha cig na re gnod pa la bya ste /
analyzed: mi sdug pa bsgrub pa dang phan pa ma yin pa sgrub pa'o zhes bya ba la kha cig na re gnod pa la bya ste /
translated: The phrase “the accomplishment of what is unattractive and the accomplishment of what is not beneficial” means that some say that it is harm.

original: de las bzlog pa ni gnod pa med pa zhes gsungs pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni gnod pa med pa zhes gsungs pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: The opposite of that is the phrase “not harmful.”

original: yang kha cig na re mdo sde gzhan dag las tshad med pa bzhi ni bsgoms pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po yin no zhes gsungs pas na de dag gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni mdza' ba'i mtshan nyid bzhi po smos pa dag yin no
analyzed: yang kha cig na re mdo sde gzhan dag las tshad med pa bzhi ni bsgoms pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po yin no zhes gsungs pas na de dag gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni mdza' ba'i mtshan nyid bzhi po smos pa dag yin no
translated: Moreover, some say that since it is stated in other sūtras that the four immeasurables are the bases of meritorious action that arise from meditation, the four characteristics of friendship are the opposites of those.

original: // go rims bzhin du sbyar ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: // go rims bzhin du sbyar ro zhes zer ro //
translated: They should be applied in order.

original: yo byad kyi bde ba bsgrub pa ni 'dod pa'i khams na'o //
analyzed: yo byad kyi bde ba bsgrub pa ni 'dod pa'i khams na'o //
translated: The accomplishment of the happiness of material well-being is in the desire realm.

original: dga' ba dang bcas pa'i bde ba bsgrub pa zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan gnyis pa man chad du dga' ba dang bcas pa'i bde ba nye bar bsgrub pa la bya'o //
analyzed: dga' ba dang bcas pa'i bde ba bsgrub pa zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan gnyis pa man chad du dga' ba dang bcas pa'i bde ba nye bar bsgrub pa la bya'o //
translated: The attainment of equanimity is in the fourth absorption and above.

original: dga' ba med pa'i bde ba bsgrub pa zhes bya ba ni de'i gong ma la ste /
analyzed: dga' ba med pa'i bde ba bsgrub pa zhes bya ba ni de'i gong ma la ste /
translated: The attainment of equanimity is in the fourth absorption and above.🔽The attainment of equanimity is in the fourth absorption and above.🔽The attainment of equanimity is in the fourth absorption and above.🔽The attainment of equanimity is in the fourth absorption and above.🔽The attainment of equanimity is in the fourth absorption and above.

original: yang mthun par 'jug par khas blangs pa ni bzhi po 'di dag yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po'i zhar la smos pa yin te /
analyzed: yang mthun par 'jug par khas blangs pa ni bzhi po 'di dag yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po'i zhar la smos pa yin te /
translated: The four types of harmonious engagement are mentioned in the context of meritorious action:

original: 'dir mdo sde las mkhas pa rnams kyis bstan pa dang / skyes bu dam pa rnams kyis bstan pa dang / skyes bu ngan pa rnams kyis bstan pa dang / mdzangs pa rnams kyis bsngags pa dang / shes pa rnams kyis ma smad pa dag ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: 'dir mdo sde las mkhas pa rnams kyis bstan pa dang / skyes bu dam pa rnams kyis bstan pa dang / skyes bu ngan pa rnams kyis bstan pa dang / mdzangs pa rnams kyis bsngags pa dang / shes pa rnams kyis ma smad pa dag ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: Here, the wise teach four types of teaching: teaching by holy beings, teaching by evil beings, praise by the wise, and blame by the ignorant.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: sbyin pa ni mkhas pa rnams kyis bstan pa dang / shes pa rnams kyis ma smad pa'i bar dag yin no //
analyzed: sbyin pa ni mkhas pa rnams kyis bstan pa dang / shes pa rnams kyis ma smad pa'i bar dag yin no //
translated: Giving is taught by the wise and is not blamed by the wise.

original: srog chags 'byung po thams cad la mi 'tshe ba dang / pha dang ma la bsnyen bkur byed pa dang legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu byung zhing bsnyen par rdzogs pa dge slong gi dngos po mkhas pa rnams kyis bstan pa dang /
analyzed: srog chags 'byung po thams cad la mi 'tshe ba dang / pha dang ma la bsnyen bkur byed pa dang legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu byung zhing bsnyen par rdzogs pa dge slong gi dngos po mkhas pa rnams kyis bstan pa dang /
translated: They do not harm any living being, they respect their parents, they go forth into the well-spoken Dharma and Vinaya, they become fully ordained monks, they are skilled in the teachings of the wise,

original: shes pa rnams kyis ma smad pa'i bar dag yin te /
analyzed: shes pa rnams kyis ma smad pa'i bar dag yin te /
translated: and they are not reproached by the wise.

original: sbyin dang mi 'tshe yang dag sdom //
analyzed: sbyin dang mi 'tshe yang dag sdom //
translated: Generosity, non-violence, and perfect restraint,🔽self-control, serving one's parents,

original: dul dang pha ma bsnyen bkur dang // zhi ba nyid dang tshangs spyod ni //
analyzed: dul dang pha ma bsnyen bkur dang // zhi ba nyid dang tshangs spyod ni //
translated: peacefulness, and pure conduct

original: dam pa rnams kyis bstan pa ste //
analyzed: dam pa rnams kyis bstan pa ste //
translated: are taught by the noble ones.

original: gang dag mkhas pas bstan bya'i gnas //
analyzed: gang dag mkhas pas bstan bya'i gnas //
translated: These are the bases taught by the wise.

original: de dag yang dag mthong na ni //
analyzed: de dag yang dag mthong na ni //
translated: When one sees them correctly,

original: mthong ba rdzogs pa'i 'phags par 'gyur //
analyzed: mthong ba rdzogs pa'i 'phags par 'gyur //
translated: one becomes an ārya who has completed the view.

original: de ni 'jig rten yin zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni 'jig rten yin zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: This is what is called the world.

original: mkhas pas bstan pa rnam pa bzhi po de dag dang mthun par 'jug par khas blang ba bzhi po rnams su go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: mkhas pas bstan pa rnam pa bzhi po de dag dang mthun par 'jug par khas blang ba bzhi po rnams su go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: The four assertions should be applied in order to the four types of teachings by the wise.

original: de la skye bo yongs la mthun par 'jug pa khas blang ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de la skye bo yongs la mthun par 'jug pa khas blang ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: The first is called the vow to engage in conduct that is agreeable to all people.

original: skye bo yongs zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad la bya ste /
analyzed: skye bo yongs zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad la bya ste /
translated: All people means all sentient beings,

original: yongs zhes bya ba'i sgra ni kun gyi don yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs zhes bya ba'i sgra ni kun gyi don yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the word all has the meaning of totality.

original: tshogs par 'du 'os la mthun par 'jug par khas blang ba zhes bya ba la tshogs par 'du 'os zhes bya ba ni 'di'i tshul khrims la gnas pa gang yin pa'o //🔽longs spyod che ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'bras bu rnams ni phan gdags pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: tshogs par 'du 'os la mthun par 'jug par khas blang ba zhes bya ba la tshogs par 'du 'os zhes bya ba ni 'di'i tshul khrims la gnas pa gang yin pa'o // longs spyod che ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'bras bu rnams ni phan gdags pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: The second is called the vow to engage in conduct that is agreeable to those who are worthy of being gathered in the assembly. Those who are worthy of being gathered in the assembly are those who abide in morality.🔽The results of the first are stated in the passage beginning with great wealth, and the results of the second are stated in the passage beginning with benefiting others.

original: skal ba mnyam pa dang mthun par 'jug pa zhes bya ba tha ma'i 'bras bu ni mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa dang / bde 'gror 'gro ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang mdo sde las gsungs pa'i tshig mthong ba rdzogs pa'i 'phags @133a * //
analyzed: skal ba mnyam pa dang mthun par 'jug pa zhes bya ba tha ma'i 'bras bu ni mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa dang / bde 'gror 'gro ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang mdo sde las gsungs pa'i tshig mthong ba rdzogs pa'i 'phags @133a * //
translated: The third is called the vow to engage in conduct that is agreeable to those who are similar to oneself. The ultimate result of this vow is the attainment of nirvana and rebirth in happy forms of life, as stated in the sutra.

original: bar 'gyur / de ni 'jig rten yin zhes gsungs pa dang sbyar te /
analyzed: bar 'gyur / de ni 'jig rten yin zhes gsungs pa dang sbyar te /
translated: and the world is the remainder.

original: de la mya ngan las 'das pa thob pas mthong ba rdzogs pa'i 'phags pa yin la /
analyzed: de la mya ngan las 'das pa thob pas mthong ba rdzogs pa'i 'phags pa yin la /
translated: The first is the ārya who has completed seeing, who has attained nirvana.

original: lhag ma rnams ni 'jig rten na zhi ba la brten pa yin par gsungs so //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni 'jig rten na zhi ba la brten pa yin par gsungs so //
translated: The remainder are said to be those who rely on mundane peace.🔽The wise have three characteristics.

original: mkhas pa rnams kyis mkhas pa'i mtshan nyid ni gsum po 'di dag yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di yang snga ma bzhin du tshul khrims kyi phung po'i rgyud du gtogs pa las gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: mkhas pa rnams kyis mkhas pa'i mtshan nyid ni gsum po 'di dag yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di yang snga ma bzhin du tshul khrims kyi phung po'i rgyud du gtogs pa las gsungs pa yin te /
translated: This is also stated in the chapter on the aggregate of ethics.

original: bye brag tu na ste dran pa dang shes bzhin dam pa de dang ldan zhing /
analyzed: bye brag tu na ste dran pa dang shes bzhin dam pa de dang ldan zhing /
translated: In particular, they have the highest mindfulness and introspection.

original: shing drung dag gam grong stong dag gi gnas mal dben pa dag tu gnas par byed de /
analyzed: shing drung dag gam grong stong dag gi gnas mal dben pa dag tu gnas par byed de /
translated: They live in solitary places such as the foot of a tree or an empty building.

original: der skyil mo krung bcas nas dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i bar du byas te 'dug nas /
analyzed: der skyil mo krung bcas nas dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i bar du byas te 'dug nas /
translated: There, they sit cross-legged and practice the four establishments of mindfulness.

original: des 'jig rten la brnab sems spangs shing brnab sems dang bral ba'i sems kyis len mang du gnas so //
analyzed: des 'jig rten la brnab sems spangs shing brnab sems dang bral ba'i sems kyis len mang du gnas so //
translated: He abides with a mind free from covetousness, having abandoned covetousness for the world.

original: de bzhin du sgrib pa lnga po dag la yang brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du sgrib pa lnga po dag la yang brjod par bya ste /
translated: The same should be said for the five hindrances.

original: de ni ma nur las rgal zhing the tshom las rgal nas dge ba'i chos rnams la the tshom med cing the tshom las sems yongs su sbyong bar byed do //
analyzed: de ni ma nur las rgal zhing the tshom las rgal nas dge ba'i chos rnams la the tshom med cing the tshom las sems yongs su sbyong bar byed do //
translated: He has crossed over the swamp, crossed over the doubt, and is without doubt about the wholesome dharmas. He purifies his mind of doubt.

original: des sgrib pa lnga po dag spangs nas 'dod pa rnams las dben pa zhes bya ba nas bsam gtan bzhi pa'i bar dag bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: des sgrib pa lnga po dag spangs nas 'dod pa rnams las dben pa zhes bya ba nas bsam gtan bzhi pa'i bar dag bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: Having abandoned the five hindrances, he abides having attained the four meditations, which are free from desires, free from negative influences, and are accompanied by enjoyment and concentration.

original: des de ltar sems yongs su dag pa dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi mngon par rtogs pa'i bar dag la brten nas zag pa zad pa rjes su thob po zhes gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: des de ltar sems yongs su dag pa dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi mngon par rtogs pa'i bar dag la brten nas zag pa zad pa rjes su thob po zhes gsungs pa ste /
translated: In this way, he attains the purification of his mind and the clear seeing of the four noble truths. He attains the destruction of the contaminants through the clear seeing of the four noble truths.

original: de la dge ba yang dag par len pa zhes bya ba ni rab tu 'byung bar byed do zhes gang gsungs pa la bya'o //
analyzed: de la dge ba yang dag par len pa zhes bya ba ni rab tu 'byung bar byed do zhes gang gsungs pa la bya'o //
translated: Here, the phrase “he takes up the wholesome” should be understood as “he goes forth.”

original: dge ba la gcig tu nges par zhes bya ba ni de dge ba'i chos rnams la the tshom med cing zhes bya ba nas bsam gtan bzhi pa'i bar dag bsgrubs te gnas so zhes gang gsungs pa'i bar dag la bya'o //
