analyzed: dge ba la gcig tu nges par zhes bya ba ni de dge ba'i chos rnams la the tshom med cing zhes bya ba nas bsam gtan bzhi pa'i bar dag bsgrubs te gnas so zhes gang gsungs pa'i bar dag la bya'o //
translated: The phrase “they are certain to be virtuous” refers to the passage that states, “They are free of doubt about virtuous qualities. . . . They accomplish and maintain the four meditative states of the dhyānas.”

original: dge ba la bstan pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi mngon par rtogs pa zhes gang gsungs pa la bya ste /
analyzed: dge ba la bstan pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi mngon par rtogs pa zhes gang gsungs pa la bya ste /
translated: The phrase “they are virtuous” refers to the passage that states, “They realize the four noble truths.”

original: de ltar dge ba dag las yongs su mi mnyam pa'i chos can yin no //
analyzed: de ltar dge ba dag las yongs su mi mnyam pa'i chos can yin no //
translated: Thus, they are not subject to the degeneration of virtue.

original: gzhan yang gsum ste zhes bya ba yang mdo sde de nyid las gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang gsum ste zhes bya ba yang mdo sde de nyid las gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The phrase “there are three other” is also from that same sūtra.

original: de dag kyang rab tu 'byung ba dang / bsam gtan rnams dang zag pa zad pa'i bar dag dang go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: de dag kyang rab tu 'byung ba dang / bsam gtan rnams dang zag pa zad pa'i bar dag dang go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: They are to be applied in the same order as the passage that states, “They go forth. . . . They attain the destruction of the contaminations.”

original: kha cig ni gsum po dag tshul khrims kyi phung po tsam gyi rgyud du gtogs pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: kha cig ni gsum po dag tshul khrims kyi phung po tsam gyi rgyud du gtogs pa'i mdo las /
translated: Some say that these three are included in the continuum of a person who possesses only the aggregate of morality.

original: de nyid bsam gtan dang bcas pa dang de nyid mngon par rtogs pa dang @133b bcas par 'byung ba dang go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: de nyid bsam gtan dang bcas pa dang de nyid mngon par rtogs pa dang @133b bcas par 'byung ba dang go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: and the latter is associated with meditative concentration and realization.

original: rgyu la 'bras bu yod par smra ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu la 'bras bu yod par smra ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the theory that the effect exists in the cause?

original: 'di lar 'di na dge sbyong ngam bram ze kha cig rtag pa'i dus dang ther zug ther zug gi dus su rgyu la 'bras bu yod pa kho na zhes de ltar lta zhing de skad smra ba dag yod de zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'di lar 'di na dge sbyong ngam bram ze kha cig rtag pa'i dus dang ther zug ther zug gi dus su rgyu la 'bras bu yod pa kho na zhes de ltar lta zhing de skad smra ba dag yod de zhes bya ba la /
translated: There are some ascetics and brahmins who, in regard to a permanent and eternal time and a permanent and eternal world, maintain that the effect exists in the cause.

original: rtag pa zhes bya ba ni rgyun mi 'chad pa la bya ste /
analyzed: rtag pa zhes bya ba ni rgyun mi 'chad pa la bya ste /
translated: Permanent means uninterrupted,

original: dper na rtag par zas sbyin no zhes bya ba lta bu'o /
analyzed: dper na rtag par zas sbyin no zhes bya ba lta bu'o /
translated: like, for example, the statement, “I will always give food.”

original: ther zug ces bya ba ni bar chad med pa ste /🔽'dab chags las so //
analyzed: ther zug ces bya ba ni bar chad med pa ste / 'dab chags las so //
translated: Eternal means without interruption,🔽like, for example, the statement, “I will always give food.”

original: yang rtog pa zhes bya ba ni sngon byung ba ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: yang rtog pa zhes bya ba ni sngon byung ba ma yin pa ste /
translated: Again, permanent means not arisen before,

original: gnas pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has the nature of remaining.

original: ther zug ces bya ba ni mi 'jig pa'i chos can la bya'o //
analyzed: ther zug ces bya ba ni mi 'jig pa'i chos can la bya'o //
translated: Eternal means having the nature of not being destroyed.

original: rtag pa'i dus dang ther zug gi dus zhes bya ba gnyis ni gong ma gnyis rnam par bshad pa'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: rtag pa'i dus dang ther zug gi dus zhes bya ba gnyis ni gong ma gnyis rnam par bshad pa'i tshig yin no //
translated: The two terms “permanent” and “eternal” are synonyms for the two above terms.

original: yang na rtag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig bzhi ni bral ba dang / rgyun dang skad cig la 'jig pa dang 'gyur ba'i mi rtag pa rnams med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yang na rtag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig bzhi ni bral ba dang / rgyun dang skad cig la 'jig pa dang 'gyur ba'i mi rtag pa rnams med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Or, the four terms “permanent,” etc., are used because there is no impermanence due to separation, continuity, momentariness, or change.

original: go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: They are to be connected in order.

original: de ltar lta zhing zhes bya ba ni ji ltar 'dod pa'i don la mngon par zhen pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar lta zhing zhes bya ba ni ji ltar 'dod pa'i don la mngon par zhen pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Thus, he views” means that he is attached to the meaning of the self as he wishes.

original: de skad smra ba zhes bya ba ji ltar mngon par shes pa bzhin du gzhan dag la yang brjod pas so //
analyzed: de skad smra ba zhes bya ba ji ltar mngon par shes pa bzhin du gzhan dag la yang brjod pas so //
translated: “He speaks thus” means that he expresses to others what he has realized.

original: 'di lta ste khyu mchog pa'i tshogs lta bu zhes bya ba ni mdo sde las de nas bram ze dmar po'i bu lus mi sdug bcom ldan 'das kyi drung du nye bar song nas 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: 'di lta ste khyu mchog pa'i tshogs lta bu zhes bya ba ni mdo sde las de nas bram ze dmar po'i bu lus mi sdug bcom ldan 'das kyi drung du nye bar song nas 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: “For example, it is like the assembly of the best of cattle” means that in the sutra, the brahmin son of Ratipālita approached the Bhagavān and said this:

original: kye goo ta ma 'di la bdag gi slob ma khyu mchog gi tshogs kyi rigs can de 'khor rnams la 'di skad ces gang yod pa de ni yod pa kho na'o //
analyzed: kye goo ta ma 'di la bdag gi slob ma khyu mchog gi tshogs kyi rigs can de 'khor rnams la 'di skad ces gang yod pa de ni yod pa kho na'o //
translated: “O Gautama, my disciples, the class of the best of the herd, say to their retinue: ‘That which exists exists only.

original: gang med pa de ni med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: gang med pa de ni med pa kho na'o //
translated: That which does not exist does not exist only.

original: med pa la ni 'byung ba yang med do zhes mchi'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pas ston par byed do //
analyzed: med pa la ni 'byung ba yang med do zhes mchi'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pas ston par byed do //
translated: In the non-existent, there is no origination.’

original: de dag kyang ci'i phyir rgyu la 'bras bu yod par lta zhing rnam par 'jog la yongs su ston par byed ce na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de dag kyang ci'i phyir rgyu la 'bras bu yod par lta zhing rnam par 'jog la yongs su ston par byed ce na zhes bya ba la /
translated: And why do they view and posit the effect in the cause and teach it?

original: lta zhing zhes bya ba ni rang gi lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pas so //
analyzed: lta zhing zhes bya ba ni rang gi lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pas so //
translated: “View” means to hold one’s own view as supreme.

original: rnam par 'jog la zhes bya ba ni tha snyad dang mi 'gal bar bstan bcos bzhag pas so //
analyzed: rnam par 'jog la zhes bya ba ni tha snyad dang mi 'gal bar bstan bcos bzhag pas so //
translated: “Posit” means to posit a treatise without contradicting conventional usage.

original: yongs su ston par byed ces bya ba ni gtan tshigs la sogs pa dag gis gzhan dag la rjod par byed pas so //
analyzed: yongs su ston par byed ces bya ba ni gtan tshigs la sogs pa dag gis gzhan dag la rjod par byed pas so //
translated: “Teach” means to express to others by means of reasons and so on.

original: 'di ltar lung dang rigs pas byed de zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'di ltar lung dang rigs pas byed de zhes bya ba la /
translated: Thus, it is said, “it is done through scripture and reasoning.”

original: lung ni thos pa dang dran pa'o //
analyzed: lung ni thos pa dang dran pa'o //
translated: Scripture is hearing and memory.

original: de la dran pa ni thos pa gcig tu brgyud pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la dran pa ni thos pa gcig tu brgyud pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Among them, memory is the transmission of hearing.

original: thos pa ni slob ma rnams la bstan bcos legs par rab tu ston @134a * //
analyzed: thos pa ni slob ma rnams la bstan bcos legs par rab tu ston @134a * //
translated: Hearing is the proper teaching of the treatise to students.

original: pa ste ; sde snod byin pa'i tshul gyis zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: pa ste ; sde snod byin pa'i tshul gyis zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: This is the method of giving the scriptural collection.

original: rigs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: rigs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is reasoning?

original: 'di ltar dge sbyong ngam bram ze rtog ge pa zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs dang mtshan nyid kyis bstan te /
analyzed: 'di ltar dge sbyong ngam bram ze rtog ge pa zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs dang mtshan nyid kyis bstan te /
translated: Thus, a śramaṇa or brāhmaṇa who is a logician is explained through synonyms and definitions.

original: de la rnam grangs ni dpyod pa can zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la rnam grangs ni dpyod pa can zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Among them, the synonym is called “an investigator.”

original: mtshan nyid ni 'di ltar gang slong bar byed pa de yang rtog par byed pa yin no zhes brjod pa de'i gnas skabs lta bur ma gyur pa la bya'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid ni 'di ltar gang slong bar byed pa de yang rtog par byed pa yin no zhes brjod pa de'i gnas skabs lta bur ma gyur pa la bya'o //
translated: The definition is as follows: “That which is a questioner is also a logician,” as stated. This should be understood in the context of what is not the case.

original: rtog ge la rtog pa'i sa zhes bya ba ni mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i gnas skabs la bya ste /
analyzed: rtog ge la rtog pa'i sa zhes bya ba ni mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i gnas skabs la bya ste /
translated: The stage of logic is called the stage of investigation. This should be understood in the context of the non-meditative state.

original: de yang lung med pa'i phyir rang gi spobs pa las byung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de yang lung med pa'i phyir rang gi spobs pa las byung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called “arisen from one’s own confidence” because it is not based on scripture.

original: rtog pa med pa'i phyir so so'i skye bo pa zhes bya'o//
analyzed: rtog pa med pa'i phyir so so'i skye bo pa zhes bya'o//
translated: It is called “of an ordinary person” because it is not based on the scriptures of the universal vehicle.

original: mngon par brtags shing 'thad pa sgrub pa'i rigs pas rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir dpyod pa'i rjes su spyod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mngon par brtags shing 'thad pa sgrub pa'i rigs pas rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir dpyod pa'i rjes su spyod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called “in conformity with investigation” because it is established by the reasoning of investigation and proof.

original: dngos po gang dag las dngos po gang dag 'byung ba de dag ni ngag gi rgyu nyid du grags shing 'dogs kyi zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs rnams par 'grel pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos po gang dag las dngos po gang dag 'byung ba de dag ni ngag gi rgyu nyid du grags shing 'dogs kyi zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs rnams par 'grel pa yin no //
translated: “Those entities from which those entities arise are known and designated as their cause” is the statement of the reason.

original: de las gzhan pa dag ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni ldog pa yin no //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa dag ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni ldog pa yin no //
translated: “Not from others” is the counter pervasion.

original: de bas na 'bras bu de de la yod do zhes mjug bsdus pa ni dam bcas pa'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: de bas na 'bras bu de de la yod do zhes mjug bsdus pa ni dam bcas pa'i tshig yin no //
translated: “Therefore, that effect exists in that cause” is the conclusion.

original: de'i phyir pha rol gyi sbyor ba ni sa bon la myu gu yod de 'byung ba'i rgyu nyid du gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir pha rol gyi sbyor ba ni sa bon la myu gu yod de 'byung ba'i rgyu nyid du gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Therefore, the opponent’s syllogism is: In the seed, the sprout exists, because it is posited as the cause of its arising.”

original: gang la myu gu med pa de ni myu gu 'byung ba'i rgyur mi gzhag ste /
analyzed: gang la myu gu med pa de ni myu gu 'byung ba'i rgyur mi gzhag ste /
translated: That which does not exist as a sprout is not posited as the cause of the

original: dper na shes pa yod pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na shes pa yod pa bzhin no //
translated: arising of a sprout, just like an existent consciousness.🔽Thus, because it is grasped as the referent of that word, and because it is

original: de ltar na de'i don du 'dzin par byed pa'i phyir dang / bya ba de dang de dag tu de dag nyid sbyor bar byed pa'i phyir 'bras bu de yang de dag las 'byung gi de las gzhan pa rnams las ma yin te zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de ltar na de'i don du 'dzin par byed pa'i phyir dang / bya ba de dang de dag tu de dag nyid sbyor bar byed pa'i phyir 'bras bu de yang de dag las 'byung gi de las gzhan pa rnams las ma yin te zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: applied to those actions, the effect arises from that, but not from anything🔽else.

original: de lta ma yin du zin na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ldog pa rnam par 'grel pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta ma yin du zin na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ldog pa rnam par 'grel pa yin no //
translated: “If it were not so” and so on is the explanation of the contrapositive.🔽Here, if you maintain that the sprout exists in the seed through its potential,

original: 'dir de la gal te nus pa'i sgo nas sa bon las myu gu yod par 'dod na ni brtsad du med pas chung zad kyang mi brjod de //
analyzed: 'dir de la gal te nus pa'i sgo nas sa bon las myu gu yod par 'dod na ni brtsad du med pas chung zad kyang mi brjod de //
translated: then there is nothing to debate, and so we say nothing at all.

original: grub pa sgrub par byed pa ni skyon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grub pa sgrub par byed pa ni skyon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would be a fault to establish what is already established.

original: ji ste rang gi ngo bo yod par 'dod na ni de'i phyir de la 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas dpyad par bya'o //
analyzed: ji ste rang gi ngo bo yod par 'dod na ni de'i phyir de la 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas dpyad par bya'o //
translated: But if you do maintain that it has an intrinsic reality, then we will examine it with the statement, “In that case, this should be said to it.

original: rjes su 'gro ba zhes pa'i skyon ni mtshan nyid yod pa'i chos la zhes bya ba la sogs pas don gyi sgo nas smras pa yin no //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba zhes pa'i skyon ni mtshan nyid yod pa'i chos la zhes bya ba la sogs pas don gyi sgo nas smras pa yin no //
translated: ” The fault of “non-concomitance” is stated in terms of the meaning of the statement, “A phenomenon that has a characteristic. . . .

original: yang na rtsing ba'i phyir ma smras pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: yang na rtsing ba'i phyir ma smras pa kho na yin no //
translated: ” Or else, it is not stated because it is too obvious.

original: rgyur nges pa dang 'bras bu nges pa med pas zhes bya ba ni 'di ni rgyu'o 'di ni 'bras bu'o zhes bye brag tu @134b dbye ba med pa'i phyir dam bcas pa ni 'jig rten dang mthun pa la sogs pa'i skyon yod do //
analyzed: rgyur nges pa dang 'bras bu nges pa med pas zhes bya ba ni 'di ni rgyu'o 'di ni 'bras bu'o zhes bye brag tu @134b dbye ba med pa'i phyir dam bcas pa ni 'jig rten dang mthun pa la sogs pa'i skyon yod do //
translated: “Because there is no certainty of cause and effect” means that there is no distinction, “This is the cause, this is the effect,” so the thesis has the fault of contradicting common sense, and so on.

original: ci ma skyes pa'i mtshan nyid zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ci ma skyes pa'i mtshan nyid zhes bya ba la /
translated: “What is the characteristic of the non-arisen?”

original: ma skyes pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid ma thob pa la bya ste /
analyzed: ma skyes pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid ma thob pa la bya ste /
translated: “The characteristic of the non-arisen” refers to that which has not yet obtained its own characteristic.

original: rjes su dpag pa des ni dam bcas pa sun 'byin par byed de /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa des ni dam bcas pa sun 'byin par byed de /
translated: That inference refutes the thesis.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid ma skyes pa'i phyir rang bzhin gyis rang bzhin snga ma bzhin du sa bon la myu gu med do //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid ma skyes pa'i phyir rang bzhin gyis rang bzhin snga ma bzhin du sa bon la myu gu med do //
translated: Because its own characteristic is not produced, the sprout does not exist in the seed by intrinsic nature, just as before.

original: chos mi mthun pa ni sa bon dag la gzugs la sogs pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid yod pa'o //
analyzed: chos mi mthun pa ni sa bon dag la gzugs la sogs pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid yod pa'o //
translated: The dissimilar example is the seed, in which the characteristics of form, etc. exist.

original: de yang pha rol gyis khas blangs pa'i phyir gnyis ka la grub po //
analyzed: de yang pha rol gyis khas blangs pa'i phyir gnyis ka la grub po //
translated: And that is established for both parties because the opponent accepts it.

original: de lta bas na gal te skyes pa'i mtshan nyid gcig yin na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de lta bas na gal te skyes pa'i mtshan nyid gcig yin na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Therefore, it says, “If the characteristic of the produced were one, etc.”

original: nus pa yod par smra ba la yang skyon de kho na yod de /
analyzed: nus pa yod par smra ba la yang skyon de kho na yod de /
translated: The same fault also applies to the theory of potentiality,

original: nus pa ni 'bras bu las tha dad pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nus pa ni 'bras bu las tha dad pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because potentiality is not different from the effect.

original: gal te skyes zin pa'i mtshan nyid gcig yin na ni zhes bya ba de la yang dam bcas pa'i skyon ni snga ma bzhin te /
analyzed: gal te skyes zin pa'i mtshan nyid gcig yin na ni zhes bya ba de la yang dam bcas pa'i skyon ni snga ma bzhin te /
translated: If the characteristic of the produced were one, etc., then the fault of the thesis is the same as before,

original: rang gi mtshan nyid skyes pa'i gsal ba gzhan rnams ni sa bon las mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid skyes pa'i gsal ba gzhan rnams ni sa bon las mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the manifest, which has already arisen by its own characteristic, does not arise from the seed.

original: rgyu yod na rkyen la ltos te skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rgyu yod na rkyen la ltos te skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: If there is a cause, it arises in dependence on conditions.

original: rgyu yod na zhes bya ba ni nus pa dang ldan pa nye bar gnas sam sa bon yang dag par ma bcom zhing ma spangs pa la bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu yod na zhes bya ba ni nus pa dang ldan pa nye bar gnas sam sa bon yang dag par ma bcom zhing ma spangs pa la bya'o //
translated: If there is a cause means if there is a cause that is present and capable, or if the seed has not been destroyed or abandoned.🔽In this regard, the example of the five characteristics, etc.

original: de la mtshan nyid rnam pa lngas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i dpes ni dgag pa kho na brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de la mtshan nyid rnam pa lngas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i dpes ni dgag pa kho na brjod pa yin no //
translated: , only expresses a negation.

original: de'i rten la dmigs pa 'di lta ste mig la mig gi rnam par shes pa lta bu zhes bya ba ni gzugs can ma yin yang de la bya ba byed pa dmigs pa'i phyir yod pa yin no zhes rtogs par 'gyur ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: de'i rten la dmigs pa 'di lta ste mig la mig gi rnam par shes pa lta bu zhes bya ba ni gzugs can ma yin yang de la bya ba byed pa dmigs pa'i phyir yod pa yin no zhes rtogs par 'gyur ba lta bu'o //
translated: The example of the eye and the eye-consciousness, which is its basis and object, is like the following. Even though it is not physical, it is understood to exist because its activity is perceived.

original: de bzhin du rang gi mtshan nyid du dmigs pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du rang gi mtshan nyid du dmigs pa 'di lta ste /
translated: In the same way, the example of the perception of its own characteristic is like the following.

original: rgyu ni rjes su dpag par bya ba ma yin zhing /
analyzed: rgyu ni rjes su dpag par bya ba ma yin zhing /
translated: The cause is not to be inferred.

original: rang gi las byed pa lta bu zhes bya ba ni dper na rgyu la rjes su dpag par bya ba med pa de'i tshe 'bras bu yang de bzhin du 'gyur zhing 'bras bus kyang de bzhin du las bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi las byed pa lta bu zhes bya ba ni dper na rgyu la rjes su dpag par bya ba med pa de'i tshe 'bras bu yang de bzhin du 'gyur zhing 'bras bus kyang de bzhin du las bya'o //
translated: “Like one’s own action” means that when there is no inference of the effect in the cause, the effect is also like that, and the action is also like that.

original: de bzhin du yod pa'i phyir te rgyu bzhin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du yod pa'i phyir te rgyu bzhin no //
translated: Because it exists in that way, like the cause.

original: yang na 'di ltar bya ste /
analyzed: yang na 'di ltar bya ste /
translated: Or it should be stated like this:

original: sa bon skam po la ni myu gu med de /
analyzed: sa bon skam po la ni myu gu med de /
translated: A sprout does not exist in a dry seed.

original: bar du gcod pa med kyang myu gu dang bcas pa nyid du gzung du med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bar du gcod pa med kyang myu gu dang bcas pa nyid du gzung du med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even without an obstruction, it is not apprehended as having a sprout.

original: dper na sems sam shes pa yod pa bzhin te /
analyzed: dper na sems sam shes pa yod pa bzhin te /
translated: For example, like the existence of mind or consciousness.

original: chos mi mthun pa ni sa bon las myu gu mngon par grub pa'o //
analyzed: chos mi mthun pa ni sa bon las myu gu mngon par grub pa'o //
translated: The dissimilar example is the establishment of a sprout from a seed.

original: las la yang de bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: las la yang de bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
translated: The action should be stated in the same way.

original: rgyur 'gyur ba'am zhes bya ba ni 'bras thug po che la sogs pa bzhin du myu gu yang nyams par 'gyur @135a * //
analyzed: rgyur 'gyur ba'am zhes bya ba ni 'bras thug po che la sogs pa bzhin du myu gu yang nyams par 'gyur @135a * //
translated: “If it were a cause” means that like rice, etc., the sprout would be destroyed.

original: bar bsams pa'o //
analyzed: bar bsams pa'o //
translated: This is what is intended.

original: yang na 'gyur ba'i rkyen rnams kyis 'gyur bar 'ong ba'o zhes bya ba ni rgyur 'gyur ba'i rkyen rnams ma gtogs par yang ngo //
analyzed: yang na 'gyur ba'i rkyen rnams kyis 'gyur bar 'ong ba'o zhes bya ba ni rgyur 'gyur ba'i rkyen rnams ma gtogs par yang ngo //
translated: Or else, they are subject to change because of the conditions of change.

original: de dag 'di nyid du sems te /
analyzed: de dag 'di nyid du sems te /
translated: They think about this very thing:🔽If the effect does not exist in the cause, it cannot arise,

original: rgyu la 'bras bu med na skye bar mi rung la zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar yod pa kho na la mngon par gsal bar byed de bsgrubs pa'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rgyu la 'bras bu med na skye bar mi rung la zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar yod pa kho na la mngon par gsal bar byed de bsgrubs pa'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: because it is only what exists that is manifested, as in the case of a pot, etc.🔽And it is not the case that one does not strive to produce the effect,

original: 'bras bu bsgrub pa'i phyir 'bad par mi byed pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten la sogs pa dang 'gal ba yongs su sel bar byed do //
analyzed: 'bras bu bsgrub pa'i phyir 'bad par mi byed pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten la sogs pa dang 'gal ba yongs su sel bar byed do //
translated: in order to avoid contradicting the world, etc.🔽Having examined it in this way,

original: de de ltar yongs su brtags nas zhes bya ba ni yongs su brtags nas mngon par zhen pa las so zhes bya ba'i tshig lhag ma'o //
analyzed: de de ltar yongs su brtags nas zhes bya ba ni yongs su brtags nas mngon par zhen pa las so zhes bya ba'i tshig lhag ma'o //
translated: having examined it, having conceived of it, is the remainder of the sentence.🔽He says that the reason is unestablished:

original: ci sgrib pa'i rgyu med pa'am srib pa yod par 'dod ces bya ba la sogs pas ni gtan tshigs ma grub par smras pa yin no //
analyzed: ci sgrib pa'i rgyu med pa'am srib pa yod par 'dod ces bya ba la sogs pas ni gtan tshigs ma grub par smras pa yin no //
translated: What is the use of the word “or”?

original: gal te yod pa na ni yod par yang 'dra na 'bras bu dang 'brel ba'i rgyu la yang ci'i phyir sgrib par mi byed de mi rung ngo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gal te yod pa na ni yod par yang 'dra na 'bras bu dang 'brel ba'i rgyu la yang ci'i phyir sgrib par mi byed de mi rung ngo zhes bya ba la /
translated: If it exists, then since it is the same in existing, why does it not obstruct the cause that is related to the effect? It is not tenable.

original: 'bras bu dang 'brel ba zhes bya ba ni yul la sogs pa 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu dang 'brel ba zhes bya ba ni yul la sogs pa 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: “Related to the effect” means that the object, etc., are similar.

original: ji ste pha rol gyis gtan tshigs ma grub par rig nas sgrub par byed de /
analyzed: ji ste pha rol gyis gtan tshigs ma grub par rig nas sgrub par byed de /
translated: If the opponent, knowing that the reason is unestablished, establishes it,

original: sa bon la myu gus bsgribs pa yin te /
analyzed: sa bon la myu gus bsgribs pa yin te /
translated: then the sprout obstructs the seed,

original: yod na 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod na 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because if it exists, it is the effect.🔽For example, it is like that very thing changing.

original: dper na de nyid 'gyur ba bzhin no zhe na 'di ltar 'di na dge sbyong ngam bram ze'am chos 'di pa kha ci rang gi mtshan nyid las zhes smra bar mi 'dod pas na de'i phyir ci yod pa nyid sgrib pa'i rgyu yin nam /
analyzed: dper na de nyid 'gyur ba bzhin no zhe na 'di ltar 'di na dge sbyong ngam bram ze'am chos 'di pa kha ci rang gi mtshan nyid las zhes smra bar mi 'dod pas na de'i phyir ci yod pa nyid sgrib pa'i rgyu yin nam /
translated: In this way, since no ascetic, brahmin, or adherent of this doctrine wishes to say that it is from its own characteristic, therefore, one should argue and investigate whether existence itself is the cause of obstruction,

original: 'on te 'bras bu nyid sgrib ba'i rgyu yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas rgol zhing rtog par byed do //
analyzed: 'on te 'bras bu nyid sgrib ba'i rgyu yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas rgol zhing rtog par byed do //
translated: or whether the effect itself is the cause of obstruction.

original: gal te yod pa nyid sgrib pa'i rgyu yin na ni des na rgyu yang yod pa yin pas yod pa ni dus thams cad du mngon par gsal ba ma yin par 'gyur bas mi rung ngo zhes bya ba la rgyu yang yod pa yin zhes bya bas ni
analyzed: gal te yod pa nyid sgrib pa'i rgyu yin na ni des na rgyu yang yod pa yin pas yod pa ni dus thams cad du mngon par gsal ba ma yin par 'gyur bas mi rung ngo zhes bya ba la rgyu yang yod pa yin zhes bya bas ni
translated: The phrase “the cause also exists”

original: de yang bsgribs pa yin pa'i phyir mngon par gsal bar bya ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don thob pa yin te /
analyzed: de yang bsgribs pa yin pa'i phyir mngon par gsal bar bya ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don thob pa yin te /
translated: means that since it is also obstructed, it must be manifest.

original: de gnyis kyis ni ma nges pa yin par smra ba ste /
analyzed: de gnyis kyis ni ma nges pa yin par smra ba ste /
translated: These two are the proponents of indeterminacy.

original: de lta bas na mi sgrib pa nyid kyi lan gdab par mi nus so //
analyzed: de lta bas na mi sgrib pa nyid kyi lan gdab par mi nus so //
translated: Therefore, they are unable to respond to the objection that nonobstruction is untenable.🔽The phrase “Is the manifest of that phenomenon nondifferent or different?”

original: ci chos de las mngon par gsal ba tha dad pa ma yin pa'am 'on te tha dad par 'dod ces bya ba 'dis ni dam bcas pa snga ma la rang gi rjes su dpag pa gnod pa smras pa yin no //
analyzed: ci chos de las mngon par gsal ba tha dad pa ma yin pa'am 'on te tha dad par 'dod ces bya ba 'dis ni dam bcas pa snga ma la rang gi rjes su dpag pa gnod pa smras pa yin no //
translated: indicates that the former thesis is undermined by their own inference.

original: gal te rgyu med pa zhig yin na ni des na rgyu med pa mngon par gsal bar bya ba'i mi rung ngo zhes bya ba ni rkyen nye bar gyur pa'i phyir dang po nyid nas mngon par gsal ba'i @135b chos yin par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te rgyu med pa zhig yin na ni des na rgyu med pa mngon par gsal bar bya ba'i mi rung ngo zhes bya ba ni rkyen nye bar gyur pa'i phyir dang po nyid nas mngon par gsal ba'i @135b chos yin par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is causeless, then it is not tenable that it is manifested, because it would follow that it is a manifest phenomenon from the very beginning, since its conditions are present.

original: gal te 'bras bu mngon par gsal bar bya ba'i yin na ni 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir mngon par gsal ba la mngon par gsal bar bya dgos par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: gal te 'bras bu mngon par gsal bar bya ba'i yin na ni 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir mngon par gsal ba la mngon par gsal bar bya dgos par 'gyur bas /
translated: If it is manifested by the effect, then because it is the effect, the manifest would have to be manifested by the manifest.

original: de la yang gzhan gyi bya ba dgos pas thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la yang gzhan gyi bya ba dgos pas thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: And since another action would be required for that, there would be an infinite regress.

original: gal te de mngon par gsal ba ma yin pa las mngon par gsal bar byed na ci'i phyir 'bras bu yang mngon par gsal bar byed pa yin par mi 'dod de /
analyzed: gal te de mngon par gsal ba ma yin pa las mngon par gsal bar byed na ci'i phyir 'bras bu yang mngon par gsal bar byed pa yin par mi 'dod de /
translated: If it is manifested by that which is not manifest, then why is it not accepted that the effect is manifested by that which is not manifest?

original: rjes su dpag pa des kyang gnod pa kho nar smras pa yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa des kyang gnod pa kho nar smras pa yin no //
translated: That inference also is said to be undermined by that.

original: med pa'i med pa nyid ni mngon par gsal ba med pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i dus na 'bras bu med na ni med pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: med pa'i med pa nyid ni mngon par gsal ba med pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i dus na 'bras bu med na ni med pa kho na yin no //
translated: The nonexistence of nonexistence is the nonmanifestation of the effect.

original: yod pa'i yod pa nyid ni mngon par gsal ba yin no zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu byung ba'i'o //
analyzed: yod pa'i yod pa nyid ni mngon par gsal ba yin no zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu byung ba'i'o //
translated: The existence of existence is the manifestation of the effect.🔽Just as the characteristics of sound are designated,

original: sgra'i mtshan ni ji skad 'dogs pa kho na bzhin du zhes bya ba ni skyabs dang 'jig pa dang 'gyur ba la sogs pa med pas ther zug tu gnas par lta ba'o //
analyzed: sgra'i mtshan ni ji skad 'dogs pa kho na bzhin du zhes bya ba ni skyabs dang 'jig pa dang 'gyur ba la sogs pa med pas ther zug tu gnas par lta ba'o //
translated: the view of permanence is the view that sound is permanent because it is not destroyed, does not perish, and does not change.

original: yang na don dang 'grel ba tha snyad gang yin pa ni mi rtag pa'o //
analyzed: yang na don dang 'grel ba tha snyad gang yin pa ni mi rtag pa'o //
translated: Or, the meaning and the explanation are impermanent.

original: yang na brjod pas ni dbang po dang yul mngon par 'du byed de zhes bya ba ji skad smras pa la bya'o //
analyzed: yang na brjod pas ni dbang po dang yul mngon par 'du byed de zhes bya ba ji skad smras pa la bya'o //
translated: Or, the expression “by expression, the sense faculties and objects are brought together” should be understood as stated.

original: rnam par gnas par lta ba zhes bya ba ni snga ma yang sgra'i mtshan nyid rnam par gnas pa kho nar lta'o //
analyzed: rnam par gnas par lta ba zhes bya ba ni snga ma yang sgra'i mtshan nyid rnam par gnas pa kho nar lta'o //
translated: The view of abiding is the view that sound is abiding because it abides just as it is.

original: 'dir mngon par gsal ba zhes bya ba'i bye brag ni brjod par byas pa'i mngon par 'du byed pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir mngon par gsal ba zhes bya ba'i bye brag ni brjod par byas pa'i mngon par 'du byed pa ste /
translated: The specific quality of manifest karma is called “manifest” because it is the manifest activity of the formative forces.

original: bye brag ni de yin no //
analyzed: bye brag ni de yin no //
translated: This is the specific quality.

original: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa rdzas su yod par smra ba gang zhe na //
analyzed: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa rdzas su yod par smra ba gang zhe na //
translated: Who are the proponents of the substantial existence of the past and future?

original: 'di ltar 'di na dge sbyong ngam bram ze'am chos 'di pa kha cig kyang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di na dge sbyong ngam bram ze'am chos 'di pa kha cig kyang zhes bya ba la /
translated: Some śramaṇas or brahmins, who are followers of this doctrine, say:

original: chos 'di pa kha cig kyang kun gyis bkur ba dang thams cad yod par smra ba bye brag tu smra ba la sogs pa'o //🔽'das pa yang yod de /
analyzed: chos 'di pa kha cig kyang kun gyis bkur ba dang thams cad yod par smra ba bye brag tu smra ba la sogs pa'o // 'das pa yang yod de /
translated: “Some followers of this doctrine” refers to the Sāṃmitīyas, the Sarvāstivādins, the Vaibhāṣikas, and so on.🔽The past exists.

original: ma 'ongs pa yang yod /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa yang yod /
translated: The future exists.

original: da ltar byung ba bzhin du mtshan nyid kyis yongs su grub pa yin te /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba bzhin du mtshan nyid kyis yongs su grub pa yin te /
translated: They are established by their characteristics, just as the present is.🔽They exist substantially, not as nominal existences.

original: rdzas su yod pa yin gyis btags pa'i yod pa ni ma yin no zhes tshul bzhin ma yin pas de ltar zhing de skad smra ba dag kyang yod de zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rdzas su yod pa yin gyis btags pa'i yod pa ni ma yin no zhes tshul bzhin ma yin pas de ltar zhing de skad smra ba dag kyang yod de zhes bya ba la /
translated: Those who say this in an improper manner, saying “They exist,” are the proponents of the substantial existence of the past and future.

original: 'di la sbyor ba ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa ni rdzas su yod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di la sbyor ba ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa ni rdzas su yod pa yin te /
translated: The syllogism is as follows: The past and future exist substantially.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yongs su grub pa yin pa'i phyir ba'am /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yongs su grub pa yin pa'i phyir ba'am /
translated: Because they are established by intrinsic identity,

original: dus yin pa'i phyir te da ltar byung ba'i bzhin no //
analyzed: dus yin pa'i phyir te da ltar byung ba'i bzhin no //
translated: or because they are time, like the present.

original: chos mthun pa ni bud bu'i ras bzhin no zhes sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: chos mthun pa ni bud bu'i ras bzhin no zhes sbyor bar byed do //
translated: The example is like a cloth that is woven.

original: de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: He thinks as follows:

original: chos dang rang gi mtshan nyid gang gi rnam par @136a * //
analyzed: chos dang rang gi mtshan nyid gang gi rnam par @136a * //
translated: That which is the intrinsic identity and the intrinsic identity of a dharma is its establishment by intrinsic identity.

original: gnas pa de ni de yongs su grub pa yin no zhes bya bas ni gtan tshigs dang po'i ma grub pa sel bar byed do //
analyzed: gnas pa de ni de yongs su grub pa yin no zhes bya bas ni gtan tshigs dang po'i ma grub pa sel bar byed do //
translated: Thus he eliminates the first reason’s lack of establishment.

original: gal te ma 'ongs pa de med du zin na des na de'i tshe zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gal te ma 'ongs pa de med du zin na des na de'i tshe zhes bya ba la /
translated: If the future did not exist, then at that time,

original: de'i tshe zhes bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus na'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe zhes bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus na'o //
translated: “at that time” means in the future.🔽“It would not be apprehended by intrinsic identity” and so on.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid ma zin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni phyir rgol ba 'dod pa'i phyir ji ltar na des skyon thogs par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid ma zin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni phyir rgol ba 'dod pa'i phyir ji ltar na des skyon thogs par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How could he be faulted by the opponent’s desire?

original: de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: He thinks as follows:

original: gal te ma 'ongs pa'i gnas skabs na de'i mtshan nyid med du zin na da ltar byung ba'i gnas skabs su de'i mtshan nyid glo bur du 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te ma 'ongs pa'i gnas skabs na de'i mtshan nyid med du zin na da ltar byung ba'i gnas skabs su de'i mtshan nyid glo bur du 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: If the characteristic did not exist in the future time, it would arise adventitiously in the present time.🔽Since the characteristic arises adventitiously, it would follow that intention and so on would also be form because they are imputed to have the characteristic of form.

original: mtshan nyid glo bur du 'byung bas sgro btags pa'i phyir 'dun pa la sogs pa yang gzugs can nyid yin par thal bar 'gyur ba dang / ma 'ongs pa'i gnas skabs kyi chos la yang gzugs dang sgra la sogs par brjod pa kho nar 'gyur te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid glo bur du 'byung bas sgro btags pa'i phyir 'dun pa la sogs pa yang gzugs can nyid yin par thal bar 'gyur ba dang / ma 'ongs pa'i gnas skabs kyi chos la yang gzugs dang sgra la sogs par brjod pa kho nar 'gyur te /
translated: And it would be said that even the future dharma would be form, sound, and so on,

original: de'i mtshan nyid dang bral ba'i phyir ro snyam du sems so //
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid dang bral ba'i phyir ro snyam du sems so //
translated: because it would be devoid of its own characteristic.

original: gal te tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin na ni mtshan nyid dus gsum du rnam par gzhag tu mi rung ngo zhes bya ba ni de dus rnams su 'pho ba na skye ba'am /
analyzed: gal te tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin na ni mtshan nyid dus gsum du rnam par gzhag tu mi rung ngo zhes bya ba ni de dus rnams su 'pho ba na skye ba'am /
translated: If the characteristic were not different, it would not be tenable to posit the characteristic in the three times.

original: 'bri ba cung zad kyang med pas na de'i phyir da ltar byung ba'i bzhin te /
analyzed: 'bri ba cung zad kyang med pas na de'i phyir da ltar byung ba'i bzhin te /
translated: Since it does not arise or diminish in the slightest when it passes into the times, therefore it is like the present.

original: ma 'ongs pa log par sgrub pa'i phyir 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa log par sgrub pa'i phyir 'gal ba yin no //
translated: It is contradictory because it is established as future.

original: gal te tha dad pa'i phyir mtshan nyid yin na ni yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid ces byar mi rung ngo zhes bya ba ni mig gis gzung ba kho na yin na /
analyzed: gal te tha dad pa'i phyir mtshan nyid yin na ni yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid ces byar mi rung ngo zhes bya ba ni mig gis gzung ba kho na yin na /
translated: If it is a characteristic because it is different, it is not suitable to be called the characteristic of the perfected because it is not suitable to be called the perfected.

original: de lta ma yin pas de ltas lhag ma'i gzugs kyi mtshan nyid gzhan med pa'i phyir yongs su grub pa nyid yin no zhes byar mi rung ste /
analyzed: de lta ma yin pas de ltas lhag ma'i gzugs kyi mtshan nyid gzhan med pa'i phyir yongs su grub pa nyid yin no zhes byar mi rung ste /
translated: If it is not like that, then because the other characteristics of form do not exist, it is not suitable to be called the perfected.

original: des ni ma grub pa smras pa yin no //
analyzed: des ni ma grub pa smras pa yin no //
translated: This is a statement of what is not established.

original: gnyis pa yang 'gal bar 'khrul pa med pa yin te /🔽ma 'ongs pa ni rdzas su yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gnyis pa yang 'gal bar 'khrul pa med pa yin te / ma 'ongs pa ni rdzas su yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The second is not confused about contradiction.

original: yongs su ma grub pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su ma grub pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The future does not substantially exist because it is not the characteristic of the perfected.

original: bum pa bzhin te chos mthun pa ni da ltar byung ba'o //
analyzed: bum pa bzhin te chos mthun pa ni da ltar byung ba'o //
translated: Like a pot. The similar quality is the present.

original: gal te rtag pa'i mtshan nyid cig yin na ni dus gsum du gtogs pa zhes byar mi rung ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gal te rtag pa'i mtshan nyid cig yin na ni dus gsum du gtogs pa zhes byar mi rung ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If it is the characteristic of the permanent, it is not suitable to be called that which is included in the three times.

original: gal te rtag pa'i mtshan nyid yin par khas len pa chos can gyi ngo bo nyid log par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te rtag pa'i mtshan nyid yin par khas len pa chos can gyi ngo bo nyid log par 'gyur te /
translated: If you accept that it is the characteristic of the permanent, then the entity itself of the subject would be refuted.

original: ma 'ongs pa nyid nyams pa'i gtan tshigs gnyis pa ni rang la ma grub pa yin no //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa nyid nyams pa'i gtan tshigs gnyis pa ni rang la ma grub pa yin no //
translated: The second reason, that the future itself would be lost, is not established for you.

original: gal te mi rtag pa'i mtshan nyid yin na ni des na dus gsum du de kho na bzhin du yod do zhes byar mi rung ngo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gal te mi rtag pa'i mtshan nyid yin na ni des na dus gsum du de kho na bzhin du yod do zhes byar mi rung ngo zhes bya ba la /
translated: If it is the characteristic of the impermanent, then it is not tenable to say that it exists just as it is in the three times.

original: de kho na bzhin du yod do zhes byar mi rung ngo zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid las nyams pa kho @136b na yin pas de'i phyir gtan tshigs dang po ma grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de kho na bzhin du yod do zhes byar mi rung ngo zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid las nyams pa kho @136b na yin pas de'i phyir gtan tshigs dang po ma grub pa yin no //
translated: Since it is not tenable to say that it exists just as it is, it is just that its nature would be lost. Therefore the first reason is not established.

original: gal te 'ong ba zhig yin na ni des na yul na gnas par yang 'gyur la zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gal te 'ong ba zhig yin na ni des na yul na gnas par yang 'gyur la zhes bya ba la /
translated: If it is coming, then it would also abide in a place.

original: yul na gnas par 'gyur zhes byar ni ma grub pa'i mtha' las 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa dang gzugs can ma yin pa'i chos rnams ni yul na gnas pa ma yin no zhes 'byung ba dang 'gal lo //
analyzed: yul na gnas par 'gyur zhes byar ni ma grub pa'i mtha' las 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa dang gzugs can ma yin pa'i chos rnams ni yul na gnas pa ma yin no zhes 'byung ba dang 'gal lo //
translated: The statement, “It is not established that they exist in a place,” contradicts the treatise, which says, “The past, the future, nonindicative form, and nonphysical phenomena do not exist in a place.”

original: da ltar dang yang bye brag med de zhes bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa nyid nyams pa kho nar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: da ltar dang yang bye brag med de zhes bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa nyid nyams pa kho nar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The statement, “There is no difference between the present and the future” means that the future would be destroyed.

original: gal te 'phos nas skye bar 'gyur na ni des na ma 'ongs pa yang ma skyes par 'gyur la zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gal te 'phos nas skye bar 'gyur na ni des na ma 'ongs pa yang ma skyes par 'gyur la zhes bya ba la /
translated: If it were to arise after it has transferred, then the future would not arise.

original: ma 'ongs pa yang ma skyes par 'gyur la zhes bya ba ni de zhig par khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa yang ma skyes par 'gyur la zhes bya ba ni de zhig par khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The statement, “The future would not arise” means that it would be accepted that it would be destroyed.

original: sngon ma byung ba yang skyes par 'gyur ba dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sngon ma byung ba yang skyes par 'gyur ba dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: The statement, “What has not previously occurred would arise” means that it would arise again.

original: de la nyes pa ci yod ce na /
analyzed: de la nyes pa ci yod ce na /
translated: What is wrong with that?

original: lung las dus rnams ni bya bas rnam par gzhag pa yin no zhes gsungs pa dang 'gal lo //
analyzed: lung las dus rnams ni bya bas rnam par gzhag pa yin no zhes gsungs pa dang 'gal lo //
translated: It contradicts the scriptures, which state, “The times are posited by activity.”

original: gal te las mi byed pa yin pa la las byed par 'gyur na ni des na ma byung ba byung bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni las ma byung ba las 'byung bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gal te las mi byed pa yin pa la las byed par 'gyur na ni des na ma byung ba byung bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni las ma byung ba las 'byung bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: That is, it would arise from an action that has not arisen.

original: skyon snga ma rnams ji lta ba bzhin du 'gyur bas de yang mi rung ngo zhes bya ba la /🔽skyon snga ma rnams zhes bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa yang skyes par 'gyur la /
analyzed: skyon snga ma rnams ji lta ba bzhin du 'gyur bas de yang mi rung ngo zhes bya ba la / skyon snga ma rnams zhes bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa yang skyes par 'gyur la /
translated: Since the former errors would apply in just the same way, that is also unacceptable.🔽The former errors are those that were mentioned, such as “The future would be arisen,”

original: sngon ma byung ba yang skyes par 'gyur ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ji skad smos pa rnams so //
analyzed: sngon ma byung ba yang skyes par 'gyur ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ji skad smos pa rnams so //
translated: “that which has not previously occurred would arise,” and so on.

original: de la bye brag ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la bye brag ni 'di yin te /
translated: The difference is this:

original: rang bzhin 'dres pa'i skyon yod pa'i phyir mi rung ngo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rang bzhin 'dres pa'i skyon yod pa'i phyir mi rung ngo zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is unacceptable because the error of mixing intrinsic natures would occur.

original: rang bzhin 'dres pa'i skyon zhes bya ba ni gal te ma 'ongs pa de ltar byung ba'i dngos po dang tha dad pa ma yin na /
analyzed: rang bzhin 'dres pa'i skyon zhes bya ba ni gal te ma 'ongs pa de ltar byung ba'i dngos po dang tha dad pa ma yin na /
translated: The error of mixing intrinsic natures is as follows: If the future were not different from the thing that has arisen,🔽then the future would be the present.

original: de'i tshe ma 'ongs pa de nyid da ltar byung ba yin par 'gyur ba la sogs pa ste ;
analyzed: de'i tshe ma 'ongs pa de nyid da ltar byung ba yin par 'gyur ba la sogs pa ste ;
translated: At that time, the future would be the present.

original: de dag thams cad kyang khas blangs pa'i sgo nas dam bcas pa'i skyon dag yod pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyang khas blangs pa'i sgo nas dam bcas pa'i skyon dag yod pa yin no //
translated: All of these are faults of your thesis, which you accept.🔽Just as the fault of the confusion of natures exists for that which lacks the characteristics of activity, etc.,

original: mtshan nyid ma rdzogs pa la sogs pa la rang bzhin 'dres pa'i skyon ji ltar yod pa de bzhin du las dang bcas pa'i phyogs la yang yod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: mtshan nyid ma rdzogs pa la sogs pa la rang bzhin 'dres pa'i skyon ji ltar yod pa de bzhin du las dang bcas pa'i phyogs la yang yod pa ma yin nam /
translated: doesn’t it also exist for the position that it has activity?

original: ji ltar bye brag tu dbye ba na de la ni 'brel pa'i bye brag yod pa'i phyir bye brag brjod par nus pas na skyon 'di ma nges par ma smos so //
analyzed: ji ltar bye brag tu dbye ba na de la ni 'brel pa'i bye brag yod pa'i phyir bye brag brjod par nus pas na skyon 'di ma nges par ma smos so //
translated: When it is distinguished, it can be said that it has a specific relation, and therefore this fault is not definite, and so is not mentioned.

original: der ni 'khrug pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: der ni 'khrug pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because there is no confusion there.

original: 'di ltar de la ni las dang tha dad pa med par bstan gyi da ltar byung ba dang ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar de la ni las dang tha dad pa med par bstan gyi da ltar byung ba dang ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus, it is taught that it is not different from activity, but it is not the present.

original: yang 'di skad ces zer te /
analyzed: yang 'di skad ces zer te /
translated: Again, it is said:

original: gal te 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa med du zin na dmigs @137a * //
analyzed: gal te 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa med du zin na dmigs @137a * //
translated: If the past and future do not exist, then the object of memory and of a wish would not exist.

original: pa la ji ltar blo 'jug par 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgol zhing rtog pas ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa ni yod pa yin te /
analyzed: pa la ji ltar blo 'jug par 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgol zhing rtog pas ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa ni yod pa yin te /
translated: and so on, and they argue and speculate, “How can the mind engage with the past and future?”

original: blo'i gzung ba yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: blo'i gzung ba yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: They prove that the past and future exist because they are the objects of the mind,

original: da ltar byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba bzhin no //
translated: just as the present is.

original: skye mched rnams kyang dus gsum pa yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: skye mched rnams kyang dus gsum pa yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: They also prove that the past and future exist because the sense bases are of three times,

original: thams cad yod do zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni khungs yin no zhes bsgrubs pa yin no //
analyzed: thams cad yod do zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni khungs yin no zhes bsgrubs pa yin no //
translated: and they cite the sutra that states, “All exists” and so on as a source.

original: med pa la yang med par shes so zhes gsungs pa zhes bya ba 'di ni dmigs pa med pa la blo 'jug pa'i dpe yin no //
analyzed: med pa la yang med par shes so zhes gsungs pa zhes bya ba 'di ni dmigs pa med pa la blo 'jug pa'i dpe yin no //
translated: The statement, “One knows the nonexistent as nonexistent” is an example of the mind engaging with nonexistent objects.🔽If the mind is of the aspect that thinks, “It exists,” then it is not suitable to be of the aspect that thinks, “The mind apprehending nonexistence exists.”

original: gal te yod do snyam pa de lta bu'i rnam pa yin na ni des na med par 'dzin pa'i blo yod do snyam pa de lta bu'i rnam par 'gyur du mi rung ngo zhes bya ba ni 'dzin pa'i rnam pa'i stobs kyis yul yod pa nyid du nges
analyzed: gal te yod do snyam pa de lta bu'i rnam pa yin na ni des na med par 'dzin pa'i blo yod do snyam pa de lta bu'i rnam par 'gyur du mi rung ngo zhes bya ba ni 'dzin pa'i rnam pa'i stobs kyis yul yod pa nyid du nges
translated: The mind is ascertained to exist by the power of the aspect of the apprehender.

original: pa'i phyir don gyi rnam par shes pa yongs su spangs na yul gyi ngo bo nyid nges par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa'i phyir don gyi rnam par shes pa yongs su spangs na yul gyi ngo bo nyid nges par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because if the consciousness of the object is rejected, the nature of the object cannot be ascertained.

original: dngos po yod pa la med do zhes ming la dmigs pa na 'khrul ba'i shes pa'i ngo bo'i blo 'jug pa yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: dngos po yod pa la med do zhes ming la dmigs pa na 'khrul ba'i shes pa'i ngo bo'i blo 'jug pa yin nam zhe na /
translated: If an existent thing is perceived as nonexistent, is the cognition that engages the name mistaken?

original: ma yin te ming la dmigs pa dang / de'i don la dmigs pa'i blo gnyis bye brag med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin te ming la dmigs pa dang / de'i don la dmigs pa'i blo gnyis bye brag med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: No, because it follows that the two cognitions, one that engages the name and the other that engages its object, would be indistinguishable.

original: 'khrul ba'i shes pa de ni de'i don la dmigs par mi nus pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: 'khrul ba'i shes pa de ni de'i don la dmigs par mi nus pa kho na yin no //
translated: That mistaken cognition is not capable of engaging its object.

original: med pa la med pa'i mtshan nyid yod pa la dgongs nas gsungs pa yin te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: med pa la med pa'i mtshan nyid yod pa la dgongs nas gsungs pa yin te zhes bya ba la /
translated: The statement that the characteristic of nonexistence exists is made with the intention that the characteristic of nonexistence exists in the existent.

original: ji ltar na yod pas dben pa la yod do zhes brjod par rigs she na /
analyzed: ji ltar na yod pas dben pa la yod do zhes brjod par rigs she na /
translated: How is it reasonable to say that exists in the absence of existence?

original: de yod pas dben pa yin no zhes sus smras te /
analyzed: de yod pas dben pa yin no zhes sus smras te /
translated: Who says that the absence of existence exists?

original: de la ni de las gzhan pa'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid med par zad de /
analyzed: de la ni de las gzhan pa'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid med par zad de /
translated: It is simply that the characteristic of an entity that is different from it does not exist in it.

original: de'i phyir de la med pa nyid ces bya bar 'dod kyi bdag gi dngos po la ltos nas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de la med pa nyid ces bya bar 'dod kyi bdag gi dngos po la ltos nas ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is said to be nonexistent, but not in reliance on its own intrinsic reality.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i dngos po la yang gzhan la ltos nas 'dri pa med pa nyid do zhes bya ba yod de /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i dngos po la yang gzhan la ltos nas 'dri pa med pa nyid do zhes bya ba yod de /
translated: And even if it has intrinsic identity, it is not said to be nonexistent in reliance on another.

original: dper na sngon po la ser po'i ngo bo nyid lta bu yin yang ci sngon po de rnam pa thams cad du med par brjod par bya ba'am /
analyzed: dper na sngon po la ser po'i ngo bo nyid lta bu yin yang ci sngon po de rnam pa thams cad du med par brjod par bya ba'am /
translated: For example, even though blue is not the intrinsic reality of yellow, is blue to be said to be totally nonexistent?

original: med par shes zhes bya bas ni med pa'i chos nyid bstan te /
analyzed: med par shes zhes bya bas ni med pa'i chos nyid bstan te /
translated: Or is it to be known as nonexistent?

original: de bzhin du ma nor ba'i mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i phyir bas kyang ngo ;
analyzed: de bzhin du ma nor ba'i mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i phyir bas kyang ngo ;
translated: In the same way, it is not to be known as nonexistent because it holds its own intrinsic identity.

original: / lan de dag gis ni ma nges pa nyid smras pa yin no //
analyzed: / lan de dag gis ni ma nges pa nyid smras pa yin no //
translated: These answers are said to be inconclusive.

original: 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid la dgongs nas zhes bya ba ni kha cig na re 'bras bu bskyed pa'i phyir 'das pa zhes bya ba'i 'bras bu yod pa'i phyir ni ma yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid la dgongs nas zhes bya ba ni kha cig na re 'bras bu bskyed pa'i phyir 'das pa zhes bya ba'i 'bras bu yod pa'i phyir ni ma yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: With the intention of the characteristic of effect, some say that it is not because the effect exists, but because it generates the effect.

original: skyes pa dang 'dra ba zhes bya ba ni skyes pa gang yin pa de'i ngo bo lta bu yin gyi sngon ma byung ba @137b ma yin te /
analyzed: skyes pa dang 'dra ba zhes bya ba ni skyes pa gang yin pa de'i ngo bo lta bu yin gyi sngon ma byung ba @137b ma yin te /
translated: “Like what has already arisen” means that it is like the nature of what has already arisen, not like what has not yet arisen.

original: dper na 'phags pa rnams kyis lam skyes pa gang yin pa ni phyir skyes par 'gyur ba yang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: dper na 'phags pa rnams kyis lam skyes pa gang yin pa ni phyir skyes par 'gyur ba yang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: For example, it is like the path of the noble ones: what has already arisen is what arises again.

original: sngon ma byung ba ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sngon ma byung ba ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: It is not like what has not yet arisen.

original: rtag tu rung ba ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa gang yin pa ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i gnas kyis bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag tu rung ba ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa gang yin pa ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i gnas kyis bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Not always possible” means that what is future is included within the inconceivable realm.

original: rkyen dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la ;
analyzed: rkyen dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la ;
translated: “Possessing conditions” means

original: /'bras bu da ltar byung ba na rkyen kha cig 'das par gyur pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: /'bras bu da ltar byung ba na rkyen kha cig 'das par gyur pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: that when a result is present, are not some of its conditions past?

original: 'bras bu mngon par grub pa na rkyen gyi dngos por gzhag pa'i phyir de'i tshe na rkyen dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu mngon par grub pa na rkyen gyi dngos por gzhag pa'i phyir de'i tshe na rkyen dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: When a result is actually established, it is posited as having the nature of conditions. At that time, it is said to possess conditions.

original: skyes pa dang 'dra ba dang zhes bya ba ni skyes pa kho na ste /
analyzed: skyes pa dang 'dra ba dang zhes bya ba ni skyes pa kho na ste /
translated: “Like what has already arisen” means that it is like what has already arisen.

original: dper na mkhas pa'i rang bzhin can zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na mkhas pa'i rang bzhin can zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like the one called “having the nature of a scholar.”

original: yang na skyes pa dang 'dra ba la bya'o //
analyzed: yang na skyes pa dang 'dra ba la bya'o //
translated: Or, it is like a man.

original: mi skye ba'i chos can zhes bya ba ni phyis skye bar mi 'gyur ba la bya'o //
analyzed: mi skye ba'i chos can zhes bya ba ni phyis skye bar mi 'gyur ba la bya'o //
translated: One who has the quality of not being born is one who will not be born later.

original: 'bras bu 'das pa zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu'i dngos po 'das pa la bya'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu 'das pa zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu'i dngos po 'das pa la bya'o //
translated: The result that has passed is the result that has passed into the state of being a result.

original: mi ltos pa'i gnas lta bu zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal la bya'o //
analyzed: mi ltos pa'i gnas lta bu zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal la bya'o //
translated: The state of not relying is like suffering.

original: bdag tu smra ba gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: bdag tu smra ba gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: What is the doctrine of self?

original: tshig re re la sgrub pa dang sun dbyung ba brjod ni mngas par 'gyur bas don gyi tshig rnams kho na mdor bsdus te brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: tshig re re la sgrub pa dang sun dbyung ba brjod ni mngas par 'gyur bas don gyi tshig rnams kho na mdor bsdus te brjod par bya'o //
translated: If the proofs and refutations of each word are stated, it would be too much, so the meaning of the words will be summarized and stated.

original: blo sngon du btang ba ma yin pas zhes bya ba ni gang dag gis kyang sngon ma brtags pa ste /
analyzed: blo sngon du btang ba ma yin pas zhes bya ba ni gang dag gis kyang sngon ma brtags pa ste /
translated: Not preceded by the mind means that which has not been examined by anyone.

original: de dag la yang sems can gyi blo 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag la yang sems can gyi blo 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the mind of a sentient being arises in them.

original: sems can gyi blo 'jug pa'i mi rigs so zhes bya ba ni gal te de dang 'brel pa'i bdag med par gyur na zhes bya bar bsam pa'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi blo 'jug pa'i mi rigs so zhes bya ba ni gal te de dang 'brel pa'i bdag med par gyur na zhes bya bar bsam pa'o //
translated: The meaning of the phrase “it is not reasonable for the mind to engage in that way” is that if the self were related to the aggregates in that way, it would be nonexistent.

original: ming dang ldan pa ming dang 'brel ba'i 'du byed mthong na 'du shes kyi blo kho na 'jug pa'i rigs kyi zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ming dang ldan pa ming dang 'brel ba'i 'du byed mthong na 'du shes kyi blo kho na 'jug pa'i rigs kyi zhes bya ba la /
translated: If one sees the aggregates that possess a name and are related to a name, it is reasonable that only the mind that perceives them would engage.

original: ji ltar na de la 'du shes dmigs par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na de la 'du shes dmigs par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does one perceive the name?

original: de'i 'bras bu mthong ba las 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu mthong ba las 'gyur te /
translated: One perceives it through seeing its result.🔽For example, it is like feeling that arises from seeing an object.

original: dper na dmigs pa dang mthong ba las tshor ba bzhin no /'di ltar de sangs rgyas byin zhes bos na 'ong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: dper na dmigs pa dang mthong ba las tshor ba bzhin no /'di ltar de sangs rgyas byin zhes bos na 'ong bar 'gyur te /
translated: When someone calls out to the Buddha, “Give me a gift!” he comes.

original: de'i phyir de'i ming yongs su chud pa'i 'du shes yod par mngon no //🔽bdag gi mig gis gzugs rnams mthong bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni blo gang yin pa de sngon du btang nas dpyod pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i ming yongs su chud pa'i 'du shes yod par mngon no // bdag gi mig gis gzugs rnams mthong bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni blo gang yin pa de sngon du btang nas dpyod pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is evident that the mind that perceives the name of the Buddha exists.🔽The mind that thinks, “I see forms with my eyes,” is preceded by the mind that thinks, “I will see forms with my eyes.”

original: mthong zin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mthong zin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: The mind that thinks, “I saw forms,” is preceded by the mind that thinks, “I will see forms.”

original: ji ltar da ltar bdag gis mthong zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: ji ltar da ltar bdag gis mthong zhes bya ba'am /
translated: “How could I see it now?”

original: sngon mthong zin no zhes bya ba de bzhin du mthong bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de yang blo sngon du btang ba yin no //🔽mngon par 'du byed pa las zhes bya ba yang blo de sngon du btang ba yin no //
analyzed: sngon mthong zin no zhes bya ba de bzhin du mthong bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de yang blo sngon du btang ba yin no // mngon par 'du byed pa las zhes bya ba yang blo de sngon du btang ba yin no //
translated: Just as one says, “I see it now,” or “I saw it before,” so too, one says, “I will see it.”🔽The idea of “from the formation of the action” also presupposes the idea of the self.

original: @138a * // las 'grub pa zhes bya ba ni spyod pa de yang blo sngon du btang ba yin no //
analyzed: @138a * // las 'grub pa zhes bya ba ni spyod pa de yang blo sngon du btang ba yin no //
translated: The idea of “the accomplishment of the action” also presupposes the idea of the self.

original: gal te gzhan la 'dod na ni des na dbyibs dang ldan pa la bdag ces byar mi rung ngo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gal te gzhan la 'dod na ni des na dbyibs dang ldan pa la bdag ces byar mi rung ngo zhes bya ba la /
translated: If you admit that the idea of the self is based on something else, then it is not tenable to say that the self is the possessor of shape.

original: 'di ltar pha rol po blo de ni gzhan pa yin no khas len la blo sngon du btang ba ma yin pas 'dzin pa'i phyir de dbyibs dang ldan pa de yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar pha rol po blo de ni gzhan pa yin no khas len la blo sngon du btang ba ma yin pas 'dzin pa'i phyir de dbyibs dang ldan pa de yang mi rung ste /
translated: Since the idea of the self is admitted to be based on something else, it is not tenable that the self is the possessor of shape, because the idea of the self is based on something else.

original: dbyibs dang ni gzugs las gzhan pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbyibs dang ni gzugs las gzhan pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because shape is not different from form.

original: gal te rang gi mtshan nyid las 'dod na ni des na gang mthong ba de nyid la blo phyin ci log tu gyur pa'i phyir bdag gi blo mi rung ngo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gal te rang gi mtshan nyid las 'dod na ni des na gang mthong ba de nyid la blo phyin ci log tu gyur pa'i phyir bdag gi blo mi rung ngo zhes bya ba la /
translated: If you accept that it is from its own intrinsic identity, then since the mind would be mistaken with respect to what is seen, the mind of self would be improper.

original: de nyid la zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: de nyid la zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa la'o //
translated: “With respect to that itself” means with respect to form, etc.

original: des na yul thams cad kyang yul thams cad kyi blo'i rgyur 'gyur bas mi rung ngo zhes bya ba ni mngon sum gyi rgyur 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: des na yul thams cad kyang yul thams cad kyi blo'i rgyur 'gyur bas mi rung ngo zhes bya ba ni mngon sum gyi rgyur 'gyur bas so //
translated: Therefore, since it would be the cause of the cognition of all objects, it would be improper. This means that it would be the cause of direct perception.

original: de las gzhan pa'i sems can bgrang ba la de las gzhan pa'i sems can du bgrang ba'i blo 'byung bar 'dod dam mi 'dod ces bya ba 'dis ci zhig brtsad ce na /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i sems can bgrang ba la de las gzhan pa'i sems can du bgrang ba'i blo 'byung bar 'dod dam mi 'dod ces bya ba 'dis ci zhig brtsad ce na /
translated: Do you accept or not that the cognition of a sentient being counted as other arises with respect to a sentient being counted as other? What is the point of this question?

original: sngar sems can gyi blor lhung ba ni don ji lta ba bzhin ma yin te /
analyzed: sngar sems can gyi blor lhung ba ni don ji lta ba bzhin ma yin te /
translated: The cognition of a sentient being that occurred previously is not in accordance with fact,

original: blo sngon du ma btang bar 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: blo sngon du ma btang bar 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it engages without the mind being directed beforehand.

original: de las gzhan pa kho na bzhin no zhes bya ba 'di la ma nges pa nyid kyang yod mod kyi tshig mngas par 'gyur bas mi brjod do zhes sngar yang smras pa yin no //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa kho na bzhin no zhes bya ba 'di la ma nges pa nyid kyang yod mod kyi tshig mngas par 'gyur bas mi brjod do zhes sngar yang smras pa yin no //
translated: Although there is no certainty in this, I have already said that I will not discuss it here because it would require too many words.

original: gal te mi 'byung na ni des na mngon sum gyi tshad ma la yang skur pa btab par gyur par mi rung ngo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gal te mi 'byung na ni des na mngon sum gyi tshad ma la yang skur pa btab par gyur par mi rung ngo zhes bya ba la /
translated: If it does not arise, then it is not suitable to repudiate even the valid cognition of direct perception.

original: mngon sum ni nor pa nyid yin yang rang rig pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum ni nor pa nyid yin yang rang rig pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Direct perception is mistaken, but it is reflexive awareness.

original: gal te blo'i rgyu las byung na ni bdag gi spyod pa zhes bya bar mi rung ngo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gal te blo'i rgyu las byung na ni bdag gi spyod pa zhes bya bar mi rung ngo zhes bya ba la /
translated: If it arises from the cause of the mind, then it is not suitable to say “my activity.”

original: blo'i rgyu las byung ba zhes bya ba ni bdag gi rgyu las byung ba zhes bya bar brjod par bya'o zhes bsams pa'o //
analyzed: blo'i rgyu las byung ba zhes bya ba ni bdag gi rgyu las byung ba zhes bya bar brjod par bya'o zhes bsams pa'o //
translated: “Arising from the cause of the mind” should be expressed as “arising from the cause of the self.”

original: gal te mi rtag na ni 'gyur ba yod pas bdag gi spyod pa zhes byar mi rung ngo zhes bya ba ni bdag rtag par mi rung ste gsal ba bzhin no //
analyzed: gal te mi rtag na ni 'gyur ba yod pas bdag gi spyod pa zhes byar mi rung ngo zhes bya ba ni bdag rtag par mi rung ste gsal ba bzhin no //
translated: If it is impermanent, then it is not suitable to say “my activity” because it would have change, just like a manifestation.

original: gal te rtsol ba'i bdag nyid can zhig yin na ni des na rtag tu spyod pa dang ldan pas yang spyod do zhes byar mi rung ngo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gal te rtsol ba'i bdag nyid can zhig yin na ni des na rtag tu spyod pa dang ldan pas yang spyod do zhes byar mi rung ngo zhes bya ba la /
translated: If it has the nature of exertion, then it is always associated with activity, and it is not tenable to say that it acts again.

original: rtag tu spyod pa dang ldan pa nyid ni rung ngo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rtag tu spyod pa dang ldan pa nyid ni rung ngo zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is not tenable that it is always associated with activity.

original: rtag tu spyod pa dang ldan pa nyid ni yang spyod bar mi byed do zhes khyed cag gis brtags so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rtag tu spyod pa dang ldan pa nyid ni yang spyod bar mi byed do zhes khyed cag gis brtags so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that you imagine that it does not act again because it is always associated with activity.

original: gal te mi rtsol ba'i bdag nyid can zhig yin na ni mi rtsol ba'i bdag nyid can spyod do zhes bya ba ni spyod pa ni rtsol bar rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te mi rtsol ba'i bdag nyid can zhig yin na ni mi rtsol ba'i bdag nyid can spyod do zhes bya ba ni spyod pa ni rtsol bar rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it has the nature of non-exertion, then it is not tenable to say that it acts without exertion, because activity is understood as exertion.🔽If there is a cause, then it would be another agent that makes sentient beings act, and that is not tenable.

original: gal te rgyu yod na ni sems can gyi spyod pa la byed du 'jug pa gzhan zhig na yod par 'gyur bas @138b mi rung ngo zhes bya bas ni thug pa med par 'gyur ba'i skyon smras so //
analyzed: gal te rgyu yod na ni sems can gyi spyod pa la byed du 'jug pa gzhan zhig na yod par 'gyur bas @138b mi rung ngo zhes bya bas ni thug pa med par 'gyur ba'i skyon smras so //
translated: This is the fault of infinite regress that is stated.

original: gal te rang dbang yod na ni bdag nyid na ba dang rga ba dang 'chi ba dang sdug bsngal ba dang kun nas nyon mongs pa spyod pa'i mi rigs so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gal te rang dbang yod na ni bdag nyid na ba dang rga ba dang 'chi ba dang sdug bsngal ba dang kun nas nyon mongs pa spyod pa'i mi rigs so zhes bya ba la /
translated: If it were independent, it would not be reasonable for it to engage in sickness, aging, death, suffering, and affliction.

original: rang dbang zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang bcas pa yang spyod par byed pa na rgyu la dbang byed pa'i phyir dang dbang zhes bya ba yang brtsams so //
analyzed: rang dbang zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang bcas pa yang spyod par byed pa na rgyu la dbang byed pa'i phyir dang dbang zhes bya ba yang brtsams so //
translated: “Independent” means that it engages in activity even though it has a cause, because it controls the cause.

original: gal te gzhan gyi dbang gis spyod na ni bdag spyod do zhes byar mi rung ngo zhes bya ba ni des na spyod do zhes bya bar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gal te gzhan gyi dbang gis spyod na ni bdag spyod do zhes byar mi rung ngo zhes bya ba ni des na spyod do zhes bya bar mi rung ngo //
translated: “It is not reasonable to say that the self engages in activity if it does so under the influence of another,” because it is not reasonable to say that it engages in activity through the influence of another.

original: kha cig na re spyod pa bdag la ni gzhan rgyu dang rkyen de dag kho na'i spyod pa yod do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig na re spyod pa bdag la ni gzhan rgyu dang rkyen de dag kho na'i spyod pa yod do zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say that the self does not engage in activity, but the activity of those causes and conditions exists.

original: yang kha cig na re dbang zhes bya ba ni bdag gi sgra'i rnam grangs yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yang kha cig na re dbang zhes bya ba ni bdag gi sgra'i rnam grangs yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Some say that “independent” is a synonym for “self,” because

original: bden smra'i bu'i mdo las kyang mer 'jug gi bu khyod gzugs bdag yin no zhes smra'am /
analyzed: bden smra'i bu'i mdo las kyang mer 'jug gi bu khyod gzugs bdag yin no zhes smra'am /
translated: Son of Mṛgāra, do you say that form is the self?

original: tshor ba dang / rnam par shes pa'i bar dag yin no zhes smra'am /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / rnam par shes pa'i bar dag yin no zhes smra'am /
translated: Do you say that it is feeling, and so on up to: consciousness?

original: khyod gzugs la 'di ni bdag gi gzugs te 'di ltar ni gyur cig /'di ltar ni ma gyur cig ces bya ba'i dbang yod dam /🔽rnam par shes pa'i bar la yang 'di ni bdag gi rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: khyod gzugs la 'di ni bdag gi gzugs te 'di ltar ni gyur cig /'di ltar ni ma gyur cig ces bya ba'i dbang yod dam / rnam par shes pa'i bar la yang 'di ni bdag gi rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: Do you have the power to say of form, “My form should be like this, it should not be like that”?

original: 'di ltar ni gyur cig 'di ltar ni ma gyur cig ces bya ba'i dbang yod dam zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar ni gyur cig 'di ltar ni ma gyur cig ces bya ba'i dbang yod dam zhes gsungs so //
translated: Do you have the power to say of consciousness, “My consciousness should be like this, it should not be like that”?

original: de bzhin du dge slong gi mdo la sogs pa dag las kyang de skad gsungs so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du dge slong gi mdo la sogs pa dag las kyang de skad gsungs so zhes zer ro //
translated: So too, the Bhikṣu Sūtra and so on also say this.

original: gal te rtag na ni mi rtag pa la bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi phan pa dang gnod par 'gyur ba'i mi rigs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i skabs kyis ni thams cad ltar gyur na yang nye bar gnas par ston par byed do //🔽gal te mi rtag na ni 'du byed rnams las logs shig na 'jig pa dang skye ba dang rgyun dang 'jug pa yang mi dmigs pas mi rung la zhes bya ba ni phung po rnams las logs shig na 'jig pa dang skye ba dang ldan pa la sogs
analyzed: gal te rtag na ni mi rtag pa la bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi phan pa dang gnod par 'gyur ba'i mi rigs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i skabs kyis ni thams cad ltar gyur na yang nye bar gnas par ston par byed do // gal te mi rtag na ni 'du byed rnams las logs shig na 'jig pa dang skye ba dang rgyun dang 'jug pa yang mi dmigs pas mi rung la zhes bya ba ni phung po rnams las logs shig na 'jig pa dang skye ba dang ldan pa la sogs
translated: If it is permanent, then it is not tenable that the impermanent is benefited or harmed by pleasure and pain, and so on.🔽If it is impermanent, then since destruction, arising, continuity, and engagement are not observed apart from formations, it is not tenable.

original: pa med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: pa med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that destruction, arising, and so on do not exist apart from the aggregates.🔽Here it is also untenable to say that destruction is not made into something else because the error of obtaining it would arise.

original: 'dir zhig par gyur pa gzhan du ma byas par thob pa'i skyon du yang 'gyur bas mi rung ngo zhes bya ba ni pha rol gyi byed pa po ni gcig tu zad la /
analyzed: 'dir zhig par gyur pa gzhan du ma byas par thob pa'i skyon du yang 'gyur bas mi rung ngo zhes bya ba ni pha rol gyi byed pa po ni gcig tu zad la /
translated: The agent of the other is exhausted in one.

original: de ni 'di nyid du zhigs te rtag pa'i phyir gzhan gyi dbang du gyur pa yin pas byed pa po ma yin pas zos pa'i phyir ma byas pa dang phrad pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni 'di nyid du zhigs te rtag pa'i phyir gzhan gyi dbang du gyur pa yin pas byed pa po ma yin pas zos pa'i phyir ma byas pa dang phrad pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: Since it would be destroyed here and now, it would be permanent and dependent on another, and so it would not be an agent. Therefore, the error would arise that one would enjoy the fruits of actions that one did not perform.
