original: gang rgyun la byed pa po la sogs par tha snyad 'dogs pa de la ni nyes pa med do //🔽phung po rnams dang tha dad pa zhes bya ba ni phung po dang ma 'dres pa nyid du logs shig na gnas shing phung po @139a * //
analyzed: gang rgyun la byed pa po la sogs par tha snyad 'dogs pa de la ni nyes pa med do // phung po rnams dang tha dad pa zhes bya ba ni phung po dang ma 'dres pa nyid du logs shig na gnas shing phung po @139a * //
translated: But there is no error in the convention that a continuum is an agent, etc.

original: rnams la nye bar spyod pa'o //
analyzed: rnams la nye bar spyod pa'o //
translated: “Distinct from the aggregates” means that it would exist separately, not mixed with the aggregates, and it would enjoy the aggregates.

original: sems can 'dus ma byas su 'dod pa kho na ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: sems can 'dus ma byas su 'dod pa kho na ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Isn’t it just asserted that sentient beings are uncompounded?

original: 'dus byas kyi bya ba dang byed pa dang / nye bar spyod pa la sogs pa mi byed pas na de la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi bya ba dang byed pa dang / nye bar spyod pa la sogs pa mi byed pas na de la nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no error in that, because it does not perform the functions of compounded phenomena, such as being an agent, etc.

original: gal te phung po med pa zhig yin na ni zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gal te phung po med pa zhig yin na ni zhes bya ba la /
translated: If it were without the aggregates, etc.

original: phung po med pa zhes bya ba ni nye bar spyad par bya ba'i phung po med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phung po med pa zhes bya ba ni nye bar spyad par bya ba'i phung po med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase “there is no personality” means that there is no personality that is the basis of the experience of the aggregates.

original: des na rtag tu kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin la lus dang 'brel ba med pas bdag ces byar mi rung ngo zhes bya ba ni lus dang 'brel ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na rtag tu kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin la lus dang 'brel ba med pas bdag ces byar mi rung ngo zhes bya ba ni lus dang 'brel ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, since it is not always and everywhere defiled, and since it is not related to the body, it is not suitable to be the self.

original: gal te lta ba la sogs pa la bdag na ni des na lta ba la sogs pa 'di lta ba por 'gyur gyi bdag gi lta ba la sogs pa dang bye brag med pas lta ba por mi rung ngo zhes bya ba ni lta ba po gcig kho
analyzed: gal te lta ba la sogs pa la bdag na ni des na lta ba la sogs pa 'di lta ba por 'gyur gyi bdag gi lta ba la sogs pa dang bye brag med pas lta ba por mi rung ngo zhes bya ba ni lta ba po gcig kho
translated: If the self were seeing, etc., then seeing, etc., would be the self, and the self would not be different from seeing, etc.

original: nar zad na gnyis pas ci zhig byar yod ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: nar zad na gnyis pas ci zhig byar yod ces bya ba'o //
translated: If there were only one seer, what would be the use of a second?

original: gal te las yin na ni de yang sa bon dang 'dra bas des ni rtag par 'gyur ba ste mi rung ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i dpe bzhi po rnams ni skyed pa dang / 'gyur ba dang / gzhi dang / sgrib pa med pa'i bye brag gi phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te las yin na ni de yang sa bon dang 'dra bas des ni rtag par 'gyur ba ste mi rung ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i dpe bzhi po rnams ni skyed pa dang / 'gyur ba dang / gzhi dang / sgrib pa med pa'i bye brag gi phyir ro //
translated: The four examples are in terms of the distinctions of generation, transformation, basis, and nonobstruction.

original: la la ni skyed par byed pa dang / la la ni skyed par mi byed kyi bskyed par 'gyur bar byed pa dang / gcig ni gnyis ka yang mi byed mod kyi skye ba dang 'gyur ba ni phyir 'jil zhing 'dzin pa la sogs pa cung zad byed pa dang /
analyzed: la la ni skyed par byed pa dang / la la ni skyed par mi byed kyi bskyed par 'gyur bar byed pa dang / gcig ni gnyis ka yang mi byed mod kyi skye ba dang 'gyur ba ni phyir 'jil zhing 'dzin pa la sogs pa cung zad byed pa dang /
translated: Some generate, some do not generate but cause generation, one does not do either, but it slightly functions to hold and so on, and

original: gcig ni gsum char yang mi byed mod kyi bgegs mi byed pa nyid du gnas pa ste /
analyzed: gcig ni gsum char yang mi byed mod kyi bgegs mi byed pa nyid du gnas pa ste /
translated: one does not do the three, but it abides as nonobstruction.

original: rnam pa de tsam du zad pas na de'i phyir rnam pa bzhi smos so //
analyzed: rnam pa de tsam du zad pas na de'i phyir rnam pa bzhi smos so //
translated: Since it is just that much, therefore four types are mentioned.

original: gal te byed pa yin na ni des ni gal te zor ba la sogs pa dang 'dra na des na ji ltar zor ba la sogs pas gzhan gcod pa la sogs pa'i bya ba byed pa de bzhin du lta ba la sogs pa las lta ba la sogs🔽pa tha dad pa gzhan mi dmigs pas mi rung ngo zhes bya ba ni ji ltar gcad pa'i bya ba ni zor ba las gzhan te las la gnas par dmigs pa ltar lta ba zhes bya ba la ni de lta bu med de /
analyzed: gal te byed pa yin na ni des ni gal te zor ba la sogs pa dang 'dra na des na ji ltar zor ba la sogs pas gzhan gcod pa la sogs pa'i bya ba byed pa de bzhin du lta ba la sogs pa las lta ba la sogs pa tha dad pa gzhan mi dmigs pas mi rung ngo zhes bya ba ni ji ltar gcad pa'i bya ba ni zor ba las gzhan te las la gnas par dmigs pa ltar lta ba zhes bya ba la ni de lta bu med de /
translated: If it is an agent, then if it is like a sword, then just as a sword performs the action of cutting something else, so too, seeing and so on would be observed to be different from seeing and so on.🔽But that is not tenable, because

original: de nyid bya ba'i ngo bo nyid kho na yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid bya ba'i ngo bo nyid kho na yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the action of cutting is observed to be different from the sword, and to be based on the object. But that is not so for seeing and so on, because they are by nature action itself.

original: de bzhin du de nyid byed pa po'i ngo bo nyid du'ang 'gyur bas na de ni mi 'dra'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du de nyid byed pa po'i ngo bo nyid du'ang 'gyur bas na de ni mi 'dra'o //
translated: And because it would also be the nature of the agent, that is not similar.

original: gal te me lta bu zhig yin na ni des na bdag tu rtog pa don med par 'gyur bas mi rung ste /
analyzed: gal te me lta bu zhig yin na ni des na bdag tu rtog pa don med par 'gyur bas mi rung ste /
translated: If it is like fire, then it is untenable that the conception of the self is purposeless.

original: 'di ltar me ni sreg pa po med par yang bdag nyid kyis sreg par byed do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'di ltar me ni sreg pa po med par yang bdag nyid kyis sreg par byed do zhes bya ba la /
translated: In this regard, it is said that fire burns without a burner.

original: zor ba dang me'i dpe gnyis kyis ni bye brag ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: zor ba dang me'i dpe gnyis kyis ni bye brag ni 'di yin te /
translated: The two examples of the saw and fire show the difference.

original: gcig ni bya ba rnams la yang dang yang byed pa na byed pa po la ltos pa yin la cig shos ni de lta ma yin no //🔽gal te lta ba po la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid las gzhan zhig yin na ni des na tshad ma @139b thams cad med pa'i mtshan nyid la bdag ces byar mi rung ngo zhes bya ba la tshad ma thams cad med pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni 'bras
analyzed: gcig ni bya ba rnams la yang dang yang byed pa na byed pa po la ltos pa yin la cig shos ni de lta ma yin no // gal te lta ba po la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid las gzhan zhig yin na ni des na tshad ma @139b thams cad med pa'i mtshan nyid la bdag ces byar mi rung ngo zhes bya ba la tshad ma thams cad med pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni 'bras
translated: One, in the performance of actions, is dependent on the agent, the other is not.🔽If it is different from the characteristics of the seer and so on, then it is not tenable to call it the self, which has the characteristic of the absence of all valid cognitions.

original: bu las rjes su dpag pa nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bu las rjes su dpag pa nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The absence of all valid cognitions means the absence of inference from effect to cause.

original: de la 'di skad ces kyang brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de la 'di skad ces kyang brjod par bya ste /
translated: Here, this should be said:

original: ci gang 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa de 'jug kyang 'jug la ldog kyang ldog par 'gyur ram ;
analyzed: ci gang 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa de 'jug kyang 'jug la ldog kyang ldog par 'gyur ram ;
translated: Is that which possesses the characteristic of engagement engaged in engagement and disengaged in disengagement?

original: 'on te de'i mtshan nyid dang mi ldan pa de ltar 'gyur bar 'dod na zhes bya ba la ci'i phyir ldog pa'i mtshan nyid ces ma smos she na /
analyzed: 'on te de'i mtshan nyid dang mi ldan pa de ltar 'gyur bar 'dod na zhes bya ba la ci'i phyir ldog pa'i mtshan nyid ces ma smos she na /
translated: then why is the term “non-reversal” not mentioned?

original: kha cig na re 'jug pa las nyams pa nyid ldog pa kho na yin par smras pa bzhin no zhes zer ro //🔽yang kha cig ldog kyang ldog par 'gyur ram zhes bya ba'i tshig tha mar /
analyzed: kha cig na re 'jug pa las nyams pa nyid ldog pa kho na yin par smras pa bzhin no zhes zer ro // yang kha cig ldog kyang ldog par 'gyur ram zhes bya ba'i tshig tha mar /
translated: Some say: It is just as it is said that one who has degenerated from entering the ārya path is a non-entrant.

original: bstan pas na thams cad du 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: bstan pas na thams cad du 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
translated: Again, some say: Since the term “even though one has reversed” is mentioned at the end, it is reversed in all cases.

original: gal te gang mtshan nyid dang ldan pa de de ltar 'gyur na ni des na 'du byed la 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid rnam pa lnga dmigs te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gal te gang mtshan nyid dang ldan pa de de ltar 'gyur na ni des na 'du byed la 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid rnam pa lnga dmigs te zhes bya ba la /
translated: If it is the one who possesses the characteristics of an ārya who is so described, then the five aspects of the characteristics of entering compositional activity are observed.

original: 'di ltar pha rol la ni 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid rnam pa de lta bu ma grub mod kyi 'on kyang sgrub pas gdags par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar pha rol la ni 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid rnam pa de lta bu ma grub mod kyi 'on kyang sgrub pas gdags par bya ste /
translated: Thus, although the characteristics of entering the ārya path are not established in others, they are imputed through proof.

original: phung po las ma gtogs pa'i 'jug par byed pa med kyang 'du byed la la dag 'jug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: phung po las ma gtogs pa'i 'jug par byed pa med kyang 'du byed la la dag 'jug par 'gyur te /
translated: Although there is no instigator apart from the aggregates, some formations do occur.

original: 'di ltar rgyu dang ldan pa'i phyir ba dang / 'gyur ba zhes bya ba'i bar gyi phyir te /
analyzed: 'di ltar rgyu dang ldan pa'i phyir ba dang / 'gyur ba zhes bya ba'i bar gyi phyir te /
translated: Because they are caused, and because they are impermanent, etc.

original: lus dang myu gu la sogs pa grags pa rnams ni mthun pa'i dpe yin no //
analyzed: lus dang myu gu la sogs pa grags pa rnams ni mthun pa'i dpe yin no //
translated: The body, the sprout, etc., are the examples that are similar to the thesis.

original: chos mi mthun pa'i bong bu'i rva'am /
analyzed: chos mi mthun pa'i bong bu'i rva'am /
translated: The donkey’s horn is the dissimilar example.

original: 'jug pa'i las gzhan pa'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i las gzhan pa'o //
translated: The instigator is something other than the activity.

original: de yang 'di lta ste 'du byed lus dang / myu gu dang / chu klung dang / mar me dang / bya ba dang / bzhon pa'i rgyun rnams la dmigs te /
analyzed: de yang 'di lta ste 'du byed lus dang / myu gu dang / chu klung dang / mar me dang / bya ba dang / bzhon pa'i rgyun rnams la dmigs te /
translated: The body, the sprout, the river, the flame, the action, and the continuum of the vehicle are the examples.

original: des na bdag med par yang byed pa rnams nyid 'jug cing ldog pa'i phyir mi rung ngo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: des na bdag med par yang byed pa rnams nyid 'jug cing ldog pa'i phyir mi rung ngo zhes bya ba la /
translated: Therefore, it is not correct to say that activity occurs and ceases in the absence of a self.

original: kha cig na re lus la sogs pa dpe mang po dag smos pa ni 'jug par byed pa ni bya ba'i de tsam du zad pas na de'i phyir drug kho na smos so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig na re lus la sogs pa dpe mang po dag smos pa ni 'jug par byed pa ni bya ba'i de tsam du zad pas na de'i phyir drug kho na smos so zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say that the many examples such as the body are mentioned because the instigator is merely the activity. Therefore, only six are mentioned.

original: yang kha cig na re 'di ltar bdag gi blos ni dpe thams cad la yang rgyu dang ldan pa la sogs pa thams cad yod mod kyi gzhan dag las gang du cung zad grags pa rnams smos te ;🔽'di ltar 'ug pa pa dag mar me ni gzhan dang gzhan du 'jug par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: yang kha cig na re 'di ltar bdag gi blos ni dpe thams cad la yang rgyu dang ldan pa la sogs pa thams cad yod mod kyi gzhan dag las gang du cung zad grags pa rnams smos te ; 'di ltar 'ug pa pa dag mar me ni gzhan dang gzhan du 'jug par 'gyur gyi /
translated: Some say: The mind of the self has all the causes and so on, but I will mention those that are known to others.🔽Thus the owl school says: A lamp moves from one place to another, but the body is not like that.

original: lus ni de lta bu yin no zhes brjod pas na de'i phyir dpe mang du smos so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: lus ni de lta bu yin no zhes brjod pas na de'i phyir dpe mang du smos so zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore many examples are mentioned.

original: gal te lus ni dpe yin na bsgrub pa gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te lus ni dpe yin na bsgrub pa gang yin zhe na /
translated: If the body is an example, what is the thesis?

original: ming ni bsgrubs pa'o //
analyzed: ming ni bsgrubs pa'o //
translated: The thesis is name.

original: gzugs ni dpe'o //🔽yang na ji @140a * //
analyzed: gzugs ni dpe'o // yang na ji @140a * //
translated: Form is the example.

original: ltar log par rtog pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ltar log par rtog pa bzhin no //
translated: Or else, it is like the misconception.

original: de la 'di skad ces kyang brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de la 'di skad ces kyang brjod par bya ste /
translated: In this regard, this should be said:

original: ci yul gyis skyes pa dang / sdug bsngal bas 'gyur ba gang yin pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gsum na zab po zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gsum dang go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //🔽gal te bdag nyid la 'dogs na ni me sreg par byed do //
analyzed: ci yul gyis skyes pa dang / sdug bsngal bas 'gyur ba gang yin pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gsum na zab po zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gsum dang go rims bzhin du sbyar ro // gal te bdag nyid la 'dogs na ni me sreg par byed do //
translated: The three phrases what is produced by the object, what is produced by suffering, and so on, are to be applied respectively to the three phrases the profound, and so on.

original: 'od snang bar byed do zhes byar mi rung ngo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'od snang bar byed do zhes byar mi rung ngo zhes bya ba la /
translated: If it is designated in terms of itself, it is not tenable to say fire is that which burns and light is that which illuminates.

original: me ni g-yo ba med pa yin yang sreg pa'i rkyen gyi byed pa po yin no //
analyzed: me ni g-yo ba med pa yin yang sreg pa'i rkyen gyi byed pa po yin no //
translated: Fire, although it does not move, is the agent in the condition of burning.

original: gal te bdag nyid la 'dogs na ni zhes bya ba ni bdag gi sgrar sbyor ba la bya'o //
analyzed: gal te bdag nyid la 'dogs na ni zhes bya ba ni bdag gi sgrar sbyor ba la bya'o //
translated: If it is designated in terms of itself, means that the word self is applied.

original: des na tha snyad du gdags pa'i mi lus la yon tan bshes gnyen dang / sangs rgyas byin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gdags su mi rung ngo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: des na tha snyad du gdags pa'i mi lus la yon tan bshes gnyen dang / sangs rgyas byin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gdags su mi rung ngo zhes bya ba la /
translated: Therefore, it is not tenable to designate the human body as the one who conventionally designates, the one who has good qualities, the spiritual friend, the one who is blessed by the Buddha, and so on.

original: ji ltar na 'di bdag yin no zhes 'dogs par byed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'di bdag yin no zhes 'dogs par byed ce na /
translated: How is it designated as this is the self?

original: ngar 'dzin pa dang gzhi gcig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngar 'dzin pa dang gzhi gcig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the basis of the conception of I.

original: gal te gzhan la 'dogs na ni des na 'du byed tsam la bdag tu 'dogs par zad de /
analyzed: gal te gzhan la 'dogs na ni des na 'du byed tsam la bdag tu 'dogs par zad de /
translated: If it is imputed to another, then it is only imputed to mere conditioning.

original: bdag tu rtog pa don med par 'gyur bas mi rung ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bdag tu rtog pa don med par 'gyur bas mi rung ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is not suitable because the conception of self would be pointless.

original: gzhan la zhes bya ba ni lha'i bshes gnyen la sogs pa dag la'o //
analyzed: gzhan la zhes bya ba ni lha'i bshes gnyen la sogs pa dag la'o //
translated: “To another” means to the friend of the gods and so on.

original: nyes pa gso bar byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni de nga rgyal la sogs pa'i rtsa ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyes pa gso bar byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni de nga rgyal la sogs pa'i rtsa ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the root of pride and so on.

original: gal te mi dge ba yin na des thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gal te mi dge ba yin na des thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: If it is nonvirtuous, then it is taught by the Omniscient One, and so on.

original: thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs pa zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyi thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sgrub pa'i rjes su dpag pa yid la gzhag nas smras pa yin te /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs pa zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyi thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sgrub pa'i rjes su dpag pa yid la gzhag nas smras pa yin te /
translated: “Taught by the Omniscient One” means that, having set forth an inference that establishes the Bhagavān as omniscient, it is said.

original: 'dir tshig gi don ni 'di yin no //
analyzed: 'dir tshig gi don ni 'di yin no //
translated: The meaning of the words here is this.

original: bdag med par lta ba ni mi dge ba ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag med par lta ba ni mi dge ba ma yin te /
translated: The view of selflessness is not nonvirtuous.

original: thams cad mkhyen pas dge ba yin par thugs su chud nas bstan pa'i phyir te byams pa yin no //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pas dge ba yin par thugs su chud nas bstan pa'i phyir te byams pa yin no //
translated: The Buddha, who is omniscient, has understood and taught that it is good, and so it is lovingkindness.

original: chos mi mthun pa ni khro ba'o //
analyzed: chos mi mthun pa ni khro ba'o //
translated: The opposite of that is anger.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'phags pa zla ba sgron ma'i mdo las /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'phags pa zla ba sgron ma'i mdo las /
translated: The Blessed One said in the Candrapradīpa Sūtra:

original: gzhon nu nga ni thams cad mkhyen cing thams cad gzigs pa yin no zhes gsungs pa las kyang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yod par rjes su dpag tu rung ste /
analyzed: gzhon nu nga ni thams cad mkhyen cing thams cad gzigs pa yin no zhes gsungs pa las kyang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yod par rjes su dpag tu rung ste /
translated: “Young man, I am omniscient and see all things.”

original: tshig de yang don ji lta ba kho na bzhin te /
analyzed: tshig de yang don ji lta ba kho na bzhin te /
translated: This statement is just as it is,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ldem por dgongs te gsungs pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ldem por dgongs te gsungs pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: because the Blessed One did not speak with an ulterior implication.

original: / ma gsod par mngon par zhen pa ni sems can dmyal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tshig bzhin te /
analyzed: / ma gsod par mngon par zhen pa ni sems can dmyal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tshig bzhin te /
translated: It is like the statement, “One who is attached to the idea that one should kill one’s mother will go to hell.”

original: chos mi mthun pa ni de nyid thar bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: chos mi mthun pa ni de nyid thar bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: The opposite of that is, “One who is attached to the idea that one should liberate one’s mother will go to heaven.”

original: ji ltar ldem por dgongs pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar ldem por dgongs pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that this statement is not an ulterior implication?

original: mdo gzhan dag las kyang bshad pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mdo gzhan dag las kyang bshad pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is explained in other sūtras.

original: de las gzhan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa bzhin no //
translated: like any other.

original: nyes pa rnams kyi gnyen por 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni @140b bdag la chags pa dam por 'dzin pa'i lam 'gog par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽gal te bdag kho na'o snyam du sems na ni de na nams kyang bdag med do snyam pa'i blo 'byung bar mi 'gyur bas mi rung ngo zhes bya ba ni bdag mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyes pa rnams kyi gnyen por 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni @140b bdag la chags pa dam por 'dzin pa'i lam 'gog par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro // gal te bdag kho na'o snyam du sems na ni de na nams kyang bdag med do snyam pa'i blo 'byung bar mi 'gyur bas mi rung ngo zhes bya ba ni bdag mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the antidote to the faults, because it stops the path of grasping the self as dear.🔽If one thinks, “It is just the self,” then the thought, “There is no self at all,” will never arise.

original: gal te bdag tu lta ba yin na ni bdag med bzhin du 'du byed tsam la bdag tu lta ba'i dbang gis bdag yod do snyam du sems na mi rung ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gal te bdag tu lta ba yin na ni bdag med bzhin du 'du byed tsam la bdag tu lta ba'i dbang gis bdag yod do snyam du sems na mi rung ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: If it is the view of the self, then it is not right to think, “The self exists,” by the power of the view of the self with regard to mere conditioning, as if there were no self.

original: bdag tu lta ba'i dbang gis zhes bya ba ni de ltar goms pa'i phyir de la mngon par zhen pa yin te /
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba'i dbang gis zhes bya ba ni de ltar goms pa'i phyir de la mngon par zhen pa yin te /
translated: By the power of the view of the self means by the power of the view of the self, because of being accustomed to it in that way, one is attached to it.

original: rang gi rkyen gyi rnam pas bsgrub par khas len par zad kyi don yod pa dang med pa las ni ma yin no zhes bya bar ston to //
analyzed: rang gi rkyen gyi rnam pas bsgrub par khas len par zad kyi don yod pa dang med pa las ni ma yin no zhes bya bar ston to //
translated: One is merely accepting the establishment of its conditions, not from the existence or nonexistence of the object.

original: chos rnams la bdag 'dogs pa rdzas su yod par 'gyur du 'ong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: chos rnams la bdag 'dogs pa rdzas su yod par 'gyur du 'ong ba'i phyir /
translated: because it would follow that the self would be substantially real in relation to phenomena.

original: de dag las tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin par brjod par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de dag las tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin par brjod par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Therefore, it should not be said that it is either different or not different from them.

original: de la nyes pa ci yod ce na /
analyzed: de la nyes pa ci yod ce na /
translated: What is wrong with that?

original: tshogs dang rgyud dag la de nye bar 'dogs pa'i phyir ba dang / de dag kyang 'du byed rnams dang tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin par mi bya ba'i phyir ro //🔽de yang mi rtag pa'i mtshan nyid dang / mi brtan pa'i mtshan nyid dang / yid brtan du mi rung ba'i mtshan nyid dang / rnam par 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba'i tshig bzhi ni skye ba'i mtshan nyid dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang /
analyzed: tshogs dang rgyud dag la de nye bar 'dogs pa'i phyir ba dang / de dag kyang 'du byed rnams dang tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin par mi bya ba'i phyir ro // de yang mi rtag pa'i mtshan nyid dang / mi brtan pa'i mtshan nyid dang / yid brtan du mi rung ba'i mtshan nyid dang / rnam par 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba'i tshig bzhi ni skye ba'i mtshan nyid dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang /
translated: Because it is imputed in relation to the collections and the continuum, and because those are not to be said to be either different or not different from the formations.🔽The four terms “impermanent,” “unstable,” “not a lasting support,” and “subject to change” correspond respectively to the four terms “arising,” “aging,” “enduring,” and “perishing.”

original: 'chi ba'i chos kyi mtshan nyid ces bya ba'i tshig bzhis go rims bzhin du bshad do //
analyzed: 'chi ba'i chos kyi mtshan nyid ces bya ba'i tshig bzhis go rims bzhin du bshad do //
translated: The four terms “subject to birth,” “subject to old age,” “subject to sickness,” and “subject to death” correspond respectively to the four terms “arising,” “aging,” “enduring,” and “perishing.”

original: chos tsam gyi mtshan nyid dang / sdug bsngal tsam gyi mtshan nyid yin zhes bya ba'i tshig lhag ma gnyis ni byed pa med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / spang bar bya ba'i mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: chos tsam gyi mtshan nyid dang / sdug bsngal tsam gyi mtshan nyid yin zhes bya ba'i tshig lhag ma gnyis ni byed pa med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / spang bar bya ba'i mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: The two remaining phrases, “the characteristic of mere phenomena” and “the characteristic of mere suffering,” refer to the characteristic of being devoid of an agent and the characteristic of being an object to be abandoned.

original: yang kha cig tu na sdug bsngal rnam pa bdun las brtsams pa yin te /
analyzed: yang kha cig tu na sdug bsngal rnam pa bdun las brtsams pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, in some places, the seven aspects of suffering are discussed.

original: rgyun gyis 'jig pa las byung ba dang / skad cig gis 'jig pa las byung ba dang / glo bur las byung ba dang / bde ba nyams pa las byung ba dang / rang gi ngang gis byung ba dang / rang dbang med pa las byung ba dang /
analyzed: rgyun gyis 'jig pa las byung ba dang / skad cig gis 'jig pa las byung ba dang / glo bur las byung ba dang / bde ba nyams pa las byung ba dang / rang gi ngang gis byung ba dang / rang dbang med pa las byung ba dang /
translated: The seven aspects of suffering are suffering that arises from the destruction of continuity, suffering that arises from the destruction of the momentariness, suffering that arises from the unexpected, suffering that arises from the loss of pleasure, suffering that arises from its very nature, suffering that arises from the absence of independence, and suffering that arises from the very nature of suffering.

original: rang bzhin gyi sdug bsngal las byung ba'i sdug bsngal rnam pa bdun las brtsams te bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi sdug bsngal las byung ba'i sdug bsngal rnam pa bdun las brtsams te bstan pa yin no //
translated: The seven aspects of suffering are taught in the sūtras, beginning with the following:

original: de la rang gi ngang gis 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni skye ba la sogs pa'i bye brag gis tshig bzhi dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de la rang gi ngang gis 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni skye ba la sogs pa'i bye brag gis tshig bzhi dang sbyar ro //
translated: “Suffering that arises from its very nature” is to be connected with the four phrases, such as “arises from birth,” and so on.

original: yang gcig tu na pha rol bdag rtag pa la sogs par rtog pa de dgag pa'i phyir mtshan nyid brgyad rnam par gzhag pa yin no /
analyzed: yang gcig tu na pha rol bdag rtag pa la sogs par rtog pa de dgag pa'i phyir mtshan nyid brgyad rnam par gzhag pa yin no /
translated: notion that the other—the self—is permanent, etc.
